Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but watch the bar prices”
Reviews.Author: Bute
Reviews.Content: This is a well-placed hotel with excellent, friendly and helpful staff and a fabulous roof terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara to enjoy breakfast and to unwind late evening after a day's walking the hilly streets. Two complaints though: our room overlooked the front of the hotel and we were woken early every morning by the sound of shutters crashing up as the local shopkeepers arrived for business; and the cost of drinks put on our room bill, and shown only as numbers with no symbols, turned out to be priced in euros not lira as I assumed, i.e. more than three times what we thought we were paying.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: uppermordent
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Specially appreciated the transfers from and to the airport again. Outstanding breakfast. Nice decor, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few days over Easter, and had a great time. The service level is exceptional, there is a great breakfast buffet served on the rooftop each morning, there is a well-equipped gym, and you can walk to all the sights, We would highly recommend Hotel Niles to everyone going to Istanbul and make sure you ask the reception for advice, since they have very good recommendations for restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Energetic, attentive staff sets this hotel apart”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: At 72 Euros per night, we found Hotel Niles to be an exceptional value for our four-night stay in Istanbul. The staff was superb from the minute we got there and most helpful throughout our stay. The location is quite good, but a bit of a hike from Sultanahmet Square (15 minutes or so). Our rooms were modest, and we heard a bit of street noise as we were on the first floor. Nonetheless, we found our stay here to be excellent and would highly recommend it for young couples traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne A
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in the Hotel Niles in February. It is very centrally located and the staff is very friendly. The room was beautiful (unique, old Ottoman style) and perfect to accomodate a small child - and also extremely clean. The breakfast at the beautiful terrace buffet was great!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed in the middle of the night by the staff and shown our room.This is not always usual but this is Hotel Niles where the staff are always smartly dressed and ready to receive weary travellers. We spent several days exploring Istanbul. Kemal was very helpful and gave us a lot of local information concerning tramways and cruises etc. He also provided us with Turkish coffee on the house whilst explaining some traditional Turkish customs. It would be difficult not to be charmed by his friendly manner. Our room was small but very clean, food was plentiful and fresh. Breakfast on the roof terrace was very pleasant in the warm sunshine.The hotel is well situated to visit major sites, the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque are within walking distance.We had a an interesting time and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “hotel niles recommended”
Reviews.Author: jandyLeigh
Reviews.Content: just had 4 night stay here and would thoroughly recommend it. service superb but not over the top. rooms very small but perfectly adequate with fridge, table etc and immaculately clean but to be honest only sleep in the room as the roof top terrace is wonderful and open all the time. attention to detail is excellent and full of plants and flowers and can sit inside or out. breakfast is the best i have ever seen . a wonderful array of everything you could possibly wish for and staff so helpful. location is good, not the prettiest of areas but easy walking distance to everything and less than 5 mins from tram stop which makes airport trips so easy. less than an hour and only4 turkish lira each way. much better than minibus. stay here and enjoy istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles: A small Turkish palace”
Reviews.Author: ChrisAndKateHurrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days in Istanbul, having picked the Hotel Niles from the lastminute.com website. This hotel is a real gem. It is located a short walk from the major monuments and markets and the Beyazit tram stop. The staff were really friendly, helpful and eager to make our stay as pleasant as possible, even down to welcome and farewell tea in reception. A faulty hair-dryer was fixed within minutes. We had a junior suite on the first floor and it was cleaner and better furnished than most upmarket chain hotels we've stayed in. There was even a fridge and microwave, as well as kettle etc. The rooftop bar, where we had evening drinks and breakfast, has a good view of the Sea of Marmara - and of the tailors working in the buildings across the street. All in all, a marvelous short break in a most interesting city, made even better by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A long weekend at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 414Mike
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul was made even better by the choice of Hotel Niles. The Hotel is excellent, from the moment we arrived the staff were attentive, friendly and so very helpful. It's tucked away just off one of the main streets. The location approx. 4 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and the nearest Tramway stop gave us access to everywhere we needed to go. I would recommend using the tramway, it saves so much time, and allows you to see more. The standard rooms are small, and you can hear some noise at times from both outside and inside the hotel, but not enough to worry about. I cannot praise the staff enough, we travel frequently, and can honestly say you will not receive better service and friendly, helpful advice anywhere. Kemal, the front desk manager was a mine of information, and a really nice person. The hotel does not have a restaurant as such, they only prepare breakfast, but they order in meals from adjacent restaurants on request. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 1AnneMac
Reviews.Content: The hotel Niles is a beautiful hotel with superb staff. I could not have wished for a better location. The bathroom was rather small but very serviceable with instant hot water. The bed was a little hard for me but that's age for you!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Suite A Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lacepede
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Niles Hotel in the new section which has deluxe Turkish style suites. After our 15 day tour staying in European style hotels it was nice to experience the Turkish flavour of our room. Located in the Beyazit district it was only a short walk to the Grand Bazaar and other historic sights. The light rail was nearby and quickly transfered us to the Sultanahmet district. Like many of the small Turkish hotels The Niles has a roof top terrace where breakfast is served. The view over the city to the ocean is spectacular and combined with a good breakfast is an ideal way to commence the day. Reception was very helpful, advising us of local restaurants within walking distance, and arranging taxi transfer to the airport. The Niles Hotel certainly lived up to its reputation and was good value. We would stay again should we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: APawlowska
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites, which was very comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. The hotel had a breakfast included in the price. It was served at the roof terrace with a nice view of the sea. Also the pick up from the airport, for which we had to pay extra, was very convenient since it was our first time in Istanbul. Moreover, the location was great, very close to main sights of Istanbul such as Grand Bazaar and Hagia Sophia. The staff was extremely commited, polite and ready to offer help whenever we needed it. I would highly recommend it to anyone that plans a stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: gripfastleicester
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this Hotel, lots of character and attention to detail. Staff very attentive and always smiling and ready to help not matter how small the detail. We stayed in the standard rooms, which were very clean and fresh towels and bed linen everyday and the bathroom cleaned. For the price that you pay it is excellent value. So practical to be there and plenty of choices of places to eat of all different standards. The little cafe called Sar's is a must and cheap place to eat as well as the street food near the bazaar. Also if you wanted anything to eat in the Hotel even though they are not a restaurant, they can send out for the food for you and it will be ready plated when it arrives. That's service. Everything is handy to get to the main sites and even if you need transport to get to them a tramway system is about 5 minutes walk from the Hotel which is only 2 lira for a journey. If you want to stay in the deluxe rooms I took a peep and perhaps will have to try them next time. Loved it, cant fault it. Try it and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable small hotel close to historic sights”
Reviews.Author: abba1126
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel within walking distance of the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque (5 min walk) and right across the street from the Grand Bazaar. The tram is one block away, allowing easy access to the other districts of the city (Karakoy, Beyoglu, etc.). The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are somewhat small and simply furnished, but if you are looking for a comfortable, clean, quiet place at a reasonable rate, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: BJBD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. Its located in the bazaar area of old Istanbul, within walking distance of all the major sights. The staff are really friendly and we became good friends by the time we departed. The breakfast is sumptuous and well the timing was really convenient for lazy tourists(like us).I would definitely recommend this hotel to those looking for a hassle free stay at Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mick A
Reviews.Content: I cannot say how pleased I was with our choice of hotel. Kemal and his colleagues were more than helpful and the room was great! The location was an easy walk to the central highlights and the tram system was less than 5 minutes walk away to get to most places. If I can suggest that anyone going there with the intention of getting a leather jacket use the shop across the street where the prices are negotiable and very reasonabe (avoid the Grand Baz as there are serious rip-off agents there). If I can find a fault it is in the selection of breakfast items but the view from the rooftop restaurant makes up for it. Well done to Kemal and team for making our weekend getaway a true success!! Highly recommended and WE WILL BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: Taylor Y
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is straight out of a story book! Incredibly quaint and beautiful. It has the most amazing staff! I cannot be more thankful for their help during our trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: I came with a friend during a very cold weekend. I travel often and all over and I would say that this was definitely one of the best trips I've had!!! This hotel is wonderful as well. All hotel staff were extremely friendly and would go out of their way to make sure you got what you need and were comfortable. I felt very safe in the area and I thought it was better to be here than in the center of the old city. The hotel is extremely clean and the breakfast selection is expansive. When I come back (probably with my mother), I will definitely be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Niles Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: T Denise J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Niles Istanbul hotel last week and really enjoyed the hotel. The staff were very hospitable and helpful. They provided us with information on places to visit, which was extremely helpful. We really enjoyed the daily breakfast spread as well. The experience and the price was wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tamaranicole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Niles and could not have enjoyed my experience more. A great warm reception and fantastic staff. They even loaned me a mobile phone charger until I go to the shop to purchase one. The location is great - a walk away from all the important sights and sites. I would certainly recommend Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “"Would go back again"”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: The staff is very professional and extremely helpful. In particular Mr. Kemal Ã‡elik, Front Desk Manager, and the others who worked at reception went far beyond similar establishments. They even helped me track down my i-pod touch, which I had lost right before leaving, and had it mailed to me. The breakfast on the terrace is very good as well! I will stay there when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service - with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Emarbee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles is admirably placed, just a stoneâ€™s throw from the University, Beyazit Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and the tram to the Golden Horn and Beyoglu though also an easy walk to the Blue Mosque etc. But because it is tucked into an area of small clothing stores and workshops just down the street from the tiny, historic Diberli Eminbey mosque [founded in 1509], it feels part of the real commercial life of Istanbul rather than the tourist life â€“ quiet at night, bustling in the day. The hotel itself is charming. From the lobby with its internet connection and samovar of tea [both available 24/7] to our small, budget priced, comfortable, immaculately clean, well-appointed twin room with constant hot water and wifi up to the panoramic view of the Sea of Marmara from the rooftop terrace, Hotel Niles was warm [January] and welcoming. Staff are friendly and obliging, providing well-informed advice about the city, ordering taxis or simply chatting. As with many hotels in the world, the walls are relatively porous to noise. One night inconsiderate neighbours moved into the next room; I mentioned this to the staff and the problem did not recur. The breakfast is lavish and varied â€“ fresh and dried fruit, yoghurt, cereals, olives, cheeses, tomatoes, eggs, pastries â€“ in the airy terrace surrounded by a profusion of plants. A suggested improvement would be fresh fruit juice and varying one or two items on a daily basis just to introduce an element of surprise for people staying more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: A lovely and unassuming boutique hotel nestled in the Bazaar Quarter-- a mere 10 minutes' walk from the monuments and other cultural sites of Sultanahmet. A gracious and accommodating staff, very clean rooms, and a pleasant rooftop terrace made for a wonderful stay. Additionally, closer proximity to the Grand Bazaar allowed the haul with a newly purchased carpet far easier! I would certainly stay again, and highly recommend Hotel Niles to others who may prefer quieter accommodations right off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul trip”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Niles for a week. I absolutely loved it. It was near many different attractions and very cheap compared to other hotels in that area. I definitely recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul - New Year 2011”
Reviews.Author: LauraLLou
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms were a bit hot. Excellent roof terrace with really helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Venetia020
Reviews.Content: Being located near the Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque and many other important sites is just one of many advantages. We were fortunate in that we had one of the larger and more luxurious rooms with a generous Turkish marble bathroom. Although our room had no view the interior design was so carefully thought out and charming that it didn't matter as one ate breakfast in the rooftop dining room with views out to the Sea of Marmara. Music in the public areas was perfect, a blend of classical and soft modern Turkish. Underfloor heating, good beds, plenty of pillows, kettle, fridge all supplied. The service was truly outstanding. They offered us hot tea on the cold, rainy afternoon we arrived. The entire staff were warm, gracious, spoke good to excellent English and provided sound information. They were very professional but made you feel as if they enjoyed serving you. An absolutely spotless, calm and lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Philippe2016
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is a charming hotel situated very close to all the high spots of Istanbul. You can reach almost everything by foot and the tramway station is also very close. The staff is very helpful and nice. An excellent breakfast is served on the roof terrace with view on the Bosphorous. We have only positive points about this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Really top class location/price/performance”
Reviews.Author: inch1957
Reviews.Content: The Niles Hotel is located at walking distance from most of the main Istanbul attractions, 2 minutes from a tram stop and just up the hill from a bunch of fish restaurants. That's for the location. The staff is very, very friendly and efficient, will provide you with all information, services, contacts, whatever you need will be lookd after for you. On the rooftop you can have breakfast overlooking the Maramara sea just at the Bosphorus entrance, a great deal of ships coming and going. And the breakfast buffet is so rich in fresh food, you'll be done for the whole day! Rooms are warm, daily cleaned, TV-fridge-WiFi (free)-phone, all you need when staying in town. Not all that spacious but then most of the time you'll be around visiting. Be aware that once the morning wake-up prayer has been called for from one of the many nearby mosques, most of the activities outside get going, this can be somewhat noisy. Reccomend? definitively YES!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight?”
Reviews.Author: dist
Reviews.Content: Either you like it or you don't Istanbul is a scruffy old city but the Hotel Niles is well placed in it... close to the Grand Bazaar, Bayazit tram station and within walking distance to many interesting historic sites.Excellent fish restaurants 5>10 mins walk through the garment area (bit spooky at night) to Kumkapi. Hotel Niles reception is a bit like a tv/film set but has a pleasant charm, the standard room was fine and had a comfortable queen size bed. The staff were charming and very helpful. Good breakfast which sets you up for the day.... we enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “You do not have to think further than Hotel niles when visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lknowles33
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Niles - our first stay was in 2007. Many improvements had been made since our previous visit to which was already a great place to stay. Some things were the same though - the excellent, polite and attentive staff at all levels, the great breakfast in the rooftop restaurant. The pickup from the airport was also organised by the hotel - a comforting feature when arriving late at night at Ataturk airport. Our room was on the fifth floor overlooking the street - it was immaculately clean and comfortable - yes small by American standards but really so nice. Of course the hotel is well situated, being in walking distance of many of this city's great sites - even if you don't want to walk everywhere you are only 5 minutes form the excellent tram system in front of the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Serene haven in exciting city”
Reviews.Author: Eva R
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of Hotel Niles, since I selected it based on the great reviews and praise the hotel and staff receive... and it was even better than expected. It was my first time in Istanbul and the staff made me feel welcome and supported, and helped to make my trip a real pleasure. Hotel Niles is located in a relatively quiet street but close to the efficient light rail and a short walk to most major tourist sites. The room (a suite) was clean, comfortable, pleasantly designed, and spacious enough to do some writing. Breakfast was a simple and delicious start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ejamtag
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Hotel Niles before heading out to the Aegean coast. The room was comfortable, and the rooftop terrace a nice spot for breakfast and evening tea. The staff, especially Kemal, was very helpful on arranging our side trip flights and airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: MountainRenewal
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at Hotel Niles during our honeymoon to Turkey. The hotel is located a few blocks from the Grand Bazaar and tram station. And a short walk to major sites including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The beautiful rooftop terrace open 24 hours provides views of the Bosphorus and city. The delicious and plentiful breakfast is served in the rooftop terrace. The rooms are small and simple, but well appointed and immaculately clean, beds comfortable with luxurious linens. While the perfect location in the heart of the old city it is the staff that made this stay most memorable and enjoyable. The entire staff from the front desk, door/bell man, bartenders, breakfast staff and general manager where gracious, helpful and made our trip very, very special!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish to the core!”
Reviews.Author: gpbraun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Niles. It was a fascinating experience! When we travel, we try to stay at places that represent the feel of the nation. The Niles met this goal in every way. The staff was super friendly and always helpful. The room was comforfortable, large by size in traditional European hotels.The breakfast buffet was a Turkish delight, especially the hand whipped yoghurt, the fresh olives and the jams. The location was superb, two blocks from the Beyazit tram stop, and a short walk to all the major sights in the Sultanahmet area. With a room on the front of the hotel, we enjoyed watching the shopkeepers and their stores open, and the early morning call the prayer from the nearby mosques. Higly recommend this as a place to stay if you love local atmosphere and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles- An Excellent Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_mcknight
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay( November) at the Hotel Niles. We stayed in one of the suites. The rooms and bathrooms are of a very high standard- marble wetroom- our suite had a fridge and microwave as well. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring istanbul on foot ,with tram and bus links if you wish to go further. The staff are the most helpful , pleasant thoughtful and friendly people I have met -nothing is too much for them . My husband and I have done a lot of worldwide travel. and this hotels staff are the best! Kemal the front desk manager arranged our transfers from the airport and also kindly posted something important I had stupidly left in our room. The roof top terrace / bar where breakfast is served has a great view of the sea and istanbul. Murat looked after us there and again like all the staff - he is a very pleasant, hardworking individual I am certainly looking forward to coming back to stay at the Hotel Niles soon and will be recommending it to friends and family. Thank you Hotel Niles for a memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2blackrabbits
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is 3 blocks from the Grand Bazaar on a side street that doesn't get a lot of noisy traffic. It is clean and modern (the older side is due for remodeling in Feb 2012 with marble bathrooms and larger rooms). The staff is very helpful and friendly. They have airport pickup for 25 euros (about 36 dollars) which is reasonable and convenient. There is a lovely roof top terrace that has open areas for nice weather and a glass enclosed area with lots of plants and 2 pet cockatiels. Breakfast is served here, simple but tasty. There is tea and coffee available made fresh 24 hours. There are many restaurants within walking distance. The Tram stops 3 blocks away, giving easy access to the rest of the city. If I ever get back to Istanbul I will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: KKillius
Reviews.Content: For those people who are going to stay in Istanbul, I strongly recommend Hotel Niles. My sister and I stayed there for 5 days between Sept/October, 2011 and it was wonderful! This was our second trip to Istanbul and Turkey and the hotel we stayed last time was really good except it was a bit far from the tram and we got lost so many times, so I booked Hotel Niles this time because it was much closer to the tram (just a 3-4 minute walk). The area is not the best in the city but once you are inside the hotel, everything was superb - from the front staffs, our room (though small but very clean) and the roof-top restaurant and its staffs. They responded to our questions or requests very promptly every time. Everyone working there was polite but very friendly - exactly the way we ususally want from the hotel staffs. I am glad we switched to Hotel Niles and when I go back to Istanbul (beautiful and exciting city!) I will definitely stay there again. I showed the pictures taken at the rooftop restaurant to my family and friends and everyone says what a wonderful place it looks like (the food, view and atmosphere)!

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TravelnFoodLover
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel, especially the staff. The location is great, walking distance to many major sites (steps from the Grand Bazaar and major tram line, 10+ minutes to other sites). The rooms were simple - we were in the non-suite - but clean and adequate. Lobby is charming, the public computer with internet worked. The staff was super friendly and helpful. We found that some staff in museums and restaurants in Istanbul were not particularly helpful, which made the friendly smiles and 'at your service' attitude at the hotel even more appreciated. The breakfast is very nice, lots of options, and the rooftop deck/lounge was a pleasant place to unwind, with 24hr small bar for convenicence. The two managers (Kemel & Ahmet I think were their names) were the best- The value/quality ratio of this hotel far exceeded our expectations. We are LGBT but it made no difference to staff or experience. I posted the same review on Orbitz - really like it. Note that the roof deck is for snacks/drinks, not a restaurant per se.

Reviews.Title: “Grateful I made the choice to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: whitmarshn
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before choosing Hotel Niles, and I am nothing but pleased with my decision. The hotel was charming and VERY clean, the staff was exceptionally hospitable, and I loved the location. It is close to all of the sights but still has the feeling of being away from the thick of it. We had two rooms here for four nights, and I was traveling with my fiancee and mother. The rooftop area was fantastic for my mother to stay in one evening when she was tired after a day of tromping around the city, and wonderful for my fiancee and I to enjoy a glass of wine at the end of the night. The breakfast buffet was delicous, and one of the most varied that we experienced in our three weeks in Turkey. Great value, I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Corarichards
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a fascinating city and I warmly recommend the Hotel Niles. It is a lovely traditional family run hotel. The suite with its traditional Turkish decor and bathroom was a pleasure to be in. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful and we enjoyed drinks on the roof terrace and meeting in the the beautifully furnished reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay at the end of a months cruising - the hotel was recommended to us by a friend and we chose the Penthouse Suite. Stepping off a cruise ship is often a big let down, but the staff at the Niles instantly made us feel completely at home; so courteous, so friendly and so helpful. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The room was fabulous and we even had a view from the balcony. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: lsnhc1
Reviews.Content: Prior to leavng on a cruise on Oct. 17, we flew to Istanbul a day early and based on comments on this site, we booked one night at the Hotel Niles. It was the perfect place to begin our vacation. We arrived late the afternoon on Oct. 17 to discover that we had been upgraded to a suite - it was beautifully decorated and made our "time zone" adjustment very easy. The staff was unfailingly helpful, both with assisting with a wonderful dinner recommendation at the Fener Fish Restaurant (would return in a heartbeat!) as well as pointing us in the right direction for our sightseeing the following day. The buffet breakfast on the roof was very good and was the ideal start to a day of sightseeing! This is truly the perfect boutique hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yellomello
Reviews.Content: We spent two wonderful, Â hectic weeks in Turkey. Â Hotel Niles and its fantastic team made our last stop; Istanbul extra special. The hotel is tastefully furnished. The room quiet, clean, cosy. The location is great for both the top tourist spots and the shopping belt. There is a tram stop just a few minutes walk away. Shops and restaurants surround you. If you think this is enough to entice you to Niles, there is more: Free flow of tea in the lovely reception area and then there is the beautiful roof terrace. Have a healthy, tasty breakfast with wonderful views planning your day and after dinner, a nightcap to recall all the wonderful people and places.Â  For us Feridun Guen Â was one key reason for our super stay and it started with our very late check-in. Tired and hungry, Feridun who was on night shift, managed to find a hot meal for us from a cafe down the street. We enjoyed our special delivery meal and went to bed only to discover the next day that Feridun had paid for it. In our exhaustion, we had forgotten. Feridun also had little titbit surprises whilst you sipped your evening raki. Every evening was special. And to Feridun every guest was special. So when in Istanbul, all we can say is do stay at Hotel Niles: a special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and economical location near Sultanmehmet”
Reviews.Author: SaifIqbal
Reviews.Content: Location & Getting there: Near the Beyazit tram station. Take the metro from Ataturk Havaliman airport (its a single line there). One can interchange to the tram line at two places - Zeytinburnu or, Aksaray. Choose the former. Aksaray is a busy stop and if you have luggage it will be very difficult to get on the tram. Also, the Aksaray tram line is a decent walking distance from the metro station. Take the tram towards Kabatas and get down at the Beyazit station (10-odd stops away). Once you get down from the tram, exit, and move in the opposite direction of the tram (on the same side of the street); turn left on the second street (Ordu Caddesi / Ordu Street) and after a steep downhill walk, you will see the hotel on your left. Staff: Kemal Ã‡elik is the manager and was very helpful. We arrived early for check in. He asked us to go to the restaurant on the terrace and get some breakfast while he completes the formalities. Since we did not spend the previous night at the hotel, it was of course complimentary. A bellboy was also on hand to take our luggage up to our rooms (there are a couple of elevators). Kemal also helped us in figuring out our two day itinerary in Old Istanbul (ask for a map), including good suggestions for places to eat. Sami is the other manager and he was helpful too. Room: Standard double room. The room was a little small, but I guess that is because it is a boutique hotel. Some sort of cable was there will few English channels (true for even 4-star hotels in Turkey). Bathrooms were adequate and clean. Since we were going to be out the whole day the room served its functional purpose. The room faced the street in front of the hotel, so there was no view to speak of. The street itself is a quite one at all times of the day. View: The terrace restaurant had a great view of the Marmara sea. The hotel is a couple of miles away from the sea. Meals: We had the breakfast at the restaurant everyday (included in the tariff). It is standard fare that you will see most hotels in Turkey, but it was fresh and good. Bread rolls, jams, olives, eggs, salads, and fruits with tea/coffee. The terrace restaurant is a great place to relax before a day of walking and sightseeing. Things around: If you walk along the tram line for 10 minutes, you will hit Sultanmehmet area after one stop. The walk itself is a good one as the street is famous for its stores, eateries, old buildings, etc. Once at Sultanmehmet you can see the Hagia Sophia (cathedral turned mosque and now a museum) - 2 hours; Basilica Cistern (underground aquaduct) - 0.5 hour; Sultanmehmet/Blue mosque (0.5 hr). The Topkapi Palace and Museum is a half day activity as the complex is a huge one so best to do it early in the day before the crowds get in. Eminonu and Karakoy (on either side of the Galata bridge - can walk and take in views of both the European and Old Istanbul sides) are a couple of tram stops away from the Sultanmehmet. Eat & Shop: There quite a few good kofta (meat ball) shops near Sultanmehmet. There is one 'Meshur Kofte', which had a few choices in the menu, but was excellent (it is also pretty famous considering the number of locals that were there). You can always grap a doner (wrap) at one of the small eateries. Sirkeci has quite a few shops for local trinkets as such. While the Grand Bazaar is not too far from the hotel, we found the prices too inflate there (as well as the Egyptian Bazaar). It is better to buy from standalone shops than from those at the Bazaar (market). There is a small market behind the Blue mosque (Artasan Bazaar), which had 6-8 shops and better prices for exactly the same things. Tips: 1. Exchange currency near the hotel; Sultanmehmet area exchange shops will give you a worse rate; 2. Do not need a taxi if you are going to hang around near the hotel and Sultanmehmet area. 3. To take tickets on the metro/tram, you would need Jeton tokens (1 token = 2 Liras = 1 trip on Metro/Train). Machines are near the stops and take both paper and coins; 4. There is an Istanbul Museum pass that is valid for 48-72 hours that gets you cheaper entry into museums (we did not know about it until later).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Leonie H
Reviews.Content: The helpful staff, central location and comfortable room at the Hotel Niles helped make our visit Istanbul a success. It was close to all the main tourist sites and easy to find. The trams were just at the top of the street, if we felt exhausted after a day of walking, but mostly we took advantage of everything being within walking distance of the hotel. The helpful friendly staff went out of their way to provide information and ring to make any bookings and the breakfast each morning was something to look forward to - great views, good food and lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Niles. The great service started with email advice prior and during our booking. Kemal on the front desk is so efficient and helpful. The room was clean and the bathroom facilities were nice. We were upgraded to a suite for one night which was great. Breakfast on the terrace is a lovely way to start the day. A great view, nice food and really friendly staff. The Niles is close to the Grand Bazaar and many other sights are within walking distance. It is great value for money and we have no hesitation recomending Hotel Niles. All the Niles staff are so friendly and helpful that returning each afternoon was like coming home. All the staff came out on the footpath to wave goodbye when we checked out. We were indeed sad to leave. Hotel Niles will be our first choice for our next visit to Istanbul. Richard and Stella Walker

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming and well located”
Reviews.Author: Susanne B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles has a very kind, polite and helpful staff. Clean and well maintained rooms. Lovely terrace/breakfast place.( Superb breakfast ) Situated in the " leather quarter" which gave us great shopping possibilities :-) Close to Grand Bazar , Museums, Mosques, Turkish Bath...you name it..Highly recomendable. Susanne Boenloekke

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel it was a pleasure to return to each day”
Reviews.Author: Brash E
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is excellent on all fronts: welcoming, well equipped, handsome and well-maintained. The old city surrounds the hotel, the Grand Bazaar is nearby, and the location provides a very real sense of what the city is about. The staff was invariably polite, friendly, and helpful. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is a fine way to start the day. Altogether, a fine hotel experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is a charming, smallish hotel with a very good location near the main sights. I was impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, the breakfast selection was excellent, and there was a wonderful view from the roof terrace. I had booked a suite, it was roomy and neat. As an extra plus, they had very comfortable pillows, which for me personally is important. The taxi service from and to the airport was handy. I also got a free map and good advice at the beginning of my stay. I warmly recommend this hotel for a comfortable and pleasant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel and great base for the sights”
Reviews.Author: izzimac
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for seeing the sights in the Sulhammet area. We had a suite and felt that it was a well sized room. The hotel staff are without the reason this hotel is a great hit. They were all very helpful from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We stayed at another hotel in Istanbul at the end of this 10 day break in Turkey and we paid double the money but the customer service was awful.. so much so we wished we had returned to the Hotel Niles. Hind sight is a wonderful thing. Love Istanbul loved Hotel Niles .. we will be back and would recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: liz b
Reviews.Content: the niles hotel was situated in an ideal location with the main attractions being only a few minutes walk away. the rooms are very small but have everything u need. it was nice to be able 2 use the free internet in the lobby area. the staff were friendly especially the waiters and waitress.....sorry cannot remember their names. the breakfast was lovely. this is a good budget hotel but next time, i think i would stay in the bigger suites as the room was a little small and cramped. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great breakfast, nice area”
Reviews.Author: Erik P
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 nights and liked it a lot. The room that we stayed in was clean and good, though nothing particularly fancy (Rooms on the pictures on the web are probably of the better looking (and more expensive suite)). Staff is extremely friendly and nice, the breakfast was something to look forward to every day and views from the rooftop terrace were nice. The hotel doesn't actually make lunch or dinner, but you can order food, that they will get from a nearby restaurant or hotel, and serve on the terrace. THe hotel is in an alltogether nice area, close enough (about 3 tram stops, or a 15-minute walk) from the major sights like the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc, a 5-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and located in a working class neighbourhood, full of leather workshops, and with nice cobblestone streets, very lively during the day, and very quiet at night. The price is probably not the cheapest, but altogether very much worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service but ordinary rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: YChristinae
Reviews.Content: The staff go the extra mile here and make a big effort with guests. The communal areas are nice and the outside roof terrace for breakfast is also nice. Customer service is exceptionally good at this place and the management should be very proud of their staff. The ordinary rooms are very small but apparently the suites are much bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: isobel21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Staff very helpful. Room nice and bed comfortable. Rooftop terrace lovely and the breakfast a real treat. The location is very convenient to major sights. A warning to anyone with mobility problems. The hotel is at the bottom of a steep hill, which made going and coming a little difficult with our bad knees. Wouldn't be a problem for most people. Would opt for hotel pick-up from the airport as Istanbul taxi drivers can be difficult to negotiate with.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for creating beautiful memories..”
Reviews.Author: Shillpi J
Reviews.Content: I write this review on behalf of our parents who are returning from their stay at The Hotel Niles today evening.The fact that i only spoken to them on the phone and yet i have decided to write a review is enough to convey how they were looked after.Right from the mails regarding availability and booking,everything was prompt and the staff was always very helpful.They won our hearts by celebrated our parents 40th anniversary by surprising them with flowers and a cake.Thank you so much for giving them so much love and affection and making their Day special.Mr Kemal,Mr Ahmet are the two people whom i have corresponded through mails but this Thank you goes out to everyone at The Niles. Im glad i chose your hotel for our parents even when we had stayed at another hotel 3 yrs back.We loook forward to visiting you all again.Needless to write that our parents loved their stay with you all and your hotels proximity to all sightseeing made it even better, Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently returned from Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Lowen B
Reviews.Content: Truly excellent experience. Spent a total of 9 days in a double room on the fifth floor (floor is recommended.) Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Location is excellent, two blocks from the tram which will connect you with most of the city. Not in the center of the tourist area but on the edge with easy access to all tourist areas but with a real sense of the city (for example, a leather goods workshop across the street). Breakfasts were top especially excellent on a beautiful terrace with a view of the Sea of Marma. Suites are especially nice if you can afford a bit extra but our regular double was just fine. Highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ZoJo
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beaten for value for money. If you pay cash (Euros or Dollars) they give a 10% discount. It is 5 minutes from the tram and 15 minutes to the Blue Mosque etc. The staff are all excellent. We arrived just as breakfast was finishing and were invited to take breakfast free of charge whilst our room was being prepared. When we left, it was before breakfast started and orange juice and sandwiches were brought to our room. We were given a map and shown the main tourist attractions upon our arrival and also given some nice restaurant recommendations. We chose a standard room as we were not planning to spend a lot of time in it and did not think it was worth paying extra for a suite. It was very clean and quite comfortable, other than the pillows. The shower cubicle was a little small if you are a little taller than average. The only problem I had was that the street outside can get quite noisy early in the morning as the hotel is in an area with quite a few tailors and handbag factories. I would stay again, but would bring my earplugs. The hotel is half way up quite a steep hill and is not recommended if you are not fully mobile.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in the old town.”
Reviews.Author: merlintrust
Reviews.Content: Quirky room - immaculately clean and well positioned near the tram lines, bazaar and Aga Sophia. Loved the view at breakfast from the rooftop terrace where we also enjoyed a glass of the local rose each afternoon. Breakfast was ample for us - the Borek was great. Loved the staff who were very helpful. You are best to hail a cab though at busy times than try to hire one through the hotel. the hotel does have a driver for the airport and a slightly higher cab rate - we used it and it was great. Found the displayed room rate lower than we paid through expedia so shop around or check direct with the hotel. Laundry was immaculate but takes 36 hours turnaround. We ate at local eateries where we could see locals eating and the food was great. Take the tram - ride the ferry to the Asian side - take the Tunel train up the hill - walk the cobblestone streets and check out french St - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful city, fantastic hotel, brilliant staff. recommend to anyone going!”
Reviews.Author: Rebeccaacton
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel sept 2011 and i thought that the hotel itself was clean and pretty. the staff were extremely polite and very helpful, the location was fantastic to getting to most places. the grand bizarre is just over the road 3min walk away. the blue mosque is 30min walk away and so is hagia sophia - very easy to find from hotel. the staff were very helpful in recommending places to go and when. overall i thought that this hotel was brilliant and would most definitely recommend to anyone who is going to Istanbul! Beautiful city!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location, average place”
Reviews.Author: triceratops111
Reviews.Content: For the price, you're definitely not going to beat Niles. Book online and agree to pay cash and you're paying one of the better rates I found for a decent Istanbul hotel. The staff is friendly enough and can generally help you find what you're looking for the city. That said, the place is just decent, nothing fancy. Our standard room was quite small with a window that looked out onto a building where people inside were making handbags all day. Small bathroom. The hotel also has newer, larger suites, which seem to be well liked by other reviewers. They're cheap by Istanbul standards, so if you can afford 50 or so Euros per night more than the standard room, you might wanna go for those. Our room was spotlessly clean. There's a small lift, which is good, 'cause the building is tall. We were on the fifth floor. The vaunted rooftop cafe area is quite nice, and serves (slightly overpriced) drinks until late, but I found the view wasn't quite as great as I was expecting. Still very pleasant up there, and it was cool to go up late at night and see small groups of people hanging out, all speaking different languages. Breakfast on the roof is also pleasant, but nothing fancy. First time I've seen cocoa puffs as a regular cereal offering at an international hotel! Free wifi worked the whole time, even in our room on the fifth floor. Warning, this area of Istanbul is a tourist haven -- think narrow mazelike streets with lots of shops selling cheap souvenirs and mosty so-so food. But you can walk to several amazing attractions, or even better -- take the cheap tram at the top of the hill. You're a stop or three away from Topkapi palace, Cemberlitas hamami, The Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. Take the tram a bit further and you're in the Spice Market area. Grab a ferry from there to the Asian side -- super fun. Niles is also especially super close to the Grand Bazaar, which I ironically never checked out but my wife liked. There's also a surprisingly big tea room/hookah place hidden away down an alley next to a cemetary on the main drag at the top of the hill. We stumbled upon it so late at night that we were too tired to actually sit down and experience it, but it's a seriously cool thing to seek out for the more adventurous among you. Istanbul's an amazing place, and if the Niles isn't luxurious, it's perfectly decent and puts more money in your pocket with which to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Made rest of trip better”
Reviews.Author: burnsfam
Reviews.Content: Everything you need in a good hotel:quiet, very clean, good bed, hot water...but made even better by an exceptionally friendly staff and a peaceful oasis of a location. You will need to do a little walking on cobblestones,through some more "authentic" less touristy streets which is fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: travellerRichmond
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel especially after the initial welcome to that great city. It was close to the main tourist attractions in Sultanamet but still fairly quiet with a sea view as well. Breakfast was fine and included in the price - always a plus - and they arranged good airport transfers

Reviews.Title: “PEJA”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, very clean and great location. Warm hospitality of Staff made our stay outstanding. Good advice and guidance readily available. Most attractions in old City were in walking distance as were restaurants. Breakfast provided wide variety and the rooftop terrace was a great feature. Wi-Fi a big plus. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: TAYF
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this hotel, the Niles was beautiful, very clean and a great location. The service was wonderful, Kemal and his team were excellent and a pleasure to deal with! We really enjoyed the breakfast on the terrace, it was such a great way to start the day! I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return to the Niles in the near future! Thanks Kemal and staff for making our stay so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: americanstreet
Reviews.Content: I was worried about the location of The Niles but we ended up loving it. It is three blocks from the Grand Bazaar and two blocks from the tram. The tram takes you to the historic district (two stops), the Spice Market and Galatea Bridge (5 stops), across the Bosphorus in 6. The neighborhood around the hotel is very working class and bustling. It reminds me of the garment district in NYC. Our rooms were gorgeous. We opted for the suite which is not a suite but a large, lovely room. At 117 Euro, it was a decent deal. Their roof terrace overlooking the Sea of Marmara is a charming place to enjoy the included breakfast or a reasonably priced wine or cocktail (we made our own) after a day of touring. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: reginew33
Reviews.Content: How fortunate we were to have Hotel Niles be our home during our three-day stay in Instanbul. We arrived after midnight but the staff were very gracious and made us feel very welcome despite the late hour. The room was immaculate. We were very delighted by the delicious breakfasts on the roof-top garden terrace with its view of the Bosphorus and the neighborhood mosque. The front desk staff were so friendly and extremely helpful. The sitting areas were comfortable and very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Susie M
Reviews.Content: Everything about Hotel Niles was great! It is very clean, the staff is exceptionally kind and helpful, the location is wonderful (walking distance to all places of interest in Sultanahmet, yet on a quiet side street), and the rooftop terrace + hearty breakfast all combine to make the Niles the perfect hotel from which to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the suites not standard rooms in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiHoward
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed with this hotel after reading all the excellent review on tripadvisor. The lobby and roof terrace are lovely, but the hotel is divided between a set of beautiful suites on one side, and a set of bog standard rooms on the other - even the lifts are different, meaning that if you stay in the standard rooms, it feels a little like you are second class visitors having to use a cranky old lift at the back of the lobby! We have stayed in quite a few budget hotels, but would not recommend the standard rooms in this one - the double bedroom was two twin beds pushed together, with single blankets and a sheet which didn't quite fit. The bathroom was tiny and clinical, and overall the room was not ideal for a week's stay at all given the price of rooms. All standard rooms also face on to a bustling road (more people noise than traffic though), so worth bearing in mind if you are a light sleeper. As other reviews have suggested, the terrace and lobby are great, the hotel is close to the tramline (though the local area is lacking in good restaurants and any bars) - and staff are friendly. However, I would recommend staying in the newly-refurbished suites rather than the standard rooms, which are just not enough for a week's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Elinor H
Reviews.Content: My friend located Hotel Niles on line and we both were very pleased with our accommodations. The room was small but very comfortable, clean and well maintained. We really enjoyed the roof top area for breakfast and once for dinner when we could order in a meal. The lobby and public spaces are very attractive and the staff was very helpful and considerate. The location was excellent for sightseeing, close to the tram and to many attractions. I most certainly would stay here again should I return to Istanbul and am happy to recommend the Hotel Niles as an excellent, reasonably priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff, breakfast with a view”
Reviews.Author: JenGP
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about it! - The interior very quaint and rustic, there's a photo opportunity in almst all corners of the lobby. - The staff was the friendliest and most helpful I've ever met. They gave good advice on where to go with very detailed instructions on how to get there. They even went out of their way to find medicine for my friend who was sick even though it was Ramadan season and all pharmacies were closed. - Breakfast was on a beautiful rooftop terrace overlooking the Marmara Sea - rooms were tiny but very clean with fridge and safe, they give complimentary toiletries and rooms cleaned everyday - it's almost right across the Grand Bazaar - good neighborhood with lots of shops and restos around - one minute from the tram station that could take you almost anywhere - 5 min tram ride or 15-20 walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia

Reviews.Title: “Solid value close to Grand Bazaar and transportation”
Reviews.Author: Cublooded
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a top floor room with a beautiful balcony and views of the Marmara Sea. The hotel has been very nicely renovated in Byzantine style, the rooms are very clean, the staff is friendly and eager to help and the price is very reasonable. Rooftop garden was really nice and breakfast was standard fare. If you're planning to stay in the Old City, the location is fine, but everything we visited was 2 - 4 tram stops away. If staying again on this side of town, for the same price, I'd probably opt for something closer to the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia. Also, the staff was really nice, but I found their knowledge of things beyond standard tourist info lacking. For example, when we arrived, we asked for a local kebop recommendation for a quick bite to eat and we were directed to some random places nearby while there was an entire street of little cafes and kebop restaurants just two blocks over. Help with more complex requests was also challenging. Still, Hotel Niles is a really nice place that's worth a serious look in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Super value hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyhoopoe
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in Sultanahmet, within a 5-minute walk to the Beyazit tram station, which again, is across the road from the Grand Bazaar. The triple room was fine, very clean, with fridge and microwave, writing desk, internet connection etc. We loved the rooftop terrace for breakfast, with a view out to the Sea of Marmara. The staff really shine, especially Kemal Celik at the reception, and that is what will make this an easy choice on our next visit. They really did go out of the way to accommodate every request with patience. The transfers from and to the airport were very convenient, with a big private car that handled all our shopping on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, terrific rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: eidolonnyc
Reviews.Content: Settled on this hotel after looking at a few dozen others, based on the recommendation of a traveling companion's brother. We were thoroughly satisfied and very impressed. Very attractive property with lots of amenities. We had a suite in the main building, which was very large with a great bathroom, good desk and lighting, etc. Very good breakfast on the very attractive and breezy indoor/outdoor roofdeck, which is open 24 hours and a great spot at all hours of the day. The location is close to the Bayazet tram stop, which is the main tram line with stops for Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, and the Istanbul Modern (at the end of the line). Good location just a five minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Hard for cabbies to find, but just tell them the Bayazet tram stop and navigate from there. Very good value. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mazen1968
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family trip to Istanbul where we stayed at the Niles Hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located to (and within 20-minutes walking distance of) most of the touristic and historical sites in the Sultanahmet district (Grand Bazar (3-minute walk), Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque). It is also a two minute walk from the Beyazit tram station from which you can reach districts that are farther away (e.g. Eminonu, Karakoy, Taksim, etc..). The Niles Hotel is a boutique hotel that is family owned and operated. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and speak very good English. The regular rooms are a little bit small (think Paris) but are otherwise very clean and comfortable. The suites, on the other hand, are spacious, and are decorated in a beautiful Ottoman style, which, while classic, does not feel stuffy. The hotel also offers Maisonettes, which are small apartments for 4-5 people, but I did not have a chance to see these. Breakfast at the Niles Hotel is served on the roof-top terrace, which is surrounded with flower beds and green shrubs, and offers a beautiful view of the Bosphorus. The breakfast includes a nice selection of breads and cakes, hard-boiled and scrambled eggs, various cheeses, confectioneries, juices, tea, and coffee. If you enjoy Turkish style tea, you can also ask the waiter for a cup of "demleme shay" (steeped tea). However, what impressed me most about my stay at the Niles Hotel was the presence of the hotel's friendly owner, Mr. Deniz Duyar, who was always on hand to make sure that all guests were being well taken care of. We had a baby with us and the staff truly went out of their way to make sure the baby's needs (e.g. high chair) were taken care of. After staying at the hotel for a few days, it truly felt like we were staying with family. The Niles Hotel offers clean, comfortable, rooms at very reasonable rates. It is conveniently located to Istanbul's major attractions with easy access to public transportation. And it has wonderful staff and management who not only make you feel welcome, but truly make you feel like you are a member of their family. I highly recommend it and would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MatteoSushi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Niles Hotel for 4 nights during August 2011. The hotel is placed a few meters away from the Beyazit tram station, so well connected to the Sulthanamet area, and just across the street from the Gran Bazaar. As we arrive the receptionist, Kemal, warmely welcomed us offering a good glass of apple tea. We arrived before the check-in time but the room was already done. It was a normal size room, suited for two people. the bed was confortable and the sheet were changed every day. it was all "fresh and clean". Kemal and his colleague helped us a lot with all the directions we needed, advicing us on the best spot to see and things to do. the buffet breakfast on the last floor was great, a good choice of international and typical food. Overall we came back in Istanbul on the 10th as the last day of the tour, and even without staying the night at the hotel the staff was so kind to keep our laugagge in their deposit for the whole day, offering us a shower before going to the airport! The Niles Hotel was the icing on the cake to our trip!we would definetly come back here in future!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Moss52
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on online reviews. The rooms in all such hotels tend to be small but the property is well maintained and all amenities are provided for a comfortable stay. The tv is small , but we never watch tv in hotel rooms anyway. They have a rooftop restaurant with a nice view where they serve breakfast (included in the tariff and very substantial) but not meals, but will order them from a nearby restaurant. Of course, the bar is open at all times! There is wi fi in the rooms, again included in the tariff. There is a provision for laundry as well as basement ironing, which we did not use. There is a computer on a desk, always available for guests who have not brought their own. We used it to make onward reservations. The airport transfer service is very reasonably priced and the Mercedes vans are very clean. The staff all speak and understand English, which is not always the case in Turkey. The location is very good, two tram stops away from Sultanahmet attractions. Its also very close to the Grand Bazaar. Overall, a reasonably priced, very well maintained and well serviced hotel where I would love to stay again, if we were to go to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “lovely roof garden”
Reviews.Author: Saeed022
Reviews.Content: me and my friend stayed at this hotel for two nights. this hotel is a small hotel in the old city of Istanbul near the grand bazaar and Beyazit mosque. the location of this hotel is great, if you go about 200m by walk you can access the metro station in one of the best lines of metro in Istanbul (T1). the rooms and also bath room were very small but with great decoration. the sheets ,pillow covers and towels were really clean but some part of our room wall was a little dirty but i think it was negligible. the hotel is located in the old bazaar of Istanbul so if you open your room windows the noise of street might be annoying. the wireless high speed internet was available in the rooms and it's quality was good. the best part of this hotel was it's roof garden, there was a coffee shop on the top of the roof that breakfast served there! but notice that this hotel doesn't serve lunch or dinner! the stuff of hotel were really kindly and helpful. at the end I think it's a good suggestion in Istanbul and I will be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Extreamly pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: Erland L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks and loved it. The staff made us feel very welcome and did everything in their power to make our stay as pleasent as possible. For that reason alone we would choose this hotel again. In addition the free wireless network coverage is perfect everywhere in the hotel. The beds are comfortable, the rooms very clean and the breakfast buffet suited us fine. The location is very good in a small side street but close to the tram station and the historical sites. A well asorted local grosery store is only 50 meter away. We had booked a standard double room. The one we first got turned out to have a broken aircondition. We stayed in it a couple of days before we complained about it. 10 minutes after we did, the guy from the reception desk came to check it. When he realized that he couldn't fix it he offered to move us to another room immediately. Problem solved! Only downside is that the standard rooms are small, the bathrooms very small and the shower cabin nano sized. If you are size large or above you should book one of the suites. We had the pleasure to stay in one the last day. This was very comfortable with plenty of space. We can realy recomend this hotel. We travel a lot but have never seen such friendly and service minded staff anywhere. A piece of good advise; book your stay directly at the hotel's web page and save a lot of money. We booked through hotels.com and got overcharged heavely. We could have saved 240 Euro if we had booked directly.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jeanmarie k
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great locale. all the staff were delightful and so helpful. standard room was satisfactory though would benefit from more storage space & a fridge could be bigger. view from 3rd floor rooms mostly look onto workshops,which in no way detract from the ambience of hotel, in fact give you an insight into the non-touristy part of istanbul. the icing on the cake however is the wonderful roof terrace (an oasis in bustling metrpolis) really want to keep this place a secret but have to give credit where due.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lindalane336
Reviews.Content: The Niles Hotel is not only perfectly located but adds perfect service to the list. About a 3 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, the location made it easy to shop, drop purchases a the hotel and shop some more. Many of the other historic sites are within walking distance. The staff especially Kemal at the front desk are extemely helpful. There is a lovely rooftop garden restaurant for breakfast each morning as well as a place to have an afternoon refreshment of coffee or tea. If you are looking for the 4 Seasons, you stay in New Islanbul but if you are looking comfort, location and vaue, I recommend the Niles.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: car081
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 nights at hotel niles in Istanbul during the beginning of our trip in Turquia and as we liked it we decided to come back again for the 4 last nights of our holiday. The location of the hotel is very good, close to the main places, the staff is particularly very kindly, nice, helpful and friendly. the hotel is quiet also and very very clean! good price compare to the others hotels in Istanbul, the standard room is correct and during our second stay we appreciated a lot the duplex maisonette, and we liked very the breakfast at the nice terrace!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: cassa52
Reviews.Content: Best place ever to stay near everything,staff just great polite, helpful & could not do anymore for you. Great breakfast & meals brought in for you if you wanted dinner on the terrace a great idea

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sight seeing!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieNM_8
Reviews.Content: Located just a few blocks from the modern tram line, the Hotel Niles was perfect for us. We rented one of the 2 level suites with a bedroom, tv, sink upstairs and the other bedroom and wonderful bathroom on the basement level. The cost of the room includes an extensive breakfast in the rooftop dining area, which also serves drinks in the evening and provides a good view of the sea in the near distance. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. A lobby computer makes it easy to stay in touch with family at home. I read that the regular rooms are smallish, but the suites are great and not too expensive. For a fee, you will be met by a man with your name on a sign at the airport. You do not pay him, just tip, for the drive to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel experiences, ever”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we've seen in Istanbul, staff is very, very good. We were in Turkey for two weeks and this was the place where we felt we were most at home. Charming rooms, spotlessly clean and great food with incredible view from roof top breakfast terrace. Also great location near to Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. We have recommended it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AR08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Niles for 3 nights. The rooms are small and standard, but very clean, and comfortable. There is a lovely rooftop area with a view of the bosphorous where breakfast is served, and where we used to go to meet up with our friends in the evening to have a glass of wine and head out for dinner. The real standout point to note was that they had wonderful customer service. They kindly stored some of our purchases when we were going to be leaving Istanbul and returning a week later (this was before we had even stayed in the hotel). We also left something behind in our room which they have been trying valiantly to have mailed to us.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: RoseAnne18
Reviews.Content: Great location, kind and friendly staff, great breakfast included, moderate price and would visit here again...absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReneSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: For' Budget Travellers', we were surprised by the quality this hotel offered. The Turkish complimentary breakfast was the best we were offered in Turkey. Loved the coffee and cakes. A block away from the Hotel is a nice local restaurant (where the hotel actually orders their meals from).They do a lovely house soup and the greatast balloon breads(pide). If you want a beer they, ll find you one! (Even if it means running down the road) The Hotel is just a short walk to the Tram station and Grand Bazaar. Thumbs Up for Hotel niles!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: u_luv_canada
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were very welcoming, and gave me a cheaper rate than that originally quoted online, which was great! The hotel was very clean, air-conditioned rooms, and although it was basic, there was a tv and a small fridge in the room. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was a great way to start the day. I will definitely visit the Hotel Niles when next in Istanbul BTW Istanbul is a terrific city to visit, I loved every minute of my visit even though it was 30C the entire time!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: frugal_travelr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two night and had a double room. Our room was a bit small but was very clean. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. Their terrace on top had a view of the sea and had great breakfast in the morning. Its close to the grand bazaar and about a 10 mins walk to blue mosque and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: bellafeure
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for more - Hotel Niles was a wonderful surprise after a long journey to Istanbul. We organised for the hotel to pick us up from Sabiha Gokcen, which was well worth it as we arrived late at night. We stayed in a suite; it was gorgeous. The rooftop terrace was wonderful for a gin and tonic after a hard day exploring Istanbul. The hotel location was also spot on and easy walking distance from all the main attractions. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Niles Better...”
Reviews.Author: the_real_miu
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a stay in wonderful Istanbul. The location is very good, a short walk to the Beyazit tram stop. It's easy to walk to the most well known sights, though you'll probably find yourself using the tram a lot... invest in an akbil (6 lira deposit), a cute little tram pass which also passes for currency in the bazaar ;) Staff are really attentive, especially the front desk. The roof terrace is the best feature --- great for breakfast (which is good) and an aperitif. A small point is that our room was on the small side, though I had asked for a top floor room and they fulfilled this request, so I cannot complain. The hotel also provides a pc in the lobby for free internet access (and I think there is also free wifi). A great find overall.

Reviews.Title: “Roof-top Terrace my Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: LivingInTheBoot
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for its proximity to the Old Town, it's Suite with small terrace and partial ocean view (partial, yes, but worth it) and it's roof top terrace, all for a very reasonable rate. We think the value for the cost ratio was right-on, and we absolutely loved breakfast time, late lunches or evening drinks on the roof-top terrace with ocean views. The waiters and staff were beyond accommodating, and always greeted us with a smile and our names. We loved... - unique Turkish decor, not cookie-cutter found in larger chains - loved our narrow but quaint porch in the Penthouse Suite - Turkish bathroom with marble and excellent shower/water pressure - very comfortable bed, pillows and crisp soft linens - and that's saying something traveling in Europe - always cleaned thoroughly Sure, there are more refined and plush places, but you will pay. Great value for the money! and excellent service is price-less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Well placed”
Reviews.Author: ZAK1London
Reviews.Content: Arrived with family over Christmas for 6 days, booked two room. there was no problems in the standards of the hotel in way, the only slight mention would be the breakfast( bland ) otherwise 5 * to staff, who made it a very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mundublu
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! Thank you to all the staff for making our trip to Istanbul so memorable & enjoyable! We were picked up at the airport upon our arrival & taken to the hotel, which was very nice! This cost us 25 euro, but was worth it for making the trip so easy! Once we reached the Hotel Niles, oh it was lovely! The decoration of the hotel has a feeling of Old World charm, with antique furniture & Turkish carpets in every room. Our luggage was taken to our room as we checked in, & then we were shown to our room: a good sized suite with one big beautiful bed & another single bed that doubled as a window seat during the day. {My brother slept in this single bed & was incredibly comfortable each night, which is saying a lot because he is about 6 foot 3!} The bathroom was spacious & very pretty. The hotel has WiFi throughout, delicious breakfast on the roof terrace, very helpful front desk staff for finding local restaurants, etc., & the location of the hotel is perfect! It was about a 3 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar & a 10 minute walk to the main area with the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc. Hotel Niles is tucked away in a quiet side street, but easily within walking distance of the big sights. If I ever am able to return to Istanbul, I will certainly stay here again! Thank you all so much!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful & friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maryamir
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located just a couple minutes from Beyazit tram station which gives you convenient access to all the important attractions. We stayed in the suite which is basically a large room decorated in Ottoman style with fridge, microwave oven and a fantastic marble bathroom. Housekeeping was superb and we always came back to a tidy room to find that even our clothes had been folded for us. Front desk staff (Kemal, Sami, Yusuf) are very friendly and helpful in arranging restaurant reservations, tours, transfers, etc. The 24hr rooftop terrace area is very pleasant with view of sea of Marmara and Beyazit mosque and a great place to get a drink. There is also a gym available although we did not try it. Overall we had a very pleasant experience and would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great bed and bath, minutes from the tourist track”
Reviews.Author: Monkey_Brand
Reviews.Content: We don't normally pride ourselves on following the tourist track. With just under 48 hours to spend in Istanbul we splurged on the Penthouse "suite" and made the most of it. The Niles staff and services are top notch. The hotel is divided in two sections, the photos and promotional material show the suites side of things. The suites are really just large rooms, and would be considered large single rooms in any North American hotel chain. Having said that, and getting over a little disappointment (expectations can do that) they are well appointed, spotless, artfully decorated and the bathrooms rival luxury hotels costing double or triple the price. The penthouse suite we stayed in had a balcony with a partial sea view and large windows. The restaurant which provided a full Turkish-style breakfast was friendy and their rooftop location is very enjoyable. The hotel is central to everything important for a first, superficial visit to Istanbul, the bazar, the key mosques and museums, and about 15 minutes from the southern seaside boardwalk - which is a must-do. The exercise room, while needing some minor design improvements (aka get a towel from housekeeping for that thing called sweat) is well appointed, quiet and clean. You might need a wrench for the upright stationary bike seat though. Apart from feeling a little B&S'ed over the "suite" thing, our only complaint/recommendation would be to ask to have the balcony banisters wiped down before visit to the penthouse. Many bird gifts were there to dissuade humans from having a firm-handed look. Overall, we'd stay again, even if we planned on spending most of our time on the Asian side of the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: shiraz457
Reviews.Content: First of all, thank you Kemal, Murat and Ferdinu. You made our stay extra special. Always friendly and helpful. Thank you for the fruit and popcorn. That was a surprise. Murat, thank you for all the tea. Kemal, it was nice to see your friendly face every time I walked into the hotel, tired and footsore. To the lady who cleaned our room, thank you. It was wonderful to walk into a clean room every evening. This hotel is so central, we walked everywhere.
