The best part is, it is so close to the Grand Bazaar, you can drop your shopping and be on your way again. The roof terrace was a bonus. The smell of jasmine and the seagulls and the beautiful music. It was a joy to sit there in the evening and just relax. I will be back. Mrs Petro du Toit

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: beachwind
Reviews.Content: As older travellers making our own way, we were very satisfied with our room and loved the rooftop terrace with its magnificent views. Turkish delight and biscuits were there for the sampling and all staff, especially those in reception, went the extra mile to be welcoming and helpful. Computer available from the desk for those without their own

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: AnneDB
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Istanbul the last week in June and the trip was one of our bests! The sights, history and energy of this city are just unbelievable. A big part of the enjoyment of this gorgeous vacation was because of Hotel Niles. It's not a large hotel, but that makes it all the more special. The staff is so welcoming and helpful, they've become like friends, and the hotel was like a home away from home. For our arrival, in response to a few e-mails, the front office arranged for a car to pick us up from the airport. As soon as I got settled into the room, I was offered apple tea while waiting for my mother in the open, small courtyard-like section of the lobby. The location is ideal. Being interested mainly in art and history, we were able to walk to just about anywhere, but if one was looking to get to a different part of the city, the tram station is right up the hill. There, in the direction of the Blue Mosque, you will also find one amazing restaurant after another. As for the rooms, if you are traveling with friends and looking to get some quality sleep, the standard rooms are fine. They are small, but very clean and have all you need. If you are looking for a romantic getaway or need a bit more comfort, I'd recommend spending a little more on a suite. The suites are gorgeous! Decorated with traditional ottoman details and featuring large all-marble bathrooms, they add a luxurious touch for the right price. The back of the hotel is probably a little more quiet, but the hotel is not on a busy street, so I don't think it makes much of a difference. In the mornings, breakfast is served on the roof where one can choose to sit in the covered part filled with plants and flowers or on the open terrace. With fresh and dried fruits, yogurt, cereal, as well as fresh-baked goods and platters of cheese, olives and fresh vegetables, the breakfast was the perfect start to our days. At the end of the day, you can wind down on the terrace by enjoying drinks while enjoying the beautiful view of the water. The staff always served cut-up fruit and other snacks. Walking the hilly city all day gave us enough of a workout, but the hotel does have a small gym that is clean and, with two treadmills, two stationary bikes and free weights, well equipped. Free WiFi is also available, although a bit slow when we stayed there. We were told that the internet was being worked on at the time. However, other than checking a few e-mails, there was not much need for it since the hotel staff had all recommendations we were looking for. Whatever excursion we were in the mood for, Kemal, the front office manager, was able to tell us all about it and let us know the best way to get there, be it historical sites, restaurants, or just where to find a good selection of Turkish music CDs. All in all, I've stayed in many hotels, large and small, but the Hotel Niles is definitely one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “A Special Place”
Reviews.Author: mlfechtor
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting in the lobby of the Hotel Niles, using their free computer and wifi, because I simply could not wait until I got home to write this review. I have traveled to many different countries, and I have stayed in accomodations ranging from the most simple of hostles to some pretty lavish, cosmopolitan hotels, and I can honestly say that Hotel Niles is a very special place. Everyone is nice and helpful, and we have had some excellent chats with a few members of the hotel staff. The breakfast buffet (included in the price) that we have every morning on the rooftop terrace is delicious. All of the ingredients are fresh and some are even home baked. The rooms are quite simple, so do not be disappointed by the lack of bedroom decor, but they are very clean and well maintained. Although the twin rooms (suites are decorated differently) are lacking in visual interest, the rest of the hotel makes up for it. The rooftop terrace is overflowing with beautiful flowers and the downstairs lobby is elegantly decorated with various pieces of art on the walls and traditionally painted ceilings. Located in the old district of Sultanahmet, only 10 minutes away from most of the major tourist attractions, this quiet gem is really a spectacular find.

Reviews.Title: “HIGH marks for the Niles Hotel on ALL counts.”
Reviews.Author: dougnie
Reviews.Content: HIGH marks for the Niles Hotel on ALL counts. Anyone interested in a perfect place to stay in Istanbul that is situated on a quiet street very close to a tram stop, and easy walking to the Grand BAZAAR, Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. This is IT. The staff bends over backwards to please. Genuinely focused on taking care of every possible detail. They were particularly helpful in booking my side trip to Izmir, Selcuk, and Ephesus, and also sending my luggage back home via DHL. The breakfast on the roof terrace is compete and included. The roof is open 24/7. It is especially peaceful in the evening. Just be careful of a certain clever seagull that likes to steal food if you leave your table unattended. The standard room is perfectly clean and comfortable, but if you want to upgrade to a deluxe suite, they have those available too. The rates are truly reasonable. Internet access is free or free use of computer in lobby for checking emails. I would return in a heartbeat. Istanbul is the most extraordinary East meets West, old and new, fusion city of today. The Niles Hotel made for an ideal base to explore every aspect of the culture the city has to offer. Oh, and there is a discount if you pay in cash. All good. Have a great time. Doug in Tucson, AZ

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: t00thy
Reviews.Content: Great, quiet hotel with flawless service and lovely view from the terrace (where breakfast is served).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but the standard room was very standard”
Reviews.Author: travj1234
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the reception staff were just lovely - enthusiastic, helpful and smiling. We were disappointed with our standard room at first as we had quite high expectations based on tripadvisor reviews â€“ our room had some peeling wallpaper, small and old tv with fuzzy reception on most channels and a bathroom where you needed to be a gymnast to stand in it AND open the door at the same time to get out (see pics). They did show us images of the more premium suites which looked far more modern but also carried a hefty premium per night (50 Euros or so from memory). The hotel's roof area had a great view to the water and we spent an afternoon or two up there with beer in hand, and had breakfast there every day. Breakfast was toast, coffee, fruits and cereal with a couple of hot items. The location cannot be faulted - it's right near Grand Bazaar and a few hundred metres to Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia however set back a few streets so quiet at night. As with most of Istanbul there were a plethora places to eat and drink nearby and everything is really cheap. Every day the reception staff just got better - they learnt everyone's names, were super-friendly and advised us on what to see, do and where to eat. The gym was ok with treadmill and bikes and wireless internet worked throughout. So whilst our room was only OK, it was clean and the aircon worked. And the hotel staff were great and location very handy so it certainly grew on us. We would stay here again but would try to get a deal on staying in a suite and also weâ€™d probably stay a few days in the old town and a couple in the new town as there is just so much to see and do all over Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it ,it was great to stay in niles ,it is like staying home”
Reviews.Author: gulsun1
Reviews.Content: great hotel ,great staff ,specially KEMAL ,HE IS OUR MEN ANYMORE

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central and just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: prithim
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to the magical city of Istanbul, and Hotel Niles came highly recommended by friends and family, and I completely agree. It's location can't be beat... a few minutes walk up the winding street and you're at The Grand Bazaar and a tram station which connects you to the important tourist spots in the city. My mom and I shared a suite at first, since they didn't have a deluxe room the first night. It was large, very clean and could comfortably sleep 4. The next couple of nights were in a deluxe room, which is smaller, of course, but still clean and compact. Not much room for a lot of luggage, though. Our stay came with breakfast in the rooftop cafe. It has a good selection of breads, cereal, eggs, some turkish savory pastries and the best coffee I've ever had. The cafe overlooks the sea, so it's the perfect spot to enjoy a blue morning or a sunset. Overall, the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the city, especially Kemal who was at the front desk. I wish I had asked them about guided tours, but instead wandered around on my own, which was still fun. They did recommend a seafood restaurant to me one night, which I felt was an overpriced option, so I would suggest trying out one of the many restaurants near the bazaar or venture into Taksim for some nicer, less touristy choices. All in all, it's a nice, comfortable hotel in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sssooo Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Nessie-d86
Reviews.Content: we spent our honey moon in Istanbul and we stayed at Niles Hotel, it's a very good hotel, very clean the staff are so nice, they can help you to know Istanbul, you can ask them about the sites you should visit they will show you every thing. The hotel is situated in a very good area, near to grand bazzard, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. For the other sites you should take the tram but this is not a problem as Niles hotel is at 02 minutes from the tram station, so every thing is close. We liked this hotel very much and we liked Istanbul. Â

Reviews.Title: “WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: lssauer
Reviews.Content: Lovely people, lovely music and lovely flowers. Hotel Niles was a "away from home but at home" hotel. Excellent service, helpfull staff and wonderful soothing music to return to at the end of a wonderful day. Late nights on the deck was special with a glass of red wine and a plate of fresh fruit and a view over the habour! will always recommend to friends and who ever wants to travel but not spend all the money on accomodation! Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service- would definitely use it again.”
Reviews.Author: saoire1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2011 and I have been meaning to write a review since. It is in a good location-very close to the main tourist attractions (about 10 mins walk away) but nicely slightly out of the tourist loop. It is very claen, the breakfast was great and served in a roof top spot with great views. This same area has a small bar you can use at night with a friendly helpful bar man. While this hotel was friendly and helpful throughout our stay, I was most impressed with the service we received after we left- we had forgotten a camera charger which they posted to us, refused to take payment for the postage and emailed to check we received it- this is incredible service for what was not an expensive rate. Thanks to trip advisor for the recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Niles Hotel which I have ever stayed.......”
Reviews.Author: backstage_light
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Niles Hotel on May 27th for 3 nights.I have been in istanbul with my friends and stayed in a lovely Maisonnette. The Maisonnette was perfect and really accomodated even 5 people comfortably.The location of Hotel was absolutely perfect very close from the main Historical Momuments. Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sopia,Basilica Cistern..There are many things to do in Istanbul . At reception who works Kemal an Yilmaz were perfect educated and knows everything. They suggasted good restaurant, shopping mals,what to do in a Holiday ...They provided for us a City Map and started to tell every details of the city Istanbul. At breakfast who works Murat, Feridun were charming everytime when they see us. In over all, I can say this: Niles Hotel is the best hotel which I have ever stayed ...........

Reviews.Title: “Wait for us!”
Reviews.Author: LamaKay
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Niles! The staff was really friendly and helpful! We loved the hotel it was cosy and cute. We plan to visit Istanbul again hopefully and when we do we do plan on coming back to Hotel Niles! Thank you Hotel Niles for your great hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “once again istanbul - always niels hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HBMarta77
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to be in this pretty little hotel in the heart of istanbul. Quality of the service was great! I've never been in such friendly hotel. Rooms are quite small but very clean and comfortable. Tasty breakfast at the sunny terrace served for smiling service. Wait for me, I'll be definetely back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieisme
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in the penthouse suite at this hotel. The room was wonderful (although it was almost double the cost of some of the other rooms at the hotel). Tons of room, large bath with marble touches, fridge, flat screen TV. One of the prettiest rooms I've stayed in anywhere in Europe. It's located just below the rooftop terrace, but noise was never an issue. In fact, the hotel is remarkably quiet, and the soundproofing must be good, because I never heard the morning call to prayer. Many of the reviews mention the helpful, friendly staff. All true -- from the front desk to the rooftop staff. You couldn't ask for a nicer, friendlier group. Location is a two-minute walk to the tram. Two short stops and you're at the "main" attractions (which you can also walk to in 15 or so minutes). I loved the location because while it's close to everything, it's tucked into a less touristy area of the city. I was a bit nervous about that at first, but I walked to and from the hotel at all hours and always felt copmletely safe. I would highly recommend this hotel. And if you can stay in one of the suites, all the better. (I also stayed for several nights at The Niles' sister hotel, The Dersaadet, which I also highly recommend. It's quiet, is a two-minute walk from the Blue Mosque, and has a fantastic rooftop view of the Marmara and Bosphorus.)

Reviews.Title: “Very clean. Wonderful staff. Nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: dlevkovits
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Small, friendly and extremely clean. Close to the tram, steps from grand bazar and very friendly staff. My room (Standard Guest Room) was small, really not a lot os space, but it was ok. If you book trough the hotel website you pay a lot less than trough sites like expedia and travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A_Guy_in_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference in Istanbul and stayed at the Hotel Niles for a little extra vacation time as well. The hotel is located a few minutes from one of the tram stops so it is VERY easy to get to other parts of the city. The single and double rooms are small but a great value (especially if you can pay cash and get a few extra Euros off of the price). There are also suites and one room that has a bed downstairs and two single beds upstairs that would be perfect for a family traveling together (but only one bathroom -- so share!) Rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast is included and is pretty darn good, even after nine days! The staff is very friendly, particularly if you ask them to teach you a few words in Turkish that you can use outside the hotel. There is free internet in the hotel and a computer you can use in the lobby. There is a small workout room too with some weights and treadmills. I expect to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved, definitely a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NY123456789
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and clean, althoug not super big. Due to the location there is no street noise. So rooms are calm. Very helpful staff - the reply to emails in almost no time. Staff (especially Kemal) very helpful when booking tables at 360istanbul-restaurant etc. Try the suite - at least for one day. You can have your own "Hammam"-experience. Nice view from the terracce.

Reviews.Title: “We doubt whetgher you could find a better hotel for the money in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: paulvingoe
Reviews.Content: Althoug hthe room was fairly basic it was spotlessly clean, as was the whole hotel, and perfectly adequate for our stay. The roof terrace is a delight and the breakfast is excellent. What makes the hotel so special is the friendly and fantastic service from all the staff. We felt really welcome and nothing was too much trouble. We thoroughly recommend the Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bestfoodever
Reviews.Content: If you want to try and see most of Istanbul's most famous sites in just a few days (at a leisurely pace), come to Hotel Niles. The staff from the reception area to those cleaning your room to the roof top bartender were all reliable, friendly and helpful. Their level of service is what we'd like to see more of both in England and in parts of North America. Now let me write about the rooms. We didn't spend that much time in our rooms but it was good enough for what we needed. The air conditioning worked extremely well (even getting too cold at night so we turned it off). The shower and plumbing fixtures were top notch and well maintained. We could hear a bit of the city at night including pigeons in the morning but our current home is situated near a busier road so this was quieter for us. We did need think that the room was less functional than it could have been. There weren't too many places to unpack or hang clothes. The television was placed inconveniently on a mini fridge. The main room could use a few minor repairs (wall paper retouching and newer linens). The terrace upstairs is beautiful and we never had to wait for a seat at breakfast. The breakfast itself was just enough -- although we were a little disappointed at the yoghurt (thinner than usual) and there wasn't that much substantial food. Then again, my companion and I eat more breakfast than the average couple so we may not be fair on this point. The terrace is open 24 hours a day which makes it convenient for any wind-down drinks later at night or simply a nice conversation. Airport transfer was also quick and the drivers always very friendly. Never tried or sought out the gym room since we walked enough up and down inclines within Istanbul to not need further exercise! Great location (just steps from the tram and the Grand Bazaar entrance). Excellent service. Good accomodation. We had a very pleasant stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ephrem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Niles Hotel for 6 nights. It is well located near the grand bazar. A tram stop is 5 minutes from the hotel. You can walk (10/15 minutes) to the main tourist attractions in Sultanhamet and can easily reach BeyoÄŸlu and the Bosphorus by tram. Our room was a suite, it was quite nice and new but calling it a suite it's stretching a bit reality. Breakfast is good with a lot of options and it is served on the lovely terrace. Personnel is very helpful and kind. Most speak very good english. We were very satisfied of our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing: we couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Pups_Kalamaro
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Niles was just perfect: cozy and romantic rooms, great terrace overlooking the sea, tasty breakfast and outstanding service: this place is a gem! The hotel manager goes beyond providing great service: his advices are always appriciated, as well as the little homemade cookies awaing for you when you come back from a busy day. As an advice: do arrange transport to/from the airport with them, especially if you land from Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en airport: price and quality is fantastic, much better than a normal taxi.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrayHall
Reviews.Content: A good central location. The service is amazing. The staff are so kind and friendly and really make you feel that it is 'home'. If I was going to Istanbul again I'd certainly return to the Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, welcoming , friendly, perfect!”
Reviews.Author: nicolaluvsart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and where very impressed. The staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The rooms were lovely, tastefully decorated and super clean. Nice central location in walking distance of the main sights. When we return we will be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: fanella3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Niles and highly recommend it. The welcome at reception was very warm and remained that way until my rather reluctant departure, and the knowledgeable staff handled all my questions with ease. Accommodation was comfortable and very clean; buffet breakfasts were delicious with a nice variety; the location couldnâ€™t be better â€“ on a quiet street but just a minute or two from a major street and another few minutes to the Grand Bazaar; and excellent value for the money. When my stay was extended by one night shortly before leaving for Turkey, I was told I could not be accommodated at the Niles, but they offered to make a reservation for me at another nearby hotel for that night. At the last minute while en route to Istanbul, they informed me I could stay at the Niles after all and gave me the deluxe suite for the one night at the price of my standard room. My last day, having checked out early morning and returned for my luggage mid-afternoon, I was welcomed back with a cup of tea. I doubt many of the most exclusive hotels would provide such service without an extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “If you're fortunate to be able to get a room here, GO FOR IT!”
Reviews.Author: SWSMSCa
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel is. The personnel are helpful and gracious, the rooms are comfortable and the rooftop area view is awesome! Close to the tram, which goes everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LeoCPH
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have anything else to say about this hotel. I absolutely agree with all the positive reviews. But I just wanted to give the credit where the credit is due. I stayed at one of the suites and it's fantastic. And it gets even better if you realize the price you have to pay to get the quality. Location at Sultanahmet is perfect, easy to reach major Istanbul attractions and restaurants, off big street but easy to find taxi, the breakfast room is great. The suite is amazing, very clean and the bathroom is great. However, the main positive thing from me about this hotel is the staff and the service the gave throughout my 7 night stay. You can stay at the finest hotel building and bedroom with perfect location but it wouldn't be good if you don't get good service. So thumbs up for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Pactola
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right on for this hotel and we were very pleased with our 5-day stay. Kemal is great; so is the rest of the staff. The tram stop is only a couple of minutes away and there are many eating places near there. Saar (pronounced "shaar") is especially good. Turn right when exiting the front door and go up the narrow winding street for two blocks. Turn right and walk one block (past a nice Saar, but not quite as nice as this one), turn right again and it will be halfway down the block on the left. Breakfast at the hotel is great, the best we had while staying at six hotels in Turkey. Noise was at a minimum as it is away from a main traffic area and the narrow street is not conducive to much vehicular traffic. The Grand Bazaar is about 3 minutes away. The budget rooms offer no phone and a small TV with limited English channels. The internet works great.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near the historic area!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Jeffries
Reviews.Content: I have visited Istanbul six times now, and for last three visits I have stayed at Niles Hotel. It is a very pleasant hotel within walking distance of the historic area. Rates are very reasonable and staff are excellent in every way. I wouldn't stay anywhere else and highly recommend it to others looking for affordable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk went beyond the call of duty with informed friendly service and assistance; a pleasant hospitable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: urbotourist
Reviews.Content: The staff was gracious and helpful at all times; even to the extent of obtaining bus tickets to solve a trip disruption. The rooftop terrace for breakfast was relaxing and offered a large selection of choices. Be sure to have the phone number of the hotel at hand when dealing with taxis as the plethora of hotels in Istanbul are beyond the knowledge of some drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: rags60
Reviews.Content: Young couple stayed 4 nights in Istanbul suite. Located very close to Grand Bazaar and old town sites. About 1.5 blocks from train station (highly reccomend, very easy). Kemal is very knowledgeable and helpful. Room was spotless everday. Full breakfast and wifi included. Quiet side street, beds very comfortable. Rooftop bar area. Great value and room. Not most popular district, but updated hotel in safe area at good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hideaway in bustling Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: clydesider45
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles exceeded our high expectations from the moment we arrived. Hidden away in the textile district, but close to the Topkapi, Hagia Sofia and the Grand Bazaar. All of the staff, from reception to housekeeping and breakfast waiters were always helpful and willing. Our room - a suite - was beautifully furnished and equipped. In the unseasonal chill of April 2011, the underfloor heating in the magnificent marble bathroom was delightful suprise.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MaryJB_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and within easy walking distance of the major tourist sites. The rooms were comfortable, the roof terrace was great and the breakfasts were good value and had healthy choices. The staff were very helpful. We would recommend it for value for money. Rooms were quiet although we were woken by the early morning calls to parayer - but this was only to be expected in Istanbul with mosques at every street corner. The only difficulty was that some taxi drivers found it difficult to locate but we would show them the hotel card and they would ring the hotel for directions so it all worked out ok.

Reviews.Title: “The Niles Hotel Istanbul is a delightful boutique hotel with fabulous staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: curly050
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Niles Hotel in Istanbul and found the hotel to be of a very good standard, although the rooms are a little small and the television a little outdated , the overall experience was just fabulous. From the lobby areas to the covered balcony cafe (where breakfast is served) everything was tastefully decorated and exceptionally clean. The hotel staff were the friendliest I have encountered in many years of travelling (both for business and pleasure). I would have not hesitation in recommending this hotel and I look forward to staying there again when my husband and I are next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've been to”
Reviews.Author: Valentina3004
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was recommended to me by friends who had been there before - they told me it was very central, clean and lovely, and that the staff were extremely helpful and competent. I must say they were absolutely right! My friend and I had the most enjoyable stay and we strongly recommend this lovely, friendly hotel to anyone who's planning to visit Istanbul. The location is ideal (down the road from the Grand Bazaar and the Beyazit tram stop, and a short walk from the beautiful Sultanahmet and plenty of restaurants and cafes - including the most atmospheric water pipe garden you can dream of!). The room we had (the Suite) was beautiful and extremely comfortable. The (yummy) breakfast is served on the roof, from where you have a great view of the city and the Bosphorus. And all the people there were so nice and helpful, and spoke flawless English! It's very good value for money and I really cannot recommend it strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base”
Reviews.Author: Bararteg
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights - was very clean and staff were very helpful. Breakfast was great. Room was small but functional. Great location by the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, spotless, generous breakfast, beautiful terrace.”
Reviews.Author: MARWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights 2 weeks ago in a suite. Comfortable and quiet. Good location, friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Niles was like a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Sandra60713
Reviews.Content: The hospitality of the entire hotel staff was outstanding. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a central location ( very close to public transportation) and cleanliness. The breakfast was outstanding with a great view from the roof terrace. When visiting istanbul, the Niles Hotel will be where Iwill be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Pepper006
Reviews.Content: I could bet if those who stay at Four Seasons would have a better view during their breakfast... The staff is great and extremely helpful, and the location - although not perfectly quiet - is very good. The breakfast is delicious!! In the spare time you eventually get, you can taste some tea in the lobby. And if Istanbul itself is not enough to make you tired, try the tiny gym at the basement (rsrs). Guys, there's no way you can get your money better spent. The only thing I noticed was about the position of the TV in the room; but, frankly, there are more important things to concern about, when you're there, and the whole rest is very positive, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, well located and with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CavusFan
Reviews.Content: Overall the Hotel Niles is an excellent place to stay. Within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and Beyazit Square but also close to the tram which gives easy access to all the key sites in Istanbul, the staff were all really friendly and helpful. The orientation talk which reception offers was really useful - we used a couple of their recomended restaurants and followed their tips on what to see and when to go. The room was clean, well equipped and a good size - the only really minor problem being that it was a bit warm for our taste and the air conditioning was a little noisy for continuous use Being in a working street, leaving the window open gave you a nice cool room but also quite an early wakening on working days!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in the Old Town Section of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter7388
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a total of ten nights at Hotel Niles in April 2011. We selected this hotel in the Old Town section of Istanbul because of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed - this hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. We were impressed by the helpfulness of the reception staff as well as the friendliness of all staff. Everyone seemed to really enjoy working at Hotel Niles and making their guests fell welcome. We had a small room on the first floor that was pleasantly decorated and impeccably maintained. An extensive breakfast buffet was offered in the sunny glass-walled room on the top floor overlooking the Marmara Sea. The central location of the hotel â€“ just three short blocks from the Bayazit Tram station - was convenient. I look forward to staying at the Hotel Niles on my next trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING IN EVERY WAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: HelloKittyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I recently came back from a 1 week stay at Hotel Niles...and we could not be more pleased with everything! The hotel itself is very quaint, very much boutique style with the antique furnishing and warm reception. The staff was so wonderful....everyone was extremely helpful...Kamel, Muhrat, Selma, Yalmiz were in particular so amazing friendly!!! They made our stay there very memorable.....as did the breathtaking view on the rooftop terrace!!! We absolutely LOVED having breakfast there each morning, greeted warmly by the staff by a delicious breakfast...a variety of olives, veggies, fruit and yogurt, eggs done Turkish style with the great sauce!....coffee, tea, juice, bread, cold cuts, and chocolate cake to round it off! The view was stunning and we felt rejuvinated each morning...ready to start our adventure for the day! The hotel also connected with a great restaurant, and when we arrived home in the evening, we would order food to be delivered to the hotel...where the staff set out for us on the terrace...like having a restaurant right at the hotel....a wonderful surprise! I have traveled all over the world, and this was by far the most amazing hotel....with amazing service.....and for a great deal...it simply can't be beat!!! We will definitely be coming back to Hotel Niles....Tini and Lynda!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: s2708
Reviews.Content: Visited toe Niles Hotel for our Honeymoon. When we originally booked, there was only the standard room available and when I spoke to the rep from Expedia to explain it was our honeymoon he put a request through to the hotel if the upgraded room became available. When we got to the hotel we asked if our request had been successful and the receptionist told us it was not possible. When we went to our room it was very small and situated on the landing of the stairs coming down from the restaurant upstairs which got quite noisey in the mornings. Having gone back to reception to tell them, he told us we could upgrade (room ''suddenly'' became available) but at a price of an extra Â£330 each!! we decided to stick with our room as it wasnt worth it. From then on I was quite put off by the hotel. The breakfast choice was very average, but i think having seen other hotels in Istanbul it seemed to be the same all round. The staff were friendly and greeted us everytime we entered and left the hotel, they also offered good areas to visit. The location was great, only a 2 minute walk from the tram line (very conventient to take you anywhere!) and a cheaper way to travel and away from the noisey traffic. There were plenty of places to explore and to begin with I thought a week would be too long there, but it really wasnt. We visited the Sulemain Hammam which was a good experience, We went to an area called Ortakoy which is a must see! beautiful mosque on the sea front with lots of hidden restaurants, bars, clubs and sheesha cafes. We also spent most of our evenings in Taksim which was a much livelier area and a restarant called 'M&N' I highly recommend. I found Istanbul not to be very accomodating for vegetarians, and struggled with food choices, so stuck to M&N for their delicious soups. Be prepared, as it is also an expensive city, which we were not expecting. But overall a very beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Solo Woman!”
Reviews.Author: mfkane
Reviews.Content: This was a charming hotel with a wonderful staff. The decorations are lovely and the rooms are very clean--pretty exceptional for what you pay. The best feature is the delicious free breakfast on the glass-enclosed roof, overlooking the Bosphorous. It's located on a side street near many of the top sites. The location is nice if you have limited time, though it's also not a particularly quaint neighborhood if you're looking for atmosphere. The only other drawback is noise. The rooms are small and sound carries. I actually started out in a first floor room by the stairs, and asked to be moved further back. Still, I could hear the other guests at night and trucks on the street in the morning. All in all, I'm convinced you won't find a better value in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sharimck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after returning to Istanbul after 3 weeks of traveling throughout Turkey. Our last stay in Istanbul was at the White House Hotel, which I've also reviewed and can now compare to the Hotel Niles. They both have amazing hospitality and service, you would never find anything comparable in North America. They both have immaculately clean rooms, but the rooms at the Hotel Niles were larger for the same price. At the White House, we had 3 adults and 1 ten year old in a room with a double and two cots. A bit crowded! At the Hotel Niles, we had a Maissonette Suite, which was perfectly laid out for a family - two singles upstairs and a double down. Tons of room, and a huge beautiful bathroom. The White House was possibly better located to the major tourist attractions, but the Hotel Niles is close to the Grand Bazaar. Both are located right by the tram line, which makes it easy to get anywhere in the city. If I go back to Istanbul, I would choose the Hotel Niles only because the room was much larger for the same price. The rooftop breakfast terrace Hotel Niles also has a lovely view of the harbour, whereas at the White House, the breakfast was served in the basement. Both breakfasts were good. Our room at the Hotel Niles was lovely and dark, as well as quite soundproof and the bed was lovely and comfortable. We had our best sleep of our trip here and the 6 AM Call to Prayer didn't wake us up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ArthurD6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Niles, like most Hotels in Istanbul it is located on a narrow cobblestone street about 2 blocks off the Main street. This allowed it to be nice and quiet. We ate breakfast on their covered enclosed roof top restaurant every morning and had a glass of wine most every evening. It was delightful, there is a good ocean view from your dining spot. The rooms are spotless and made up each morning with fresh towels and a thoroughly wiped down bathroom and shower. The shower is huge, like a Turkish bath house it has an area to sit and douse yourself with warm water from a bowl, we preferred a standard american shower. We were on the 4 th floow and happy to use the quaint elevator each evening after traisping around Istanbul all day. The location is perfect, about 2 blocks to the Grand Bazaar and 4-5 blocks from the Topaki Palace, Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia church/mosque, so you are centered in the main part of old town. The desk staff , both day and evening were very helpful and we were treated very kindly....I would highly recommend this small clean spotless hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: malifact
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location and within easy walking distance of a tram stop and close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other sites. The hotel staff were polite and friendly without being instrusive or over familiar. The top floor has a cafe, but no restaurant. If you want a meal they will order it in for you, but please note they get the food from a local takeaway (it's still pretty good). The breakfast buffet is decent. The rooms are very basic, but are clean and comfortable. The only downside is during our stay it was quite noisy in the mornings outside the hotel, so you probably can't have a lie in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel with great breakfasts and very conveniently located in an area close to the sights but not too touri”
Reviews.Author: ClareB_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk from Beyazit tram so easy for the sights and easy for the airport. Clean sheets, delicious breakfast in a lovely roof terrace and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kipofo
Reviews.Content: Very nice, well kept and clean hotel very close to the main highlights and the tram-station. The breakfast was great! The bar on the top floor is open for 24 hours! The stuff was very friendly, especially Feridun and Yilmaz! If we would visit Istanbul again, we would choose Niles again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles is a very charming and comfortable hotel with dedicated and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sparkstraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and would highly recommend it. The double rooms are very good value, but if you are willing to spend a little bit more the suites are gorgeous! The staff is very friendly and willing to help with giving tips about the city and any other help you might need. Hotel Niles is conveniently located near the Beyazit tram line, quickly connecting to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque (2 stops or less than 10 minutes walking) and the modern district of BeyoÄŸlu (great nightlife, shopping, restaurants, etc) is just a few more stops away. There is a lovely rooftop garden with a good buffet breakfast as well and the places scores high on cleanliness. Hotel pickup for 25 euros was also convenient. Very nice boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “you will be made to feel at home in this gem of a hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VoyageCafe
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel Niles in Istanbul and highly recommend the hotel (as well as the beautiful city of Istanbul as a travel destination)!! The hotel is in a fantastic location, within easy walking distance to many historical sites including the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar etc. The rooms are reasonably priced and include a good breakfast that is served on the top-floor, offering lovely views of the sea. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfortable, quiet and nicely decorated for their price-range (the TV is quite small but Istanbul is such a beautiful city and our days were so full that we did not once think of using it!!). For those with a slightly larger budget they also have beautiful suites available (maybe next time we will splurge a bit and go for one). But the main reason that I would recommend this hotel is because of the friendly staff and great service!! Upon arrival at the hotel we were greeted with friendly smiles, a warm welcome to Istanbul, and some hot mint tea. We especially appreciate all of the great restaurant advice, and daily ideas of places to visit in all parts of the city from Mr. Kemal Ã‡elik, the front office manager (who speaks excellent English). Thanks Kermal!!

Reviews.Title: “Exploring Istanbul gets even better with a stay at Hotel Niles, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sanjana2805
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, old-world charm feel. Very conveniently located right in the city centre of Old Istanbul. Across the road from Grand Bazaar and Instanbul University, less than 10 minutes walk from Sultanahmet square - which has the historic monuments such as Blue Mosque, Saint Sofia and TopKapi Palace. The Beyazit Tram Station is just across the road makes it brilliantly connected to the Aiport (approx an hour away) and other places in the city.And the "best part" of the hotel is its staff. Genuinely warm, friendly and courteous. Converse well in English. Ever-smiling and ever-helpful with all the queries. The check-in and check-out formalities was completed less than 5 minutes - very efficient working and staff had kept everything ready to ensure no waiting time. Breakfast is served on the rooftop overlooking Marmara Sea. The spread was delightful and local Turkish food makes it even more interesting. Although breakfast is served from 8 a.m. onwards - and we reached the roof-top at 0730 hrs; we were welcomed and not shooed away. The spread was all set and ready for the early morning risers. With all the convenience just a walk away - the hote is good value for money - goes easy on the pocket if you are on a leisure /back-pack trip.Thank you all at Hotel Niles. My daughter and I had a wonderful stay. A home a way from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: stevenboris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but provides big service. The room is large by European standards, very well kept and includes free WiFi as well as BBC and CNN on the TV. If you don't want to work in your room, there is a small business center in the lobby with a printer. Breakfast was included in the US$50.00 per night single off season cash price and was a hearty buffet located on the (enclosed) roof terrace. The terrace is open all day in order to have a cup of tea, get a drink, etc. Fianlly, teh front desk was fantastic: English speakers provided great restaurant tips and arranged for private pick-up and return to the airport. One of the very best small hotels I've ever visited anywhere on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “NIce and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Elin1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for an extended weekend and really enjoyed the hotel itself, the location and the atmosphere. Hotel Niles gives good value with it's standard and the walking distance to all main attractions in the old town. Loved having breakfast at the roof terrace, with a view of Bosporus. Staff were friendly and helpful. We recommend a visit to the 450 years old Turkish bath Suleyimaniye Hamam offering treatment for couples together. Spectacular surroundings, professional masseurs and a nice experience. Price is ok and you get picked up by minibus from the hotel, even though it's not far in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location and comfortable accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: kghent
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Hotel Niles. The reservation process was easy - the hotel reservation staff was responsive to my inquiries and spoke fluent English. The location was great - off the busy roads, but close to the bus stop, and a short walk to the Grand Bazaar. The hotel was clean and modern, staff was very friendly and accommodating, and breakfasts were delicious. We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: KpK_48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Niles Istanbul in march and found it to be delightful. The staff was wonderfully kind, courteous and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms were just perfect for our needs, and offered all of the amenities we desired. The central location, just minutes away from the Grand Bazaar was also ideal. We could use the Metro rail to get around the city and taxi drivers knew that part of town well, alleviating any transportation difficulties we might otherwise have experienced.In our experience, we look forward to a return visit - and we hope it will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne2321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Niles for 3 nights. The hotel is lovely, has lots of characher. Rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. The hotels location is also excellent - less than a 10 minute walk to the main attractions. The location of the hotel worked well as a base for doing lots of walking tours around this wonderful city. Would most definately recommend this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value & service”
Reviews.Author: frank_alison
Reviews.Content: 5 star service & cleanliness, a quiet location near the Beyazit tram which is a great way for getting about the city. The room was perhaps on the small side but for the price paid we got terrific value for money. The staff couldnt have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's pronounced knee-less... and stay here if you're ever in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Onwi03
Reviews.Content: This place is a three star hotel that oozes five star quality. I knew something was up when the arranged taxi parked by the entrance and the concierge came out with a huge smile and a warm greeting welcoming me to the city. Beautiful property, location that can' be beat, great value... I'll get to all that. But it was the service that really impressed me. You just don't stay at many hotels where the concierge will walk out the door with you after checking out and stand at the doorstep and wave goodbye as the taxi whisks you away. That's something my mom does let alone the front desk staff at a hotel. Location-wise this hotel is perfect. I used arranged transportation to and from the airport but also had the option of public transportation since the Beyazit tram stop is a short walk away. All the major sites are nearby so I never felt the need to curtail exploration by taking the buses or tram. I was able to walk to Galata Tower and up most of Istiklal Avenue from the hotel. That's a lot of walking... and my legs felt it at the end of each day. For the closer sites it was nice to be able to easily reach the hotel if I needed to nap or take a break during the day. There's also a little store down the street where you can stock up on snacks and supplies. I booked one of the suites and the room was beautiful. Check out the pics. Now I gave five circles for value but take into consideration that I went during the off-season and there was a special rate for suites when I booked. (Little note for those not wanting to get lost - there are two separate staircases: one for the suites and one for regular rooms. Got lost the first day thinking my room had disappeared.) The marble bathroom had a heated floor. Traditional Turkish decor throughout. Tiny little TV but that's not what you're there for. There's a king bed and a twin that also acts as a couch if you're alone. I can say that after a long day of wandering the confusing streets I always looked forward to coming back to my room. There's a daily breakfast on the rooftop terrace every morning. I posted pics of the buffet spread so you can get an idea of what you're getting. Sometimes it's late at night and you don't want to walk somewhere to get food. The hotel has a menu from a local restaurant down the street... it's actually near the little convenience store. The doorman/bellhop would whip out the menu and make some great recommendations on what to order. They deliver it to your room on a plate and you can take it upstairs and have a nice little dinner with a view. If you actually had the energy after a full day of walking there are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. I was a big fan of Sar. You'll see this place on the right side of the main road that follows the tram when walking towards Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. They have a place of the same name around the corner from that location... eat there instead since it's much nicer. Just turn right on the first side street that you see when you pass Sar and you'll see it about half a block down. Service-wise the staff was amazing. You get extra points when a new concierge whom I've never met knows your name when you go downstairs in the morning. When you venture out for the first time you get the orientation. They pull out a nice little map and teach you the basics of getting around, where to eat, where to go, you name it. They booked me for the Turkish Dance Night at Hodjapasha show on a Saturday night... I highly recommend this outing. It looks like I've written a short story here but I think you get the gist of what I'm saying. Hotel Niles is a fantastic hotel with staff that genuinely care about your stay and experience in this amazing city. I'd stay here again without question. Heck, I wouldn't be surprised if they remember me the next time.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: tempolinse
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Niles Hotel for a week. A friend recommended the hotel to us and we are very grateful for that. The staff is always very helpful and friendly, the rooms are nice and clean and the breakfast buffet is just great (and you can enjoy a nice view from the roof terrace where it is served). It is very close to a lot of attractions - like the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market, the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and it's situated in an interesting neighborhood where you can get an impression of the daily life. There also is a tram nearby with which you can get to other interesting places as Beyoglu or the ferries. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JPaulDunnigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 5 nights. The service was superb at the front desk and in the dining terrace. We had a junior suite with a full Turkish bath that was so enjoyable we actually photographed and measured the bathroom so that we can recreate it in our own home. The Hotel Niles is in a great location within a few blocks walking distance to every major site in the old city. The staff are very helpful for arranging airport transfers, recommending restaurants or making any kind of tourism arrangements you may need. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully welcoming”
Reviews.Author: interestedbaltimore
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Niles. They were absolutely welcoming & wonderful. Our room was in the new section & it was very comfortable and large. It was nice to have the ability to make coffee/tea & heat something in a microwave. We felt very well taken care of with the staff- everyone was so pleasant & quick to help with anything we needed. We thought the breakfast area was lovely...the sound of the birds & the view of the water in the distance was nice. What else can I say except they do a remarkable job making you feel like you are at home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: NathanQ_11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a fantastic stay at the Hotel Niles. The front counter service was friendly, and very informative. Everything from Taxis to Restaurants were organised for us in a professional and helpful manner. Even though we didn't enjoy the best weather whilst in Istanbul, Hotel Niles was a warm and very comfortable place to come back to. The rooftop terrace was amazing for breakfast. The location is very central and very accessible to the Grand Bazaar and historic peninsula and for trips further away, very central to the tram station.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weatherornot2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and very nicely decorated, but as nice as the atmosphere was, the staff were even better. I've never been to a hotel with nicer and more helpful staff. The housekeeping really went the extra mile and even folded a pair of my husband's socks that he'd left out and the office manager was very knowledgeable about the city and where to find everything. They loved our baby and were very good with her as well. The breakfast was very good. The room was a little small, but relatively quiet and very comfortable. The location is good, it's only a block away from the grand bazaar and a 10 minute walk or so from the blue mosque and Hagia Sophia. We really loved staying here and I was a little sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles: a bit overated.”
Reviews.Author: vale77Treviso
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Niles, we don't have nothing to complain but nothing to be enthusiastic as well, frankly I think is overated from tripadvisor's reviews. The hotel is close the tramway stop of Beyasit/Gran Bazar but is a narrow, dirty and dark street, the view from the terrace where the breakfast is served is not so charming, you can see the bosforus but even the surrounding buildings, our standard room was quite simple and small ( we had not a suite). A good mark to the staff , waiters and receptionists are very polite, professional, fluent english speaking. I advise this hotel but I don't agree with such a high position in the chart of istanbul's hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: woodard158
Reviews.Content: this is a great little hotel in the old city near the grand bazaar and a short walk to the blue moque/hagia sofia areas. it is clean, comfortable and has outstanding service from its employees. we stayed for 3 nights in the suite - very nicely decorated and very comfortable - and were treated with great hospitality by kemal and the other staff. the rooftop breakfast area is charming with views of the marmara and the sound of birds. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE, PERSONAL SERVICE, GOOD ENGLISH SPEAKING STAFF”
Reviews.Author: onenightinistanbul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Istanbul for business. Hotel Niles is located in the heart of the Fashion District of Aksaray, in Istanbul. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the service was as smooth and as attentive as it could be...believe me, I have not had that type of personal service at some of the best 5 star hotels in North America. Hotel Niles is highly recommended. The breakfast on the roof Garden is superb, and what an incredible view of the Port of Istanbul...Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL AND STAFF IN ISTANBUL-NO QUESTION”
Reviews.Author: mooz110
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Turkey in 3 years,and my first time @ hotel Niles. Firstly,Mr.Kemal thank you very much to you and all your staff for the best service you all gave us,i dont remember everyone by name . This boutique hotel is modern,well furnished and the rooftop terrace is great place to start the day with a lovely breakfast and we made new friends with fellow canadians. The location is a stone's throw from the grand bazaar and the beyazit tram stop. I was sad leaving that friday afternoon and as we waited for our shuttle to pick us up,Mr.Kemal even brought us turkish tea very kind of him and i call that service at it's best.Unfortunately our shuttle showed up and we did not get to enjoy our tea until next time. The hotel is very accomodating,we were able to check out slightly late also. Mr. Deniz Duyar,the owner has done a great job. They also have a hotel in sultanhamet,for those who prefer to be close to the tourist sites called Dersaadet hotel. Thank you to all the staff at Hotel niles,and i did remember two other staff at the rooftop terrace,Salma and Gem.Gem only works when his school is closed for bayram,he is actually the son of one of the staff. Husain,Canada

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles played a huge part in how much I enjoyed Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: JaneEO
Reviews.Content: I was so thrilled with the decision to stay at Hotel Niles in Istanbul. It was in a fantastic area, the staff there were so friendly and helpful by the end of my stay I was sad to leave them! The rooms were beautifully decorated, large, authentic and clean. I loved the roof top bar/restaurant. It was the best place I stayed while in Turkey and Greece. I couldn't recommend Hotel Niles highly enough to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly excellent service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: flkirkham
Reviews.Content: Our stay was extended from one to two weeks because of the ash cloud. All the staff took great efforts to ensure outr enforced time with them was a pleasant as the first, booked week had been. The reception staff were superb with excellent local knowledge and willingness to keep calling the airport on our behalf. They also organised laundry for us which was turned round vry quickly. Our holiday covered two birthdays , and on both occassions the management presented flowers and gifts. The hotel is 5 mins walk from the excellent tram system so everywhere is very easily accessible

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: 237ajax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the maisonettes for 9 nights and the extra space was nice for such a long stay. Breakfast was served on the rooftop cafe and there was plenty of variety for all tastes. The staff gave pretty good recommendations on places to eat and things to do and we did not have a loser once. All of the staff were friendly and helpful and I would encourage anyone staying at the hotel to engage them.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service, beautiful room and great location.”
Reviews.Author: veronicaflores10
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Niles was extremely attentive and knowledgable. Every suggestion the made to us for dinner was absolutely delicious. The location was very close to the Grand Bazaar and within walking distance of all the main sites in Historic Istanbul. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: bbsofla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Niles for about a week while visiting Istanbul, based largely on positive reviews online. When arriving in the evening, after many hours of travel, my initial reaction was to wonder if I had made a mistake: the surrounding streets were dark, sketchy, and strewn with garbage. First impressions, arriving at night, were not positive. The hotel lobby, though, was inviting, and I received an enthusiastic welcome from the desk clerk. My room proved to be clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, if basic. Breakfast the next morning -- served in the rooftop cafe -- was an awesome way to start the day (even if the never-changing selection of items became pretty boring after a few days). As I learned my way around the area, I realized that the streets being strewn with garbage seems to be a nightly occurrence: rather than put things in bins or bags, local merchants pitch their refuse on the street. It is gone in the morning... but, if you arrive late at night be prepared to be unimpressed with the area, which is not particularly scenic to begin with, and is even less welcoming when covered with refuse. The great thing about the hotel's location is that it is within easy walking distance of the tram and all the major historic attractions in Sultanahmet. Restaurants are overpriced in this area, so my routine was this -- fill up on a hearty breakfast at the hotel, visit monuments in the morning, and then seek out another neighborhood off the tourist track for lunch and dinner. There are plenty of tasty and inexpensive options throughout the city, but finding non-touristy options in Sultanahmet requires some effort. If you are interested in nightlife, this may not be the best area for you, but there are some cool cafes and hookah bars that stay open late in the area. If I had it to do over again, I would probably split my stay between Sultanahmet and Beyoglu -- or consider staying in Beyoglu the entire time. (I particularly enjoyed my day trip to the Asian side, but staying there would be impractical.) The Hotel Niles proved to be a reliable, safe, and pleasant -- if slightly bland -- place to stay. I'd recommend it, unless you are intent on partying all night long on Istiklal Cadessi, in which case you should consider something nearer to Taksim, probably, since the trams don't run very late.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendly Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BHillyard
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was recommended by some friends at work and they were spot on with all that they had said. The front office staff along with the bellman, housekeepers and food service were all very accomodating and friendly. The morning breakfast was very well presented and most of all, great tasting and representitive of the local culture. They were also helpful in transportation and local advice. What a great bargin to enjoy a fantastic week.

Reviews.Title: “five stars for 2-3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: phand11
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean, good location and price, good staff. Don't expect more than 2-3 star facilities in the room and hotel, but if you are more interested in istanbul than hanging out in the room, that is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “As enjoyable as the rest of this wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Karlski
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Niles for four nights with my girlfriend. We had one of the 'new suite' rooms, so comments are all based on those rather than a standard room. The overall experience was superb. The room was exceptionally clean, comfortable, well-sized and decorated in a cute and welcoming way, exactly as described on the website. I particularly liked the bathroom: done completely in handsome striped marble, the layout and decor made what was a normally-sized bathroom feel enormous, and the addition of a Turkish bath style bowl was very welcome. Wireless internet was free and fast, a pleasant bonus. Housekeeping exceeded expectations - room left spotless, personal possessions carefully and neatly placed, truly excellent service, which was in keeping with the rest of the staff, who were all eager to be helpful without being oppressive. Breakfast in the adorable roof room/terrace was included in the room rate which meant that I considered this very good value for money. Terrace has a nice view of the Marmara in the distance, breakfast selection is good though not outstanding. However everything was fresh and appetizing and there was enough variety to have something different each morning we were here so can't complain really! Location was also wonderful for our purposes. We wanted somewhere close to the tourist action but not actually located right in the main tourist bit, and with good links to elsewhere in the city. The Niles fits the bill as it is right across from the Grand Bazaar (though in a quiet, normal neighbourhood side street), comfortable walking distance from the main attractions such as the Blue Mosque etc, and right next to a tram station from which the vast majority of locations can be reached. Some might prefer to be in a nicer area or right in the heart of the action, but for our purposes this was perfect. I recommend the Niles 100% and will certainly stay again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and lovely people.. :)”
Reviews.Author: radhikaseth
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is a beautiful place with lovely people.. Everyone is sooo warm and considerate.. We felt at home there.. The location is perfect... U can appreciate the best part of Istanbul by just walking to the best places... The blue mosque, thje Topakapi Palace.. The breakfast served is amazing.. I am a vegetarian and my husband non- vegetarian.. We had our stomachs filled everyday.. with a rather extravagant spread..! The rooms are nice.. especially if u take the suites and the hotel is pretty... warm and cozy.. I would love to go back and stay there again! Thabnk u guys. Radhika n Pranav Pune, India

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jarejoro
Reviews.Content: We have been a whole week in this hotel, the standard room was very clean, bathroom was quite small. The service of the staff is great, always willing to help. Location of the hotel is close to the main touristic places and from the closeby metrostop & busstation it is easy to get to other places in the city. Restaurants are at walking distance. From the topfloor there is a great view over the Bosporus and the Asian part of Istanbul A minus is the relative small breakfast room in particular when the weather is bad and everybody has to sit inside

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: DaudM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Istanbul last month (late October). We stayed at Hotel Niles for 13 nights. Since the time of our arrival till departure, we can only say it was very enjoyable. From the Owner/Operator to the regular staff, we felt very comfortable and always at home. They were extremely friendly, helpful and honest people. Our room was cozy and quiet. Housekeeping always did an excellent job of changing all the linen, etc .. when we returned each evening from our excursions outdoors, we would always enter a clean and freshly made up room. The Breakfast itself was very substantial and offered a variety of home baked cookies to the cereals, eggs, cheeses, juices, teas and coffees. The location itself was spectacular, we could see the Marmara sea from the rooftop. The Staff that waited the Rooftop restaurant were again extremely courteous and hospitable and spoke multiple languages with the various guests who visited from different countries. The Location of the Hotel was just ideal and perfect. We were in close proximity of the Tramway (which ran through all touristy spots) , the Grand Bazaar, small roadside cafes, Money Changers and convenience stores. The Hotel though small in size, felt ,looked and serviced like any good 5star establishment. During our memorable stay we forged new friendship with the staff there - Kemal, Onur, Yilmaz, Sami, Murat, Selma are a few to mention. Thanks for the wonderful stay. We will surely return the next time we visit. Brgds Daud and Farah Malik.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately return to this hotel, and have reccomended to our friends”
Reviews.Author: memzie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value,the staff were very helpful and hospitable,they were always on hand to help, offer advice about places to visit and how to get there. The hotel has a fantastic roof top terrace that offers brilliant views of the Bospherus.The hotel is really well situated for all the main attractions,and for the Tram that is a two minute walk away.Although the hotel doesn't have a restaurant,the staff offer to order food for you from the many restaurants that are locally situated. They do provide a excellent breakfast,fit for a Sultan! The bed was the really comfortable and the rooms were pleasant with TV and fridge. A special thank you to Kemal and his staff I

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: anniwhere
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The location was great (although the hotel is on a side-street which is kind of dark in the evenings) and the staff were amazingly nice and helpful. I loved the rooftop lounge/restaurant and the breakfast was very good. The public areas were beautiful. My room was nothing special (basic), but it was clean and I had more than enough space. Some people might find the noise from the street annoying but I have no problem with that. I used the hotel's chauffer service to and from the airport and I recommend it. Quick, easy and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay in Istanbul as a tourist”
Reviews.Author: galanas
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our friends for four nights in November. It's really close to all main historic places - in walking distance. One of the clearest hotels and rooms I've ever stayed at. Kemal, the front desk manager, is always eager to help you. Would reccomend to everyone, especially going to Istanbul for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coolangatta68
Reviews.Content: A family run hotel. Very impressed with hotel and staff. Stayed 5 days in a fourth floor suite overlooking the Sea of Marmar and the port. Grand views of the surrounding neighbourhood from our balcony. Suite tastefully decorated with a Turkish motif. Loved the marble bathroom. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Arranged with hotel to be picked up at airport which proved to be an excellent idea. A reasonably priced hotel in a good location within walking distance of many attractions. The roof terrace was delightful for breakfast and for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles is a fabulous boutique hotel with great service at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Major007
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Hotel Niles for anyone looking for great lodging and serivce at a reasonable price! The location was within a 10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and 15 minutes from the major historical sites (Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Cistern, etc.). The immediate area surrounding the hotel did not have much going on but that made for peaceful evenings. The hotel staff was by excellent - Kemal the front desk manager was always available to answer any questions we had about restaurants or directions and also provided a free map for our reference. The other staff was always ready to hold the doors for us and greet us with a smile. The hotel owner was very helpful and contacted another hotel we stayed at in Kusadasi after we lost something there. He did not hesitate to make all necessary calls. The breakfast was fabulous - included a wide range of hot and cold food (eggs, meat, breads, yogurt, fruit, veggies, sweets, etc.) as well as coffee, juice and tea. The garden terrace on the top floor was an oasis - beautiful views as well as charming environment with seating both inside and outside. The aspects of the hotel that were less enjoyable were the thin walls - made it a bit difficult to sleep when other guests arrived late and were going up and down the halls and shutting doors. The rooms were very clean and adequately decorated/furnished - simple but adequate. Small refrigerators were in the room as well. We can't say enough positive things about Hotel Niles and will stay there again if we ever find ourselves back in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and clean comfortable rooms for a good price”
Reviews.Author: marykk2010
Reviews.Content: Kemal and Tilmet at the front desk answered our endless questions and were all around very kind and welcoming. They competently arranged transport for 7 or 8 hotel guests to the U2 concert outside of Istanbul in Sept. Would recommend as a great option near the Grand Bazaar and other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice public areas but poor location and room too small”
Reviews.Author: Lydia19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Niles in October for four nights. We stayed in a standard room and found it to be much too small, with no storage space and barely anywhere to put our two suitcases - there was no dresser and the closet held only a few hangers. The bathroom was very small with no storage room except for a small shelf above the sink. We tried to get a larger room but none were available for the first two nights of our stay, and we decided not to bother to move everything for the last two nights. The rooftop lounge/restaurant was lovely as was the lobby. Our hotel room was clean and the staff throughout the hotel was very nice. The main problem we had, aside from the room size, was the area in which the hotel was located. It was in the garment district and there were workers coming and going all hours of the day and night. They were sewing late into the night in upstairs rooms, and opening and closing industrial type doors well past midnight. We found it noisy. We also found there to be a lack of restaurants in the immediate area. We would have preferred to have stayed closer to the Blue Mosque and the Haiga Sophia or else on the water, for the view. While we were able to walk to the major attractions in about 15 minutes, we would have preferred to have been close to some nice restaurants. To get to the main street, we had to walk up a dark road, past men selling knock off clothes and purses, and found it a bit sketchy. The room rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here - it's still fabulous & I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: havachatkiwi
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the changes that have been made to the ground floor recpetion area. The whole hotel's decor is very classy. Seda, the receptionist, has left to become an air hostess with Turkish Airlines but the new staff are doing well. It was nice to see that a lot of the staff from last year were still there. My room was perfect but it would have been great if there was a luggage rack in the room. Makes it a bit easier for repacking a suitcase for an international flight before heading home. Bed mattress was slightly hard but that's really a matter of preference to each individual traveller. The fluffy white duvet/doona was just lovely. Communications by email were responded to quickly and very satisfactorily. I would recommend the hotel's chauffer service to and from the airport over and above services you can book on-line through Ataturk Airport. I used the latter and the mini bus smelt of smoke and the front seat belt did not work. I will be back to using the hotel's service again next time.

Reviews.Title: “There is a god”
Reviews.Author: RichardJ2307
Reviews.Content: This is from the open air restaurant on the top of the Nils hotel 100 yards from the Bosphorus dividing Europe from Asia. At this location â€“ which is really central Istanbul - the estuary must be 15 miles wide. Lying at anchor are around 100 merchant vessels, from 100 foot coasters taking various goods around the Turkish coastline and beyond to the Black Sea, up to 100 yard long dry bulk carriers destined for ports in other continents and other cultures. They must all be awaiting docking times and spaces further up river or ownersâ€™ instructions as to where to collect their next cargo. Right now the sun is glistening on their sides up to 10 miles away down river. It is a just amazing sight. There must be more tonnage at anchor here than the whole Allied Mediterranean fleet in the second world war. Itâ€™s 82F (28C) with 15% humidity and no wind at all. Perfect. Alongside this balcony swallows are flitting to and fro feeding voraciously on little insects. Small bunches of starlings wheel and swoop together nearby and out over the water in what seems a delight to be alive and acting exactly in concert with no need to explain how. The odd three foot span seagull drifts past in an arrogant but wasted show of self-appointed superiority. As the sun is setting the utterly clear, eggshell blue sky is becoming infused with ochre and crimson on the western horizon. The colour changes rise from behind the mysterious variety of roofs and chimneys. Across the river, looking south, the horizon is slowly going milky white as the sea and city haze ushers the fading light into dusk and darkness. And then â€“ the most astonishing visual triumph. All the vessels lying anchored offshore are manned. They need their own lights on, not navigation lights and not lights for public entertainment, but their real working lights. One by one, from the smallest to the largest, as darkness falls, their lights come on. Because of the haze over the river all the lights twinkle as they would from distant stars. Itâ€™s the moment to stop speaking. From 100 yards away to maybe 20 miles away every boat is now alight. And that time brings the calls of the muezzin to the faithful to prayer. Simultaneously, but not unpleasantly or intrusively, from the major mosques all over the city.
