Itâ€™s just an incredibly emotive time and so unfamiliar to Westerners that it almost beggars description. That lasts just a couple of minutes and now the sun has set. To finish the whole thing (and me) off, the rooftop restaurant has started playing Mozart gently to its customer (me). Itâ€™s been said before that when the angels play for God they play Bach. When they play for themselves itâ€™s always Mozart. Iâ€™m not sure that the vacation life gets better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: patricia051
Reviews.Content: Rooms are generally available for much less than the full rate - ours came to about $80 a night, and it is good value for the money. Good location - It's a ten minute walk to the Blue Mosque, or you can take the tram, which is two blocks away. the rooms are small and basic but clean and reasonably comfortable. The roof-top lounge and outside area are always open as is a small garden on the first floor, and you can hang out there. Breakfast is fine with enough choices that everyone should find something they like. There is no restaurant but one nearby will deliver. The staff was consistently cheerful and helpful. The business center was a computer you could use if no one else was on it, but there is free wifi in all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cuteluke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a suite room. The room, hotel, location, staff, breakfast, decor were all great. We arrived at 2 AM and were graciously received. We enjoyed sitting on the roof top deck as well as relaxing in the downstairs lobby. One night, we took advantage of the arrangement that the hotel has with a restaurant down the street. We ordered dinner off the menu via the Hotel Niles staff. Withiin 15-20 minutes, dinner arrived and we enjoyed our meal on the deck. Wireless internet in the rooms was a nice touch. There was also a computer in the lobby for guest use. The hotel was very quiet at night and we were glad to be out of the main tourist district. In our opinion, the walk up the hill to the main street was not difficult, but this depends on what you are used to. As mentioned previously, it's about a 10 minute walk to the main sites. On the day that we left, we had an early morning flight. We were invited to have breakfast, even though it was before the posted breakfast time. This was greatly appreciated. We had a similar situation the year previous and the B&B in Sorento was not at all interested in even providing a cup of coffee. The shuttles to and from the airport were reliable and efficient, even when we arrived after midnight and had to leave early in the morning. We don't know about the other rooms, but we were extremely pleased with the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended without reservation”
Reviews.Author: 60plusretiree
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia because it had good reviews there and we were not disappointed. Our room was perfectly big enough, it had everything we needed, the beds were clean and comfortable, the bathroom was small but perfectly adequate and everything was clean and worked properly. We overlooked the front of the hotel and the road below was bustling every work day which gave a little noise early in the morning, but not enough to disturb us, and actually we enjoyed being in this part of the city just for its busy quality. We were a short walk from the nearest tram stop and that took us to all the sights we were interested in. The terrace restaurant is a real delight, and we were able to sit outside in the sunshine for breakfasts and under the nearly full moon for night caps even in late October (be aware though that drinks are priced in Euros rather than Turkish Liras). Breakfasts were more than adequate and the waiters could not have been more friendly or helpful. Actually the staff are the real highlight of the Niles Hotel - they are well trained, speak excellent English for those of us whose Turkish is only basic, they are informative, attentive and obliging. If you're a retired couple like us who don't want 5* luxury but rather excellent value for money and a hotel of real Istanbul character, the Niles is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience...didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Explorer11563
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the new suites at the Hotel Niles. The room was beautifully designed and decorated, the bed comfortable, and the bedding soft and cozy. The bathroom was spacious, with the best hot shower I had in two weeks in Turkey. The hotel serves a plentiful breakfast on its roof, with both indoor and outdoor seating. In addition, the roof area is opened 24 hours a day, and you can purchase alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks and snacks. The roof has a view of the sea, and it is a fine place to sit and relax after a day of touring. The front desk staff is helpful and kind. When we were there, there was an artist painting traditional designs on the ceiling of the lobby. The hotel is just a few blocks from the tram stop, which makes it easy to get around, since you do not want to drive in Istanbul. I can't speak about the non-suite rooms, since I didn't see them, but I would highly recommend a suite room at this lovely hotel. By the way, Niles is a no smoking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and view”
Reviews.Author: gbbird
Reviews.Content: The location is a few streets off the tram line at the Grand Bazaar. We rode the train to and from the airport with no difficulty. The view from the restaurant is of the Marmara Sea. The hotel and facilities were very clean and modern and the staff was helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: agal_ali
Reviews.Content: Supremely situated within walking distance of Grand Bazaar, 'Blue Mosque' and other historical attractions. This hotel deserves full marks for its cleanliness and friendly and helpful staff. It was an added bonus to begin the day with breakfast, of 4* quality, and a seaview from the rooftop terrace!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for a long weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Francises
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this charming hotel. Kemal and his attentive staff were friendly and helpful, and made us feel very much at our ease. We stayed in one of the 'Suite' rooms which was spacious, clean, and beautifully furnished and decorated. The breakfast room / bar on the roof has superb views, and the breakfasts were excellent. We liked the location as it feels more like 'real' Istanbul than parts of Sultanahmet which would be too touristy for us. We felt safe and comfortable in the area, which is handy for all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Drellie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Niles for two nights on either side of our one week stay in Turkey. The hotel is beautifully furnished throughout and has the feel of a boutique hotel. We had booked into a standard double. Our room was quite small but had all we needed (although the fridge in the first room did not work). Bathroom again was small but very clean and with a very good shower. The roof top terrace was lovely and breakfast was hearty turkish fare. The highlight of our stay was the service from all the staff but especially Kemal who couldn't do more to help. He gave us a wonderful welcome both time and a good introduction to the city witha map and several good restaurant recommendations. In terms of location it is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest tram stop and a lively 10-15 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topaki Palace, etc. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, lovely staff, good location - very clean”
Reviews.Author: Gotoday1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles earlier this year. It was a lovely little hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The decor in our room was a bit old and dated and the room was not all that that big but it was very comfortable and clean. There is a really good terrace on the roof where you can have a quiet drink at night and also enjoy the very good breakfast which includes good coffee and plenty of variety. Staff were great - and the hotel is really close to the major historic sites. I would definately stay at Hotel Niles again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm and hospitable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy255100
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and we would highly recommend it as a place to stay. We arrived by train from Thessaloniki, a day earlier than planned, and although there were no vacancies for that night, the hotel staff found us somewhere close by to stay. We had booked over the internet for our week's stay at Hotel Niles and everything that was offered online was available - and more. The room was spacious (we had a junior suite for 3 of us), the staff went out of their way with advice for things to see; how to use public transport; recommended good places to eat etc. And there were small details, like a sewing kit in the room, and good quality soap with a loofa for the shower! We felt looked after in a new city, adding to the very favourable impression we now have of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: unionville_10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul. This boutique hotel was within walking distance to the many tourist sites, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. The staff were extremely friendly and offered maps and advice before setting out on our daily excursion. The public transit was also within 2 blocks of the hotel. They offer a hearty breakfast , served on the rooftop terrace . Lunch and dinner are not available. However, there are local restaurants nearby that will deliver to the hotel should you decide to eat in. Menus are available in the lobby. We dined at one of the restaurants nearby that was recommended by the staff and the food was great. We stayed in the newly renovated suite which was extremely comfortable .I would highly recommend this hotel and if I were to visit Istanbul again, this would be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, prime location, and incredible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: JPatry
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Hotel Niles. The staff (especially Kemal, who always called me by name) were outstanding. They were knowledgable and friendly and always spoke perfect English to me which made finding my way much easier. English and Spanish are spoken throughout Istanbul so if you don't have time for a Turkish lesson before you go, you'll be just fine. I stayed in one of the suites and was very happy with the cleanliness and layout of the room. I especially loved the Turkish decor of the room. The entire hotel has WIFI plus there's a computer with a printer available in the lobby at all times. The 24 hour rooftop terrace with breathtaking ocean views just topped the whole experience. And the breakfast selection was a broad range so there's something for everyone. The location of Hotel Niles is perfect--5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and 15 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Square. There's a tram station right at the Grand Bazaar that'll take you to all the other attractions but you can walk to everything as well in about 30 minutes. The hills of Istanbul will give you a great workout so you can enjoy delish dining guilt-free. The staff's restaurant suggestions were all great as well--I was very happy with my stay at Hotel Niles and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonjaCroatia
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. great staff. good location. we had a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Anywhere Else in Istanbul, This place is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TDabbs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Istanbul during late May/early June of 2010, and stayed at Hotels Niles for 5 nights in one of the new suites (great deal, paying cash 113 euro a night for a great size room with huge bathroom). The suites are brand new, and I believe they have great sound-proofing because the call to prayer only woke me up on the first morning, and I never was awaken the remaining 4 nights (some advice for booking). It was the third place I looked at since everywhere else was booked, and I am very glad we ended up here! Hotel arranged pick-up for us from the airport, though next time we will take public transportation (learn before going, will save you lots of money and time!) We were jet lagged, and the man who runs the rooftop terrace was kind enough to order out our food, bring to us at the table, and give us extra yogurt (all together 20 lira for dinner $16 USA for two people). Breakfast was great in the morning, tea was strong, we were able to skip lunch sometimes and have a snack mid-day. Great location, 15 minute walk to Aya Sofia, but again, public transportation can also take you there, just 3-4 minute walk up the street. For all clean freaks out there, we walked in on several occasions returning from our trip to see the cleaning staff scrubbing everything from head to toe; this was, simply put, amazing. The desk clerk even sent out my boyfriend's coat which he spilled tea on, and we were charged 7 lira for cleaning. TIP: Walk up to the main street and turn left down main road, great doner vendor at night and GREAT dessert venue called Karafarin, very pleasant staff! We are planning to return to Istanbul next summer, and we will be sure to stay at this hotel again. Wonderful, helpful staff! Thank you Hotel Niles for making our stay in Istanbul so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kcofstooriecastle
Reviews.Content: We were a bit shocked when we arrived at the hotel as it is surrounded by sweat shops but, when you get inside you are met with friendly, smiling, helpful staff who couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a joy. Large choice of hot and cold food in fab surroundings. The hotel was spotless and smelt fresh all the time. It was only a short walk to the tram stop and all the main attractions. We are glad we stayed in this area as it showed as a part of Istanbul life we would not otherwise have seen. Bathroom was a wee bit small but more than adequte for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, Cleanliness, and Service”
Reviews.Author: AnonDoha
Reviews.Content: The Niles Hotel is a great boutique hotel located in a good area of Istanbul; near the historical area. The tramway is close for ease of travel. The hotel was clean, charming, and comfortable. The staff was friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and service oriented. Kemal especially went out of his way to assist in any way possible. I am a single lady traveler and felt safe and comfortable the entire time with them. They went above the norm to ensure all my arrangements (including helping me organize tours), transportation, and stay went smoothly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes small and intimate hotels with 5 star friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Value Gem Near the Grand Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: theobstinatetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles over a weekend in Istanbul in September. I have to say that I don't think you will get a nicer experience for the dollar than at this hotel - it's a value gem. Its location near the main street with the metro and the grand bazaar is within walking distance of all the major sites like Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The quality of the rooms was excellent - our room was very large by European standards, impeccable clean and had a very modern, beautiful bathroom. I'm attaching pictures of the room on the 6th floor. The hotel offered free internet downstairs and a hotpot and tea in every room. Front desk staff was cordial and helpful about arranging taxis for us. Breakfast is on a beautiful terrace overlooking the Mamara sea. I found the breakfast waiters to be less welcoming and cordial but you mainly serve yourself so it doesn't really matter. Breakfast was perfectly adequate for being included in the price - not excellent but fine. Crticisms are very minor. One morning the hot water was only tepid but I told the front desk and didn't have any further issues. There is a silly charge for fresh squeezed orange juice in the morning - I would prefer that they add a few lira to the main bill and not have this nickel and dime charge.

Reviews.Title: “First Class / 5 star Service”
Reviews.Author: DickenM
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Istanbul, no finer choice needed, this is the hotel to stay at. This was our second visit to the NILES, friendly staff, no matter whatever you ask their aim is to please so you have a lovely pleasant stay. Very Central amoung the old part of the city and close to Grand Bazzar and tram station The Roof Garden Terrace is where breakfast is served very picturesque it looks out over to the sea. The hotel extension and new reception is very nice and new rooms and suite are of a very high standard. Both the Manager and Kemal even remembered us and our friends from last year, we intend to go back to the Niles again next year. Well Done and Thank you for yet again wonderful Stay.

Reviews.Title: “all my expectations were met plus more”
Reviews.Author: Cammomile_Flower
Reviews.Content: First of all the roof terrace did have a view on the sea-which I was afraid it wouldn't, one never knows what photos of a place are prefabricated or not:) The room was small, which I expected, too, the air-conditioning worked just fine. It was funny to see the workers in the windows opposite. The unexpected plus was the quality of the airport transfer: excellent, and indeed the quality of service at the reception was remarkable. The room was very clean, the shampoo smelled nice (coco-nut), if the conditioner smelled like that as well it would be even better:))) The shower was not cleaned in some places as thouroughly as it could have been, but I left a note to the cleaning staff so I'm shure when you come it will all be in order:))) The area in which the hotel is situated is not the heart of the historical part of Istambul, but my colleagues wanted to go to the Grand Bazaar and I chose this hotel because of the proximity of this place. They loved the fact that they could just get out and do their shopping, while the hotel and its roof terrace remained their safe haven and an oasis of comfort in this busy area. Many greetings! Kamila

Reviews.Title: “tremendous hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: marleefar
Reviews.Content: When the Dersaadet Hotel proved to be booked during our proposed travel dates to Istanbul, the concierge recommended staying at their new sister hotel, the Hotel Niles, and we were very happy with their recommendation! The staff at Hotel Niles is tremendously warm, helpful and knowledgeable; the rooms are spotless and comfortable; the roofdeck terrace has a great view and is a perfect spot for a pre-dinner drink; the location is just a couple of minutes walk to the tram line as well as easily accessible to most of the major Istanbul sites; they have a nice breakfast buffet up on the terrace; the lobby and tea room are elegant and cozy; and they provide free wireless internet. Suggestion 1: Take public transportation from the airport to Hotel Niles. It's extremely inexpensive and pretty straight forward - the Beyasit tram stop is just a couple of minutes from the hotel. No need to pay for a taxi or shuttle service. Suggestion 2: Bring some ear plugs with which to sleep as the call to prayer is REALLY loud in the early am (this is true of Istanbul in general, i.e., not a deficiency of the Hotel Niles).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great roof terrace and an amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wally359
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Niles. We were two friends sharing a double room and it was pretty small, but if you can pay more then you'd get more space. The roof terrace and breakfasts were the highlights of our stay at Hotel Niles - it was such a lovely way to start the day. The staff were really wonderful and responsive. The only thing we found disapointing was that they weren't terribly helpful when it came to helping us get to Sabiha Gokcen airport - they were keen for us to take a car that they would arrange for us - which was 60 Euro - they obviously make a bit of money from it. Whereas there are much cheaper options that they didn't tell us about - including a shuttle service that comes around hotels. The bus, which they told us would take 2 hours, took 30 minutes and was by far the cheapest and best way to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at Sultanahment”
Reviews.Author: Pabliblo
Reviews.Content: We are a couple and we stayed 5 days in this Hotel. Very well located and connected by Tram, close to the most famous places in Sultanahmet, just 5 or 10 minutes walking. Breakfast very good, served in a very nice terrace at the top of the building. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. Perhaps rooms are a little small, but quite fine for a couple and 5 days of tourism in Istanbul (who care if you have Istanbul waiting for you?) However room was very clean all the time, which is very important for us. In general, very good place for a quite fine price, 70â‚¬ per nit in our case.

Reviews.Title: “Niles Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sarikako
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this hotel I decided to book with them... I have to say its a lovely small hotel with very friendly staff always ready to help you out with roof top garden restaurant The was clean providing with air conditioning which sometimes was difficult to use The hotel provide breakfast with Turkish tea if your a tea person like I am I advise take your own tea bags, they don't really provide any lunch or dinner so beware of that Location is brilliant walking distance to major site seeing and tramp. I enjoyed my time at the hotel and would go back Sarika

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: rosiemLondon
Reviews.Content: Visited Hotel Niles, Istanbul with friends the beginning of June. It is listed as a 2 star hotel but should be listed as 3 Star. This hotel is in the old city but do not let this put you off as when we arrived there I was a bit put off. It is really central to all the main attractions a lot of them you can walk to. The hotel is spotless with a lovely rooftop restaurant where we had breakfast each morning and visited it in the evenings for a drink. Rooms are spotless. Staff are extremely helpful and can help with information on Istanbul, We had to leave very early in the morning due to the British Airways strike and the staff got up before 5a.m. to give us a light snack which we certainly did not expect. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: arnold17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is an oasis. Well maintained with an excellent array of new rooms and beautiful lobby and roof garden. My family and I stayed in one of the new suites. This is an excellent 3 star Hotel, Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. I would have no hesitation of recommending this establishment to families with young children. It has a free computer in the lobby. In terms of value for money I paid equivalent to Â£100 a night for my family of 4 including Breakfast, which in July and August for the quality and service I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly, interesting, small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Howarddoha
Reviews.Content: Outstanding, helpful, staff. . Don't expect to lay by the pool all day - no pool! But the hotel is in the interesting area of Istanbul. Not the most fashionable, but the area to be if one wants to get a feel of the historic city. Reliable service to and from the airport. Excellent breakfast. Excellent coffee

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Istanbul and the Niles for a first-time visitor”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: First, I would say to be careful of fake reviews of hotels in Istanbul -- I think here are quite a few. I was concerned about fake reviews of the Niles but stayed there anyway. I spent a lot of time trying to decide where to stay for a long weekend in Istanbul and was very pleased with the Niles. There are so many different neighborhoods to stay in Istanbul -- it's difficult to choose, but I think this is a good place for a first-time visitor. Most tourist hotels are in the Sultahmeht (sp?) so this is a nice mid-range option *away* from the touristy area but still very close by (2 tram stops or a 10-15 minute walk). This hotel is very close to the Grand Bazaar, which is helpful if you plan on doing a lot of shopping. The hotel is also very close to the handy transportation system -- only 2 stops to the major tourist attractions. For a first visit, it is in an ideal location. If you are going to Istanbul to go to the clubs, I would NOT stay here. All of the fancy waterfront clubs are on the other side of Istanbul, on the other side of the river. It would be difficult and expensive to find your way back to the Niles at 5 a.m. If you are a clubber, I would suggest staying at either the 4 seasons or the Radisson SAS in that area, both on the water. Alternatively, staying in the Taksim area would at least have you on the right side of the river. The rooftop cafe was nice -- I had a nice and cheap dinner from the cafeteria 2 blocks away on 2 different nights. They deliver to the hotel rooftop, and the food is good and cheap. They do serve booze. I had a room facing the street just 1 floor up -- and it was still very quiet. The area shuts down in the evenings. (If you like to be able to walk out your front door to a bar, stay elsewhere.) I thought the staff was quite nice. They were always very helpful and friendly... and they definitely took pride in their work, which I thought was quite nice, too. The free high speed internet worked quite well for me in my room -- I was able to use skype as well. There is a computer for free general use in the lobby. On the downside, I would say the following: My room was sort of run-down -- but I wasn't expecting the Taj Mahal for the price. The hotel is in the garment district -- you don't have to look to far to see/hear garment workers in the windows of the buildings on all sides of the cafe. Hence, the area immediately surrounding the hotel isn't great, either -- I made a point of being back before dark, as a solo female traveler. This would not be a good place to stay if you have difficulty walking or require a wheelchair. The hotel is located on a steep hill and the street going up to the main road is paved with very, very rough cobblestones -- I was worried about slipping and falling and made several wrong steps myself, tearing up the heels of my shoes. (But, if you want a view, you have to be on a hill, right?)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small but excellent hotel,with the best staff.”
Reviews.Author: GAC25
Reviews.Content: What a find,this is a small hotel but the suit rooms we had were fab.They had fridges balconys microwave and a kettle. The roof terrace is great and the breakfasts are more than adequate.Our room was spotlessly clean with a large comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom/wetroom. The manager Kemal was exceptionally helpfull and very professional. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone whodoes not want to stay in a large chain hotel. It is a gem

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TRUNDY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the garment district of Istanbul. It's close to the train station & bus stops. Walking distance to Blue Mosic, Grand Bazzar & other attractions. The hotel staff were excellent and very accomindating to our requests. The morning breaksfast spread was good and simple. The STaff gave suggestions on places to eat and we were thrilled everytime. I highly recommend taking the shuttle offered by the hotel to pick up/drop off at airport. Regular taxi drivers don't always know their way around to find the hotel. Only downside was none of the postcards we gave the front desk (with cash) were never mailed.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarveyThomas41
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Hotel Niles too highly. It is a small family run establishment close to the major attractions of the old city . The hotel is very good value for money. In fact tea is served for free in the outstandingly ornate reception area. it is also blessed with a roof terrace dining area The service provided is so genuinely friendly. This to me was exemplified by the hotel forwarding a package of belongings I had left at the hotel to me and refusing to take any payment for doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Morten47
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying 6 nights in Hotel Niles. One of the new suites was available, and this room was one of the finest we have ever had. Especially the bathroom has a hint of luxury with its marble interior - almost like a mini sized hamam! Staff was cunning and friendly. We will never forget the delicious breakfasts on the roof terrace with the splendid view over Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles, simply incredible!”
Reviews.Author: 5ab29
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Niles and had a wonderful experience. Everything from the staff, to the cleanliness of the rooms, to the location of the hotel were nothing short of incredible. As a young female traveler I felt safe and comfortable in the hotel and in this location of Istanbul. The staff were very accommodating and always provided me with sound, honest, advice about site seeing, restaurants, short-distance travel plans, etc. The proximity of the hotel to the tram line was also very helpful. It makes travel that much easier, and I felt very comfortable traveling on my own at night because the distance between the tram stop and the hotel was only a few hundred meters. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and can say with absolute certainty that you will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “I had a fantastic stay at hotel - great location and outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: christina108
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We arrived via airport transfer for a small charge arranged by the hotel and arrived into their lovely lobby. We immediately felt very welcomed and I felt as though we were treated like we would be in a luxury hotel! The staff are so professional, friendly and helpful. The concierge on front desk was more than happy to help with any enquiries and gave us some great eatery suggestions (also he always greeted us by first name when he saw us!). The breakfast on the terrace was nice with a great view of the city. The value for money here is outstanding. Oh also, they offered us free late checkout as they knew we had an international flight and offered us free shower facilities if needed, even though we wouldn't be leaving till later that night. Will definetely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, caring staff. Good location and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Patti122
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Niles. Warm and friendly staff, beautiful breakfasts (probably the best we had in Turkey!) on a lovely terrace and all in a great location. We felt really comfortable in this area away from the 'touristy' Sultanamet and would recommend it to anyone. It is easy to get the tram or walk to all the sites. It is nice to walk outside your hotel and not be constantly accosted by traders.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: molinadr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! It was a very good value so i was a bit skeptical. However, the place was great with very friendly, helpful staff. They constantly went out of thier way to make us feel welcome and the hotel was located in a great location. we were very close to the tram stop, but found ourselves walking to a lot of the sites instead.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy, reasonably-priced, great location and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: uclababe
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Hotel Niles. The hotel is very quaint and cozy. The rooms are clean. The staff is amazing. The rooftop has a great view. The hotel is right by the tram stop and it's really close to Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It's right across from the Grand Bazaar too. We really enjoyed our stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding friendly and helpful staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan154943
Reviews.Content: My single room was clean & comfortable with air con, hair dyer, tv, etc. The roof terrace which served a delicious breakfast and the best sesame cookies I have ever tasted, was really lovely with attractive decor and fragrant potted plants. It also had a reasonable view of the harbour. The hotel is within a 3-4 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, banks & tram line & is located within a bustling garment district which I found to be interesting & full of activity. Sitting areas in the lobby were attractive & comfortable. Email replies from the staff were prompt & professional. But really the most outstanding feature of this small hotel were the staff, particularly Hakan & Kemal at the front desk. They were friendly & good-humoured & answered all my questions. They really made a difference for me & helped me to find my way in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the Hotel Niles was excellent”
Reviews.Author: flexner
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, intelligent and courteous. The roof top breakfasts were very well done with a nice variety. The rooms were confortable and very quiet; the location was just a bit out of the noise and hussle and still very, very convenient to shopping, sites, the streetcar and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: SteveGSmith
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, with desk clerk always able to answer questions about sightseeing and shopping locations and transportation options; special breakfast brought to room for free on morning of early departure; nice room, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find in the old city”
Reviews.Author: purplebag1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul. I can't say enough about what a wonderful experience it was. The staff is so warm and friendly I felt like we were leaving old friends when we had to return home. The free breakfast is great. The rooms are beautiful. We had a two story maisonette for 5 nights and a suite for 3 nights. The suite was only 120 Euros and clean, modern and oh so beautiful. You can walk to everything or take the tram. It felt very safe and we meet many people who were very kind and friendly. There are alot of "sales" guys on the main street trying to sell you lots of knock off items. If you walk one street behind the main street you avoid them all. We will definately be back. Karl & Paula, San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for your holidays”
Reviews.Author: Cindy040
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is very close to the Grand Bazaar, the trams and the busses it is situated in a quiet neighbourhood. During the evening you will not hear anything and have quiet nights. On the top of the hotel you can have your coffee or tea and have a nice view looking over the roofs of other buildings. There you will have as well your breakfast in the morning and able to sit either inside or outside. The hotel staff is very friendly!! Especially Mr Celik who enjoys being a Front Manager and therefore is very helpful when you need anything, giving you instructions where to go for sight-seeing, a restaurant booking or a taxi, everything he does is with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: amesinlondon
Reviews.Content: you cant beat the location and the service in this hotel. they get out of their way to help visitors when they get trouble in local restaurants. the front desk is the best and he is sooo helpful. great rooftop terrace for morning breakfast or just a beer in the evening. it is very close to the grand bazaar, and we walked everywhere. save money on transport

Reviews.Title: “best price for a top quality”
Reviews.Author: rose1456
Reviews.Content: if your allocated budget allows it, choose the suites very clean, helpful staff, convenient location

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Find”
Reviews.Author: piman314
Reviews.Content: A first-time trip to Istanbul found us staying at Hotel Niles for nine nights. Our first choice was a different hotel, which was full. The owner recommend Hotel Niles. We saw our first choice and were extremely happy to have chosen Hotel Niles. It was newly renovated giving us a new suite with a queen bed, sitting area, refrigerator, large bath with shower, safe, and wardrobe. Internet service was offered at no cost. Location was about three blocks from public transportation, which allows one to travel to the tourist sites. Hotel management was outstanding. The front desk manager was one of the best we havhttps://tonic.tripadvisor.com/SavedPhotos-g625168-i25981669%2C25981670-w1-Istanbul.html#25981669e encountered. He was friendly and knowledgable to our transportation needs, including what price to offer to cab drivers; restaurant recommendations; and even offereing tea and turkish coffee after a long day of sightseeing. Included in the room price was buffet breakfast at the rooftop area overlooking the city and sea. We also received a 10% discount paying in USD. We much prefer small hotels to the chain hotels when we travel. We would have liked to see robes in the rooms, but they did provide slippers.

Reviews.Title: “Fully bears out all the favourable reviews already given to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jr54_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and cannot really find fault with any aspect. It is a mystery why this is a 2 star rated hotel when it easily outperfoms other 3 and 4 star hotels which we have stayed in. Maybe the lack of restaurant? We stayed in one of the newly opened suites which was spotless, spacious and immaculately furnished. The staff could not have been more helpful and the roof terrace was delightful to sit on, both for the very good breakfasts but also to relax in at the end of a hot days sightseeing. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and immaculate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norsechild
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in the midst of the old part of Istanbul was an unexpected delight. The price is right, the hotel absolutely spotless, the breakfast with a view of the sea from the roof is superb. This rooftop breakfast area is beautifully set up and you can eat indoors or outdoors as you wish. Best coffee in Istanbul, and not the Turkish type (which is very good, but different). We looked forward to breakfast every day for a week! The staff was very helpful and friendly and made us feel at home. The rooms are very small, as are the bathrooms, but the price makes up for it. In the lobby there is an adorable tea room area which is open to the sky 5 stories above - quite amazing - where tea is always available in those nice little Turkish tea glasses. The staff ordered taxis for us for prompt delivery to and from the airport and to other locations, and also advised us on all manner of things. Advice: this hotel is hard to find so we recommend that they send a taxi to the airport to pick you up and bring you to the hotel. Saves a lot of stress. If you are a walker, all the major attractions of old Istanbul are within walking distance, including the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, etc., etc.. We visited the other part of the city across the Golden Horn where the really fancy hotels are located and found it very unattractive and very noisy. Old Istanbul is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Good for sights but not best area for nightlife”
Reviews.Author: TinaG1979
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 4 nights in the hotel for his 30th bday, hotel was hard to find - taxi driver had no idea where it was and just left us on a random street, but when you know where it is it's easy to find. Great location for sightseeing (Blue Mosque etc all walking distance) and right near a tram stop but in the evening the area is pretty dead - we ended up geting cabs to and from Taksim which is lively 24/7 as tram stops at 12. I suggest you stay around there if interested in going out at night. Very friendly staff and ok breakfast, room was very small and pretty basic in my opinion but clean and it's fine for what you pay. Very loud outside as well so sleep was interrupted. Overall a pretty good experience but I'd stay in Taksom if I went again.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: agyRoma
Reviews.Content: i spent six nights, everything was just fine, staff members were very helpfull and very kind. in my opinion the hotel was perfectly located just few meters from the tramstation or 10 minutes walking from the main attraction sights. on the roof there is the breakfast area with a great view. our rooms was standard size, well equipped and sparkless. i suggest you to go there and in my near future i'm planning to go back there

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: alenrico
Reviews.Content: Not only the hotel is located in the best area to reach on foot the most important spots of Istanbul... the hotel is very, very clean and the staff is more than kind, they remembered right away our first names!!! The breakfast was very good and the terrace impeccable. It was my husband's birthday and without saying a word the staff left in our room a cake, sweeties and wine to celebrate it!!! if this is not "customer care"... :)

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: reginaSK52
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find for a budget trip. Pluses: location is excellent, very close to the Grand Bazaar and easy walking distance to Sultanahmet. Very near tram, which is a cheap & easy way to see the city. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast (on the roof terrace) is really good and the view is a bonus! Minuses: our room was extremely small, with a very hard bed, and when we asked for a bigger one, we were told it would cost roughly double. But the wonderful staff made our stay lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Niles=Nice”
Reviews.Author: dadim83
Reviews.Content: A bit hard to find the first time, but very close to all the hot spots of Istanbul like Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Superb breakfasts on the wonderful roof garden with view on the Marmara Sea. Rooms very nice, tidy and clean. Excellent room service, courtesy and kindness from the whole hotel staff. Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in an atmospheric hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found this hotel to be well positioned, clean, comfortable with all amenties we needed (we stayed in a Junior Suite). The room was spacey (for 2) and well decorated, with nice little traditional touches, such as Ottoman era decore and furniture. It even had a Turkish bath. The housekeeping was spotless and there was no trouble with outside noise (with windows closed) though at night other guests in the corridor could sometimes be heard. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful. When asked they provided a number of referrals (from excellent to good). One of the best was for a dinner at Hos Seda (down the hill) at Kumkapi. Here Ferat looked after us and recommended an excellent fish hotpot (not sure it was on the menu but we went with the flow). Sitting outside on the little square with music was very entertaining and the best fish we had the whole holiday, The hotel is well placed with a walk (up the hill but not too far) to the tram stop and close by the Grand Bazaar. The cashteller was also just up the road. The area did not seem too touristic - going for a little walk down the hill we felt like we were in an area where locals were really living. A couple of mornings after breaksfast on the roof terrace, we just felt like staying around and enjoying the peace and quiet in the sun, but that wasn't why we were in Istanbul. We'll have to come back for that.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ambulatory
Reviews.Content: It's not possible to say too many good things about the Hotel Niles. It has an excellent location near the Grand Bazaar in an interesting working/university neighborhood -- out of the chaos of Sultanahmet but an easy walk with lots of interesting things to see along the way. If you prefer the tram, the stop is only a two-minute walk away. The rooms are spotlessly clean, small but very comfortable, with fluffy duvets and pillows and a good strong shower. The lobby is pleasant, scented by the flowers of the courtyard. The rooftop garden is really a dream -- stunning views of the Sea of Marmara over the rooftops of Istanbul, and the garden itself is beautifully decorated with lush plants and flowers. It was our favorite place to start the day and take a break between sightseeing and dinner. But the best thing about the Hotel Niles is the absolutely top-notch staff. Kemal, the manager, couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. He even surprised us with a tray of birthday surprises for my husband: a delicious little cake, Turkish delight, nuts, wine and flowers. It was such a thoughtful thing to do for guests celebrating their birthdays in Istanbul. Kemal clearly puts a lot of thought into his guests' experience from the moment they walk in and are warmly welcomed until they sadly climb into a taxi for the airport. He is a master of customer service and it shows throughout the staff. Hakan, who also works at the front desk and just graduated from Istanbul University (congratulations, Hakan!), is a very warm and witty guy who generously shared his expertise about the city and helped us with our embarrassingly bad pronunciation of Turkish words. Onur and Ayse, two other university students, were delightful conversationalists at breakfast; we really enjoyed talking to them both (and wish them the best in their university program -- hope you get to do the study-abroad option in the Netherlands, Onur and Ayse!). We really miss our wide-ranging conversations with Murat up on the roof terrace in the early evenings. He is an extremely nice man and like the rest of the staff, very helpful with advice about Istanbul. I'm raising a glass of visne to you, Murat! On top of all this, the Hotel Niles is an extraordinary value, especially considering the wonderful breakfast that's included -- delicious homemade breads and borek, terrific yogurt, fresh and dried fruits, olives, cereals, good coffee and tea, juices and even hot egg dishes. We couldn't believe our luck at finding such a nice hotel with such an extraordinary staff at this price and would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in a friendly and warm environment”
Reviews.Author: He_Dre
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, very friendly and warm. Room was clean, very comfortable bed, small bathroom, but efficient. Slippers, hairdryer, small refrigerator, small tv. Our check out was early and breakfast was brought to our room! Lovely lobby, free internet. Beautyfull terras full with flowering plants overlooking the Bosporus/Marmara sea. Service by the front desk was perfect! The Niles hotel is situated nearby most of the cultural spots. In the area textile wholesalers and little work shops. The tram is about 100 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ahane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days with friends. Very clean Hotel, staff wonderful, really helpful. Breakfast on roof terrace, also used for evening drinks. We were treated to free snacks one evening and a drink. This hotel is in the old town, but a fantastic place to stay it is so central for sightseeing and shopping. Close to Tram Lines, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and lots of other sites. It is advisable to ask the Hotel to collect you from the airport (obviously you will have to pay) as some of the taxi drivers are not familiar with the area. Internet is free to use at the Hotel. The Restaurants the hotel recommend are not always good value for money, there are lots and lots of other lovely restaurants, so take a look around. Euros are very acceptable in Istanbul. When shopping in Grand Bazaar, etc it is acceptable to bargain, in fact it is expected. English is widly spoken. I would certainly recommend Istanbul. It is also a great place to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: sucarter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles is a wonderful small (boutique) hotel in the central part of old Istanbul. the English speaking reception staff are most helpful and informative. The rooms are immaculate, and European-sized, with standard amenities for this region -- all quite acceptable. The hotel's decor, and service, make it a real treat. A definite re-visit in store!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, nice service and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TeachersHeilbronn
Reviews.Content: We were 11 persons and wanted to make a cultural trip and found this beautifull hotel on a perfect place (Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia, Sultan Ahmet, Topkapi reaching all in just 3-7 minutes). Wonderfull view on the Breakfast-Terrace also used as night bar and we enjoyed the verry freindly and nice service.

Reviews.Title: “highlight of our time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rudloffski
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Hotel Niles after reading favorable reviews on Trip Advisor and realizing that for the price we would pay at another nice hotel in istanbul we could get a suite here AND be in the center of all the sights we wanted to see. Upon arrival the driver was waiting at the airport as promised, we were able to check into our room early (11:30am), and the front desk staff provided us a map and great 5min summary of how to navigate around the area which proved even more useful than the travel book I'd brought. The hotel was VERY convenient, right off the tram line and within walking distance to all the major sights we wanted to see (Grand Bazar, Sophia, Blue Mosque, Palace, Archeological museum, Waterfront/ferries, spice bazar). The front desk staff recommended a WONDERFUL restaurant to eat on our second night there, and because it was rainy the restaurant even paid for our taxi to and from dinner!! it was better food and more reasonable price than we had paid our first night finding a spot on our own. and finally, the room itself was STUNNING. a two story suite: main entrance was two very turkish-looking couches, TV, small kitchenette and desk. gorgeous stairwell led to basement bedroom, with tons of exposed brick for character and a full turkish bathroom that I know we did not use to its full potential! We were worried about street traffic at night but honestly didn't hear a peep. We also enjoyed breakfast and drinks one evening on the rooftop cafe/bar. it had a lovely view and we met the nicest people... enjoyed a nightcap with our fellow travelers. only complaint was the room was very dry... the AC worked, but the air was dry and we woke up with sore throat and noses (which the awesome huge shower helped relieve. ) Highly recommend this hidden gem of a hotel if you are visiting Istanbul. :) p.s. if you stay at Hotel Niles, look at the building next to it from the rooftop terrace... you'll see where they are manufacturing all the faux Burberry and D&G shoes and bags. hehe :) made us laugh.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolKamloopsCanada
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel on our 3 l/2 week to Turkey and this hotel was wonderful. Service excellent, food great and the rooms clean and comfortable. The Roof Top Terrace is breathtaking while you eat your breakfast (selection excellent). Would definitely stay again. The staff cannot do enough for you. Carol & Garry

Reviews.Title: “this boutique hotel is a "MUST"”
Reviews.Author: fritzlb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying 3 nights (May 18,19, and 20, 2010) at Hotel Niles. From the time I began communicating with hotel management (several months before our stay) I suspected that this would be a great hotel to experience, because each of my e mails was replied to promptly and courteously. My suspicion proved to be correct. The hotel is extremely well situated, a mere 2 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar , just 2 short blocks from the tramline in the Beyazit/Sultanhamet section of old Istanbul. Sultanahmet, Ayasofya and Topkapi Palace are all within a 15 - 20 minute easy walk. Also quite close to the hotel are many good restaurants; we had wonderful dinners at Faros Restaurant and Pasha Restaurant, both on Divanyolu Cadessi, about a 5 minute walk east from the hotel. The things that made our stay so favourable include: wonderfully pleasant, helpful, friendly and professional staff (without exception), lovely breakfast in a roof-top setting with a view of the Marmara Sea to die for, quiet room, efficient elevator, lovely welcoming foyer AND classical music to boot!!. The room we had was a bit small (especially the washroom) but certainly manageable. At our request staff arranged for a van to transport us to Ataturk airport at the end of our stay, at a rate of 20 Turkish lira (which was a good rate): the driver was prompt, courteous and helpful. We would DEFINITELY stay at Hotel Niles again and unreservedly recommend it to others. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ilojan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in hotel Niles and it was a great experience.The hotel was gorgeous. Its location is perfect, in the historical Istanbul, in Beyazit, with shops and the university, lively during the day and safe at night, 5 minutes walking from the Gran Bazaar and 10/15 minutes from the Blue Mosque. If you don't want to walk to the Blue Mosque or Hagya Sophia you can catch the tram which is 2 minutes far away, and brings you then whereever you want to go in Istanbul. The complete hotel staff is very friendly, professional, and helpful, the concierge Kemal was very nice and never "tired" of our thousand questions that we had: he helped us through the jungle of choices what to see, where to go, where to eat, and he always suggested places that met our tastes and his hints and tips led us right to where we wanted to go. Thank you Kemal! The hotel style is traditional and comfortable. We were 10 people had 5 rooms and were all very satisfied with our rooms. The rooms are nice and very clean, (the room service is flawless) I stayed in a suite and it was like living a honeymoon, very tasteful colours and furniture, spacy bathroom - the suites are beautiful! It is also suitable for business travellers - I found free wifi in every single corner! The breakfast room is on the roof top of the hotel where we could overlook the area of Beyzit and the Bosporus, a beautiful place which is open as bar during the day and at night, to meet your friends, to read a book or just to relax. The price/performance ratio is extremely good. They do offer a pick up and drop off service from/to the airport at a very reasonable price. I definitely recommend this hotel and if I come back to Istanbul I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “oustanding service from everyone, from manager to porter to restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: Hojo1949
Reviews.Content: As I said two years ago, an excellent choice for a reasonably priced hotel with great service. Everything the tourist needs, fluent English from manager and reception, helpful tips on where to go, how to get there, easy, efficient pick-up/drop-off service from airport, good location, only 10 mintes walk from major sights and the option of taking back dinner or lunch bought at one of the fantastic delis near the Spice Bazaar (Namli's, for example) to eat on the delightful varanda overlooking the sea of Marmara. Lavish breakfast, with no hurry to vacate the table, good rooms with modern bathrooms and lots of hot water. The only drawback is that from (very) early in the morning local shopkeepers are raising noisy steel shopfront shutters and chatting, shouting etc. The muezzin calling the faithful to prayer at 5am is inevitable anywhere in the muslim world and anyway only lasts about 10 minutes. This was our second visit and we were very impressed with the new wing, new suites, small internal patio and extended top floor varanda. Internet is freely available from a computer set up in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Personal”
Reviews.Author: Iserona
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, friendly and professional staff, clean rooms, good breakfast, perfect location. It was the second time that we stayed in this hotel and we would chose it again. Many greetings to the front office manager Kemal from Jean and Monique from Holland!

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: princess078
Reviews.Content: My partner and i spent 6 wonderful days in Istanbul. It is our second visit and we are already planning to return next year, We spent 5 nights at Hotel Niles in the Bayezit area which is within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar. All the staff are extremely kind, polite and most courteous. A warm welcome will meet you at this charming beautifully decorated small family owned hotel. It is the sister Hotel to the Dersaadet where we stayed 3 years ago in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Again we can thoroughly recommend this Hotel too. Both are beautifully decorated with great attention paid to detail and both are spotlessly clean. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: brogdogg
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles turned out to be an excellent choice and home base for our recent stay in Istanbul. The quality standard as a fairly small independent hotel and particularly the staff there (Kemal et al) are outstanding. It is truly an oasis where guests are made to feel valued, special and comfortable via highly personalized and caring service. The regular rooms are a bit small, but extremely clean (and suite rooms with Turkish baths are also available). Free wireless internet throughout and excellent rooftop terrace. Highly recommended. " TeÅŸekkÃ¼r" to Kemal and the entire Hotel Niles staff!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: zebunisa
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a safe and excellent location. The staff kemal, ayse, murat, onur fantastic, a real asset to the hotel. The hotel was exceptionally clean, our rooms were immaculate done up every day, fresh towels, fresh sheets, en suite in superb condition. The only negative was it was alittle noisy up until 12 am and from 6 am onwards, so wasn't able to get much sleep, was woken up by work being carried out nearby and shopkeepers working, not the hotel's fault. . Also the breakfast was not much and the same everyday. Istanbul was a fantastic city, I would deinitely go again, and stay at hotel niles again.

Reviews.Title: “Especially the service was excellent. The...”
Reviews.Author: teking
Reviews.Content: Especially the service was excellent. The hotel crew were very friendly and helpfully. The only minus was the room. We stayed at a double room and the room was a little bit small. There was not enough place to work with a laptop. But everything else was fine. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chriscanoe
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles is conveniently located near the Grand Bazaar, and if you have the inclination you can walk to many of Istanbul's historic places, ie Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, and the Hippodrome. Close to the hotel is a tram that will take you a good part of the way to other historic sights. The hotel generates a good atmosphere. This is helped by the wonderful staff I encountered there which made my extended stay, due to the volcanic ash delays, a pleasure. Kemal Celik on the front desk, along with his colleagues, are a great source of information for restaurants, and generally getting around Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shimbles
Reviews.Content: An excellent new hotel in the main tourist area of Istanbul. Not quite as well located as some of the other boutique hotels, but still only about 15 minutes' walk to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia. Price is competitive overall, and we got a good hotel-opening deal on a suite room which was lovely - spacious, spotless and characterful. Common areas were good, and there was a large rooftop terrace (views not quite as good as some other hotels) for breakfast (a decent buffet) and general lounging. Staff were tremendous - exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “On our first trip to Istanbul the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff made us feel instantly welcomed to the city.”
Reviews.Author: Southmouther
Reviews.Content: Very good location for all the main sights. Very clean, the cheaper priced rooms are smaller but very clean, comfortable and good value. The second half of our stay (due to the volcanic ash cloud) we moved to one of the more upmarket newly refurbished and spacious suites. (More pricey too, but still good value)! A taste of old Istanbul! The terrace where breakfast and drinks are served is a delight. They will also order a very good takeaway for you promptly delivered to the terrace. Above all the staff made our stay one to be remembered, especially helpful during our prolonged enforced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location Excellent, Tiny Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Christmastravellers
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Front desk staff went above and beyond to orient us to area. Unfortunately got terrible case of food poisoning (beware of chicken gyros/donairs) avoid poultry, choose beef. We have travelled extensively and never had problems. We were confined to our room for 3 days/nights with terrible cramping, nauseousness, diahrrea (lasted 15 days!) Bathroom was so small, had to practically step in shower to close door. Breakfast was good (only had it the first day). Hotel staff did prepare a light meal for us on day 3 of the illness, as we had only eaten granola bars and water. Can't say enough about the staff, they were awesome. Hotel was clean, central and would stay there again, but upgrade to their newer rooms (costlier), but if spending any amount of time in your room (as we did) it would have been worth it! Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “best service ever in a very comfortable, cousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amsterd
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the staff and owner of Hotel Niles for all they have done during our extended stay in their hotel, due to the ash cloud which caused our flight delay. Not only were our 3 first (planned) days very well, but when we suffered delay on the flight back we could stay in the hotel and they did everything they could to help us out with all our requests. Eventhough we we with 18 familiy members! The hotel itself is a smaller, but professional, cousy hotel, which definetely gives you the 'home' feeling. Breakfest is very good, service is outstanding. The rooms you might find a bit small, for us they were big enough. Location of hotel is also excellent, in a relatively quite street (Istanbul is never really quiet), a few blocks away from the big bazar, only a little bit further to the Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Little Jewel in a Glittering City”
Reviews.Author: VinceHON
Reviews.Content: The fantastic staff at this Hotel made our holiday. We were affected by the Volcanic Ash problems and our 5 day break ended up as 13 days! The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, willingly attending to our every request for help and advice and assisting us in every way. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. Ideally situated close to all the main attractions of Old Istanbul and also within a few hundred yards of the Beyazit tram stop for easy access to the whole of the city. Also easily reached by metro and tram from Attaturk airport or in the hotel courtesy transport.

Reviews.Title: “3 for the hotel, 5 for the staff, so 4 on average.”
Reviews.Author: deleteyourself16
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Niles via taxi. The taxi driver seemed a bit unsure of the location, but after making few phone calls to his friends (other drivers I assume), he seemed to be well on the way. The hotel is on a small side street, but not far from the main drag of Ordu Cadesi, and about a 10 minute walk from the major sights of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. When we arrived, we were informed that the air conditioning in our room was not working (not good on a 90F/32C day), but that a repair man would be coming the next morning. They said they were full for that night, so they could not move us, but if the repair man wasn't able to fix the AC the next day, they would move us to an available room then after another guest checked out. At this point, we were nervous, expecting that we were going to get a constant barrage of excuses for why we had no AC and why they couldn't move us. We slept a rather uncomfortable night (they did provide a fan, but it really just blew the hot air around) before heading off for our first day of touristing. Upon our return around dinner time, we were informed that they had been unable to fix the AC and that they had already moved our belongings (except of course for those items in the safe) to the room next door to our original. The AC worked fine in this room and we stayed there quite comfortably for the rest of our stay. The rooms were smallish and basic, but we were there to be tourists, not to spend our time in the hotel. The rooms were very clean - if a bit worn - and contained a small refrigerator, which was nice. The bed was comfortable and adequate for two people. The hotel is well located, but you do have to walk 10 minutes or so for a decent restaurant, but no big deal in nice weather. The street that it is located on looks a bit sketchy after dark, but we were assured by the hotel staff that it is totally safe, and even when returning late at night we never felt unsafe. Some reviews here (and for other hotels) have complained about the sound of the call to prayer early in the morning, but I don't know why they would hold this against the hotel. You can hear the call EVERYWHERE in the city, so to expect you wouldn't hear it in your hotel is pretty stupid. The wireless internet was a bit testy, as some others have mentioned, but it worked well enough, and there is a PC in the lobby that you can use if the wireless isn't working or if you don't have a laptop with you. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is served on the rooftop terrace. The selection was good, including a few hot dishes, fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, tea, etc. The view from the rooftop terrace on a sunny morning is amazing too. The terrace is also open in the evenings. They serve drinks on the terrace, so you can eat dinner here if you get takeout, but they won't allow you to buy the drinks elsewhere and bring them to the terrace. The staff were extremely helpful, recommending several excellent restaurants, and helping us to order pizza from a local shop one evening when we were too worn out from touristing to venture back out for dinner. We paid â‚¬57 per night, which is below the rack rate, by booking through third party site. We were not given any hassle about the price by the hotel staff. They did charge our credit card in Lira for the room, which I found a bit odd since they even quote rates on their website in â‚¬, but no big deal, because the exchange rate that they gave was pretty much even with what I found when looking it up myself. All in all, I would give the hotel itself 3 stars, but the 5 star helpfulness of the staff averages out to a 4 star rating. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to start the day and to come back to after a day of exploring”
Reviews.Author: helenJobling
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel run by a friendly and extremely helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We were just a short stroll from the main tourist sights and with the tram on our doorstep it was easy to get further afield. We had 7 days of exploring and it was lovely to come back in the evening and relax in the cafe terrace enjoying the views. The rooms are not large - but there was plenty of space for us and all our clutter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: WovenPieces
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Niles Hotel with friends I was traveling with. It is located close to public transportation and the Grand Bazaar in old town Istanbul. The Blue Mosque, University, Hagia Sofia and most of the main sites are within walking distance. The hotel provides a wonderful buffet breakfast which is included in the economical room price. They offer eggs, breads, fruit, olives, cheeses, tea and coffee. It's lovely. The breakfast is set up in the upstairs terrace which offers a beautiful view of the water and the mosque. It doubles as a bar at night. The staff are the friendliest people you could ever meet and were extremely accommodating. They answered all of our tourist questions and bent over backwards to make our stay comfortable. We left feeling as though we had a perfect stay in Istanbul and made some new friends as well. I would suggest this hotel to anyone visiting the beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff we have ever stayed with”
Reviews.Author: Balgownie
Reviews.Content: The staff are exeptionally kind, friendly and cannot help you enough e.g. went out to get a guest toothpaste and ordered food from nearby restaurant when unable to provide food at night. Very well located and if arriving at Atarturk Airport you can use local train/tram which gets you within 200m of the hotel in less than an hour for 3TL (1.5 Euro) each as compared to E50 by cab in over an hour. That saving alone paid for a nights accommodation. They recommended good restaurants and advised on where to go and when. The hotel is spotlessly clean and hotel is being decorated throughout. Rooftop restaurant is good any time of day. Easy walking distance of almost everything ot again use the trams

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff! wish i was there now!”
Reviews.Author: angellashes
Reviews.Content: amazing. the staff was so extrememly helpful in having you find your way around. they spend about 10 min identifying all the sights on a map for you and are always smilng! the breakfast was fun everymorning to eat on the rooftop terrace over looking the water. at night the rooftop is also open to enjoy a tea and take in the great weather. the rooms were clean and made every day. the location was perfect for me. a minute walk up the street and your on the main street with all the shops. 5 min walk to grand bazaar and about a 10-15 walk to blue mosque. we didn't need to cab it anywhere. metro is also 3 min walk from hotel if needed. cab to airport is around 35 dolllars. i sincerely hope to return there again one day!

Reviews.Title: “a very basic and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: geffreyjd
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel for people on a tight budget who want to stay in a central Istanbul location for 1 or 2 nights. The rooms are kept clean but are very small. The very helpful and friendly staff. Overall, the B&B was excellent. It is clean, It is also just under five minutes walk from Main Square, which is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, amazingly clean, inexpensive, cherry nectar for breakfast--who could ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: SaxSymbol73
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, regardless of price Hotel Niles was a rare and pleasant find--an inexpensive hotel, conveniently located near both transit and sites, whose cleanliness and comfort were excellent, regardless of price paid. Iâ€™ve never stayed in a hotel that was so perfectly clean--perfect, fresh white linens, a bathroom without even errant water droplets on the fixtures, accompanied by very pleasant and helpful staff, and including a fine, free breakfast served on a patio with a great view of the sea and neighborhood. I canâ€™t recommend this place enough. Traveler's tip The tram is less than five minutes walk from Hotel Niles and connects you with all the major sites (Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Spice Bazaar). Rides are 1.5 TL each segment (when you exit a platform) and have great AC. As long as you watch your bags (my mobile was stolen), they are a great way to avoid the hawkers trying to sell you rugs and crappy guidebooks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff - stressfree”
Reviews.Author: whereisliz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Prior to arrival the correspondence was quick and easy. Upon arrival it was like being greeted by old friends. The hotel is a smaller one in a section of town that is not elaborate..but the peaceful and quiet sleep you receive is all worth it. You are between the historical district of the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar which is only 3-5 minutes away. The staff is amazing. I have never been anywhere where you automatically felt like you were "home". This is now a favorite for the peacefulness and quiet that one might one, while also having the opportunity to search out the treasures of the fair city of Istanbul. A no stress home away from home. I plan to come back and stay here many times.....................

Reviews.Title: “Best memory of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kreyl
Reviews.Content: We went for 1 night in late Sept 2009 and stayed for 6 due to the convienient location and the friendly staff. A great location in Sultanahment ( old Istanbul ), so close to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, St Sophie and many other attractions. It is 2 to 3 minutes walk up hill to the tram stop and from there only a few minutes to Eminonu from where you can catch the ferry boats which take you to many stops along both sides of the Bosphorus. The hotel is a boutique, compact and very clean, albeit a little dated. The staff were great, very friendly and helpful. It is located in a small side street full of traders. The roof top breakfast dining area was a great way to start the day, the breakfast is included in the room charge and the food is very good. The views from this area look out south of the Bosphorus Straights to The Sea of Marmara. Seda, The Front Office Manager was very helpful and very pleasant. I asked her many questions about Istanbul as it is such a very interesting city and she always found the answers. A very big thankyou to Seda, Kemai and Mirat and to the other staff by the way we were treated. They came out with hugs and waves when we left, we left feeling like family. Marylou & Piet Kreyl Wellington, NewZealand

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: imzy78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2007. The trip to Istanbul was for my birthday. I really believe we couldn't have made a better choice than Hotel Niles. The hotel is small and personal and family run. The service is exceptional. The rooms are small but comfortable and excellent value especially considering the location. They have a lovely rooftop breakfast room/bar where we would start and end our days. You can walk everywhere from here or take the tram. All the sights are very accessible from here. Thank you Hotel Niles for such a memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great location, great value!!”
Reviews.Author: cateym
Reviews.Content: Just back from four nights at Hotel Niles In Istanbul. We would highly recommend it. The location of the hotel is great. A short walk to the tram stop or better still walk into Sultanahmet Square (15 minutes) which is what we did every day! It is also located close to Kumkapi for the fish restaurants which we strayed into on our first afternoon in the city and went back later for a meal at Lipsoz, good food and friendly service. The hotel itself has character. The rooms are small but for the amount of time you are likely to spend in them it is irrelevant! The rooms are comfortable, warm and spotless. I'm a fan of showers with good water pressure and was happy with ours. Perhaps the best aspect of the hotel is the terrace where breakfast is served. The choice is good for a continental breakfast and we were more than satisfied with it. The terrace itself is lovely with a lovely view down towards the Bosphorus . Seda at the front desk was more than helpful with any queries we had. The rest of the staff are also very pleasant and more than helpful. Overall we would highly recommend Hotel Niles and look forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value & Location and Superb Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: tkhan
Reviews.Content: I initially came across Hotel Niles whilst searching for a good value hotel for a weekend break in Istanbul. Having read all the positive reviews I decided to go ahead and book a 3 night stay and it certainly lived up to the hype! The one thing that stands out above all else with the hotel is the service and friendliness of the staff, you are greeted by name and with a smile each time without fail. The level of service is also very personal and attentive, I have to mention Kemal and Seda at the front desk for all their help. They provided me and my wife with maps of the local area as well as orientation to ensure you know your way round, recommendation on where to eat on the first night (Meshur Karideniz - which was delicious and excellent value at 17YTL for 2 people!) and they loaned me a free plug converter when I asked where I could buy one? On our 2nd day it happened to be my wife's birthday and they must have spotted this from the registration form we filled in at check in, when we returned from a day of sightseeing there was a bowl of fruit, nuts and turkish delight along with a birthday message waiting on the bed. It's a small gesture but one that had a very big impact. The location may seem a little off putting at first as you are surrounded by textile wholesalers however you are literally a 10 minute walk (15 min max) from all the main tourist sites like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and only across the road from the Grand Bazaar and Bayazid Mosque. If you don't feel like walking then Beyazit Tram station is 2 minutes away and is defnitely the best way of getting round all the main tourist sites for just 1.5 YTL per person per journey. My wife and I did not need to use a taxi during our stay. On most nights we walked back to the hotel and we felt completely safe walking down the streets. I generally felt safer in Istanbul more so than I would in London or Manchester. The view from the terrace is amazing, you can see the Marmara Sea on one side and the Dome and Minaret of the Beyazid Mosque on the other. The breakfast has all the items one would expect from any breakfast buffet and offers a good choice. Make sure you try the home made cakes and the spinach and cheese pastries which were very nice and moreish. Whilst the Hotel only offers breakfast on the roof terrace you can order in from the nearby restaurant and have your meal on the terrace.
