The rooms are clean, which is my main requirement, a lot of people here have complained that they're a bit on the small side but to be honest I didn't find them any smaller than some hotels I've stayed at in London so I guess they're of a typical European size. The Bathroom was very clean and the shower always had hot water at good water pressure. There's free wifi available in the rooms and you're provided a passcode on checking in. We booked the airport transfer on the way in which was expensive at 25 Euros but I would recommend this especially if you're unfamiliar with Istanbul as I would have found it near impossible to direct a taxi driver. We booked a return shuttle from the hotel to the airport which was cheaper at 16 Euros and we got a clean vehicle which arrived at the hotel on time. All in all, I would struggle to find a fault with Hotel Niles, on checking out Seda saw us off to the door and literally waved us goodbye, you really do feel that the staff all take pride in their job and really put in 100%. I have also stayed at the Atlantis in Dubai which was also very nice (but then it would be given it's a 5 star resort) however in terms of providing that personal touch Hotel Niles wins hands down in my opinion. I loved Istanbul and will definitely return and will have no qualms about staying at Hotel Niles again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: ozcanuck
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay at the Niles in early October. I was a bit put off by the location initially, but I soon realized for the price we were paying we were in an excellent location. About half the price of places in Sultanhamet, and only a 10 minute walk away, or two minutes by tram. We were on the 3rd floor, in the very quiet room at the end of the hall. Wireless internet was available throughout the hotel (except on the rooftop restaurant). The room was exactly what you'd expect, slightly compact but clean, comfortable and functional. Perhaps my only complaint would have been a lack of a bathroom vanity, but that is just being picky and wasn't really a huge issue - typical european style. The breakfast was ok - nothing memorable but enough "continental" choices to fill one up before a day of sightseeing. Staff were great - always refilling coffee and replenishing the food. The staff were exceptional, every interaction with them was pleasant and helpful - they really do go out of their way to make your stay in Istanbul a nice one. Our journeys to and from the airport were arranged through the hotel and though much more expensive than a normal taxi, were personal and punctual. Would I stay here again? Yes definitely - next time I'm in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Location”
Reviews.Author: PhelpsHawk
Reviews.Content: This very nice, family-run boutique hotel in the Beyazit district met almost all of our needs with style. As a large 60+-year-old, the rooms and bathrooms/showers are a tad squinchy for me. But the price and location are pretty unbeatable. The staff are wonderful, from the friendly General Manager to the superb front-desk manager - the indispensible Seda, and the glorious roof-top cafe and lounge with dazzling views is simply hard to leave after the leisurely included breakfast. The rooms are basic, very clean, and we only slept there as we were busy shopping and shopping. No real room service, though food can be ordered in to eat on the terrace with drinks provided there. The rooms are not really big enough to eat in. All three of us - professors on the way to and from a conference in Bursa, Turkey - were previous visitors to Istanbul, just an endlessly fascinating city. So, we were not so interested in sightseeing. But the Niles is right off the Tram line (the Blue Mosque just three stops away, the Egyptian Spice Market just beyond that), across the street from Istanbul University and the Grand Bazaar right next door. Also, you quickly figure out, or hear, that as fascinating as the huge Bazaar is, the best deals are all around the Niles Hotel where the wholesalers and workshops are. Leather everything, both gaudy and exquisite, textiles, clothes, silks, jewelry, suitcases of all kinds ... just walk out the front door and start spending. It's worthwhile noting that the hotel arranges very reliable transportation to and from the Airport for only 25 Euros. Also, if you pay your bill in cash they offer a 10% discount. The above-mentioned Tram will also take you over to the Taksim area, which is the other main suggested area to base a visit to Istanbul and where we'd stayed before. But the perfect location and excellent service at the Hotel Niles is our preferred location. Look for several "family apartments" opening up in the new year, currently being completely remodeled in the building next door.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles - Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: LAXHROO
Reviews.Content: For many years my wife and I have been avid followers of tripadvisor and have been rewarded with helpful tips and information. We have never posted a review but our recent stay at the Hotel Niles truly deserve a word or two. Hotel Niles is a boutique hotel located in the Beyazit district - 5minutes from the Grand Bazaar, a short leisurely walk to theTopkapi Palace, Agia Sofia & the Blue Mosque. The tram stop is conveniently located at the end of the street where you'll also find a fantastic delicacy shop seeling all flavors of baklavas and trukish delights. On first arrival, you might get slightly disappointed with the location as the hotel is right smack in the center of business establishments and on a narrow street but don't let this mislead you. It is in fact conveniently located and a very safe place to be in. We once returned to the hotel around 1am after a Turkish dinner and show in a nearby restaurant and never felt any threat to our safety. Being a boutique hotel, please do not expect to find large sized rooms. However, the clealiness of the room, the bathroom and the hotel in general makes for a very pleasant stay. The attention to detail and the level of service is the real reason for this review. The impeccable service we received from Seda, the front office manager, Murat the rooftop terrace server and the hotel staff altogether made our stay very enjoyable. They were always so willing to help with suggestions and anything we needed were taken care of immediately. I think this is a great advantage to staying in smaller hotels. One night, we couldn't sleep because of the time difference and found ourselves in the 24hour rooftop terrace and Murat prepared sandwiches and served us the delicious apple tea - all complimentary! He even kept us entertained until it was time to say goodnight at 4am. Our short 4 night stay was really made enjoyable by Seda and her staff and we're looking forward to our next trip as there is still so much to see of this beautiful country. Keep up the good work and your service of excellence!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break and anniversary at the Niles”
Reviews.Author: Jaqpaddy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 5 nights here to explore Istanbul and celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed. The helpfulness of all the staff right from the start was fantastic and helped us make the very best of our stay so that we got to see everything we wanted. They also recommended places to eat that were really good ranging from restaurants to kebab houses. The waiters on the rooftop bar were very polite and good for a chat when there was no-one else around. On our anniversary we returned to our room after a day cruising on the Bospherous and there we found a vase of flowers, small bottle of wine, bowl of fruit and Turkish Delight. What a lovely surprise. The lady on reception made us a certificate to congratulate us on our anniversary. We really made the right choice staying at the Niles Hotel and would definitely stay here again if we return to Istanbul. We have already recommended it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Istanbul at the Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Piperfred
Reviews.Content: We were guests in room 301 recently leaving on Nov. 1st. I'm writing to share our experience which was extremely positive. I don't know the names of anyone with the exception of a charming young waiter, Urie [?] to whom I wish a happy engagement/marriage but everyone was very nice from the chamber maid with the cute giggle and sweet voice, the porter who was very kind to bring breakfast very early the day we left and especially the beautiful and knowledgeable young woman at the front desk who was always very nice and extremely helpful, I highly recommend this hotel which is located at Ordu Caddesi Dibekli Cami Sokak No: 19 Bayazit-Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smilerneil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the Hotel Niles having booked directly with the Hotel. Customer service was excellent including airport transfers although these were far from cheap. The breakfast was very good, both the food and the view from the roof terrace dining room. The room wasn't the biggest and a little musty but in general not a bad stay at what appears a reasonable price compared to others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel with Excellent Service - Top Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: havachatkiwi
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Niles twice during October 2009. From the greeting on arrival from reception right until the end every staff member was highly professional and the hotel spotlessly clean. The view from the roof top is fabulous looking partly over the Bosphorous and the Cami just up the road adds to the ambiance of Istanbul when the Hoca sings out his prayer call. It is not overly loud as the windows are pretty much soundproofed. This is a nice quiet area at night for sleeping and literally only 3 minutes walk to Grand Bazaar when waklng at normal pace up a wee cobble stoned hill. Breakfast choice was extensive and plentiful. This hotel knows how to provide 5 star service for half the price. All pick ups to and from the airport were arranged for us without any problems. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I will be back when I am next in Istanbul for sure.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret staying here”
Reviews.Author: Tigger94
Reviews.Content: Booked because of good reviews. There are many 4* hotels that could learn from the service, friendliness and cleanliness of this hotel. Yes, rooms are small but you only sleep in them. The rooftop terrace is lovely. There are drinks available all day and evening and you are encouraged to order a takeaway from a nearby restaurant and eat it on the terrace. All the staff speak English- most of them excellently. i cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It is in a side street which may not be easy to find on arrival so I would recommend a pre booked car from the airport - it is worth the extra for the stress free arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: PIHEsbo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is located a 5-10min walk from the well known historical sights in Istanbul. The rooms are relatively small but in a good condition, proper cleaning and not much noise makes it a comfortable place to stay at. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and sercice minded, way beyond our expactations - Thank you. Reasonably priced and all in all a higly recommendable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: capitalcountdowners
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a great stay in Istanbul. Agree with all the comments from other reviewers, small but adequate, very clean rooms, friendly, helpful staff who really want you to enjoy your stay in their city. Great views from the rooftop terrace bar. All in all a great base from which to explore this amazing city. Ask at reception about where to eat and they will direct you to a great restaurant, Amedros, excellent food and service and good value meals. We tried a few other restaurants while we were there but this one was the best. As previously mentioned by another reviewer, taxi pick up was excellent, and the driver tried to communicate things of interest to us on our way to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget, no lux, great staff”
Reviews.Author: freakytsz
Reviews.Content: Of course booked this hotel after the great reviews. True for great friendly staff, they all make very good effort. (this is the best part of this hotel) Good price for what it is, clean rooms / bathrooms, location is fair, convenient with the tram although the surroundings aren't so nice (surrounded by factorys making clothes all day till midnight) but that is not a bother as these are just simple local people (we didn't feel unsafe). It is just about 3 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar. It's a good small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Combination of Price, Place and Service”
Reviews.Author: wfwbklyn
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this and other Hotels I chose the Niles based on the high ratings it garnered, even though it was 'only' a 2 star facility. The reviews were completely reliable. As promised, via email, I was met at the airport by a driver whose English was limited but whose demeanor was friendly and willing to try and communicate as we struggled through rush hour traffic. The staff expected me and ushered me to my single room which was actually a double bed. As a 2 star hotel, the facilities were modest but more than adequate. Abundant hot water, crisp sheets, working AC and TV and even a small frig. Not luxurious for those who want pampering but in no sense uncomfortable or cramped. Like many European hotels, the room was smaller than US rooms, but it was spotless. An energy savings feature is that your key parks in a slot so that when you leave all the lights and appliances turn off within 15 seconds. But as you need the same key to unlock the door, timing the process can be tricky at night. Breakast on the roooftoip terrace was wonderful. Great food, from local bureks and cheeses and yogurt, to more western cereals and scrambled eggs and fresh vegetables. Juice and coffee and tea were always fresh and good. Staffers were eager to help and bused dishes quickly. The view from the roof was lovely, both inside and out. Desk staff had good English skills and were very eager to help me. They pointed me towar the Bosphoros tour pier, told me how much and how to buy it. My unusual trip to Iznik required them to look up sea-bus schedules and prices and minibus conenctions from Yalova to Iznik and back. Except for some momentary confusion at the IDO ticket window owing to my lack of Turkish and their lack of English everything went very smoothly. But without guidance from the hotel staff it would have been much harder. I observed the entire staff to be friendly, eager to help, and competent. The waiter on staff will call a nearby locanta and have dinner delievered to the hotel where you can eat it on the same rooftop terrace at night. They serve drinks then (additional cost) alo ng with other small foods. For someone traveling alone the nightly chance to relax and even converse with the staff was great. One could hardly feel more at ease or at home anywhere else. One staffer regretted I could not come home to meet his family. Another purchased a digital camera that exactly like mine and asked me to help set it up for him. Such open hearted ways made my first trip to Istanbul and Turkey about as good as someone could imagine. Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with great staff”
Reviews.Author: benbenben
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located several hundred yards off the main road and tram stop in Beyazit. At night the road is dark and looks a bit dodgey, especially as you walk past a few other dimly lit hotels, but in fact it feels safe, and Hotel Niles stands out like a beacon. It looks new and clean and welcoming. The rooms are nothing to write home about - simple, with a small TV and fridge, basic bedding, and no great views from the window. But bear in mind that this is only a 3* hotel, so you can't expect luxury! The great things however, are the staff, who are always hospitable and knowledgeable, and the breakfast on the roof terrace. A very adequate selection, and great views to boot. Add in free wireless internet, or use of the PC in reception, and from 50 -70 euros for a double room, this is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SBSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 2 nights, and found every staff member to be helpful and attentive. Rooms were a bit small, but the standard size for a European hotel room, and meticulously clean. My room was on the first floor, right above the hotel's sign, and there was street noise nearly all night long. Their windows blocked out most of the noise. Being right on the street also caused the room to stay somewhat light during the night. Inside the hotel, things were quiet. Best of all was the wonderful breakfasts on the rooftop terrace, including a wonderful view. A great place to escape the noise and busyness of the city. Stayed there as a single female and felt safe. As others have mentioned, there is a steep uphill walk of about 4 blocks to the main street and other sights, so it may be difficult for anyone with physical challenges.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel staff ever”
Reviews.Author: jmrsacto
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles is a great place to stay in Istanbul. The location in the Beyazit neighborhood is out of, but close to, the tourist bubble - a good thing in my book. Breakfast in the terrace cafe was terrific and the staff was warm and welcoming. Spotlessly clean, if somewhat small rooms. A great choice - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: honlewis
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is in the old district within easy walking distance to all of the great sites. It is very reasonably priced and includes a nice buffet breakfast on the roof terrace. Even though the rooms are somewhat small and utilitarian, they are clean and nicely appointed. It is located off the beaten track in a local neighborhood which gives you a real feel for the city. Seda, the front desk manager, LOVES her job and it shows. She is a gracious hostess and willingly shares her knowledge of this great city. Her recommendations for dining were wonderful and she directed us to sites that we would never have found on our own. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it for anyone wanting to get the feel of the real Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are Right.”
Reviews.Author: kgtband
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. From the moment that we arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was European style. It was simple, but very nicely decorated. It had all the basics: TV, free WiFi, Air conditioning, hot water, comfortable beds, delicious rooftop breakfast, computer with printer downstairs, staff eager to make recommendations. Although, they don't serve dinner, a nearby restaurant will deliver to the rooftop terrace. The hotel is close to a tram stop and the Grand Bazaar, and about a 15 minute walk to the other main attractions. For gay travelers, they did not think twice about given two men a double bed. It's not close to any gay establishments, but they would be easily accessible by the trams. (I guess. We didn't actually go to any).

Reviews.Title: “a gem hotel”
Reviews.Author: billpall
Reviews.Content: As we made our way to Hotel Niles, I had some misgivings. We were in the European and older part of the city and the sourrounding area was older looking apartments and a working class neighborhood. But when we turned the corner and here stood Niles, a bright clean hotel so the sourrounding looks are very deceptive. We met Seda, who checked us in. This hotel is worth the stay if only for Seda. She is a Turkish delight. Her English is very good and her sense of humor even better. She shared information and tip on how to deal with the Turkish vendors. She is the perfect fit for her job. The hotel is 5 stories with an elevator and looks like its been completely remodeled. Very clean and neat. They have a lobby internet PC available at no charge and a rooftop resturant which overlooks the harbor. Breakfast is ample and included in the room price. The rooms are functional although it would have been nice to have the mini fridge work in our room. Like some European hotels, when you leave the room, all the electric is turned off so you return to a warm room and warm fridge if it works. Best yet, is the location of the hotel. It's a 5 minute walk to the trolly line to all the major attractions and, right where you get the trolley stop, the Grand Bazaar is a 1 minute walk away. You couldn't ask for a better location. Although the area looks a bit seedy, we were out at night and didn't have any worries for our safety. I'd strongly recommend this hotel and will stay there again for a second visit to Istanbul. I loved the city and its culture and definately will return. sanddune58@tampabay.rr.com

Reviews.Title: “friendly, comfortable, clean, 'authentic'”
Reviews.Author: FeistyLass
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff speak good English, and made every effort to be helpful. Hotel organised our transfer from easyjet airport. Recommended local Hamam (turkish speaking only, clean, down to earth), where to eat etc if you wanted. Good value. Â£70 for a reasonable sized twin room - not big enough if you were to be spending a lot of time in it though. Firm beds, decent linen & pillows. Very clean. TV didn't work. Street quiet until around 9am. Heard muezzin one morning out of three, but that's probably difficult to avoid. Bathroom also v clean, decent towels, good shower (no bath), shampoo/shower gel/soap provided, small but not pokey. Rooftop restaurant simple with view overlooking Marmarus (several blocks back from the port). Breakfast good - basic cereals, fresh fruits, the usual continental stuff, boiled/scramble eggs, breads. Location good in terms of being 10-15 mins walk from Blue Mosque, without feeling that you're in the middle of a tourist area. Not a particularly smart area, but we felt safe and it also felt 'authentic'. 200m is main road with metro / shops/eateries for locals rather than tourists. However, no handy bar/restaurant to have as your 'local'. Felt safe in the nearby streets at night altho it was very quiet. Couple of blocks away there are several brightly lit restaurants, as full of locals and musicians as foreign tourists. A bit further is a small all day fish market and about 5 restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tellit_Likeit_Iz
Reviews.Content: I would recomment this hotel to anyone. The staff were extremely friendly and spoke very good english. Location, Location, Location - right where the action is, couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find! And great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Isabella_LondonToday
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews. Both my husband and I were not disappointed. The rooms are small but clean. They were made every day and replenished with fresh towels. It was an easy walking distance to the main tourist site like the Grand Bazaar and Aya Sofia. And it was close to a tram stop if you didn't want to walk. But the best thing about it was the great staff. Everyone was extremely helpful, friendly and accomodating. I highly recommend this place. It's not a 2 star. It would definately be a 3 star hotel. Worth the money. Just a couple of tips: â€¢ Instanbul is more expensive than we thougt it would be. A meal for the two of us at a decent restaurant (nothing fancy) for dinner plus two alcoholic drinks (like beer) was about 80 - 100 Turkish lyra. â€¢ a great find was the local restaurant the hotel recommended that was literally a block or two away. It had tasty food and was cheap! A kebab was 8.50 lyra and a mixed salad was 4.50. Something along those lines. It was so good we went back for lunch the next day. â€¢ VERY IMPORTANT TIP: We booked a pick up from the airport to the hotel. My husband paid the driver when we got to the hotel. DO NOT PAY THE DRIVER!!!!! PAY THE HOTEL DIRECTLY ONLY! When we checked out we realised the hotel was still waiting for the amount. When we told them we already paid the driver, they contacted the driver and he denied receiving any money. What a liar! I saw my husband hand the money over to him!!!! The hotel staff were really good though. They just took our word for it and let it go. So that meant they didn't get paid whatever portion it was they normally get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / service / value for money”
Reviews.Author: mulika
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews so we went with high expectations. These were met and exceeded. The location could not be better...it's quiet (except for early morning calls to prayer), minutes from the tram / buses, walking distance to all areas of Sultanahmet & many good restaurants nearby. The staff are friendly and very helpful; they remember who you are and the room number too. Rooms are neat, fresh and very clean. Breakfast on the rooftop balcony was always a refreshing way to start the day with fresh fruit, cereal, eggs and toast etc. Also relaxing at night with a white wine or coffee. We booked through Expedia and it was great value ! Would not hesitate to recommend to others. Mulika

Reviews.Title: “A touch of luxury and warmth”
Reviews.Author: BuddyShreveport
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles was a wonderful place after our disappointing accommodations in Rome. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast and view from the roof top dining balcony was superb. The most helpful and friendly staff you will find anywhere. It is withing walking distance to historic sites, great restaurants, shopping, and the famous Turkish baths. Also they have a computer to use for free. The staff will also help print e-tickets for you. If you are going to Instabul, this is the best value you will find - we hope to go back again. Jerry and Mary Silmon

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles gives fantastic value for your money; we loved the staff, the terrace, everything!”
Reviews.Author: McGregor34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I "lived" at Niles for 15 days and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The receptionists Kemal and Seda gave us their undivided attention when we had questions; they were thoroughly helpful in arranging activities and reservations for us, were always professional, but never lacked a sense of humor and fun. The terrace on the roof, with its gorgeous view of the sea, provided a serene, even romantic, place to relax from the jostle of the city, and it was open 24 hours a day for hotel guests. Our room was simple but comfortable and quiet, the shower always had plenty of hot water, the bath towels were of great quality, and the bed was excellent. Above all, the staff was warmly welcoming and showed a sincere interest in our well-being.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Value near all the sights.”
Reviews.Author: Cultural-Chameleon
Reviews.Content: The Niles is right off the Blvd that the metro runs on. Still a few Taxi drivers had trouble finding it. It is nestled in a mini manufacturing area a block or two from the Grand Bazaar. It's roof top deck overlooks the city and has a water view. Walking distance to all the sights. The rooms are smallish but comfortable. A/C, modern clean bathroom. An exceptionally good value. What tops it off is the friendliness and knowledge of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding trip with a very friendly accomodation”
Reviews.Author: TravellersFamily
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and my 2 teenage boys) stayed in Niles hotel from 20-24 Sep. Great location close to the bazaar, Sultan Ahmet mosque, Aya Sophia, tram station I would say ideal location. The rooms are small, bit old but very very clean. The staff is the real jewel in this hotel (room service, cleaning...etc..) very friendly ,helpful extreemly polite, however Mr. Kemal (in particular) in the reception helped us alot during our stay, very polite, professional and very helpful. The breakfast on the terrace very nice with a impressive view, we knew from Ms Seda, next year will be more facilities which I will definitely put in mind while planning our next trip to Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rafried
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple recently spent two weeks in Turkey. One week of the trip was spent in Istanbul at the Hotel Niles. I had booked this hotel because of the comments on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The rooms are small, but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the rooftop terrace was the best we had while on the trip. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and gave us great advise for shopping and restaurants. The location opposite the Grand Bazaar was perfect for us as we enjoyed walking around the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly staff and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: Gordod
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a lovely time. We were very well cared for by the friendly staff who went out of their way to offer advice and assistance. The room had basic minimalist decore and was on the smaller side but was beautifully clean. The breakfast was served on the upper terrace which had views to the water. There was plenty on tasty choices on offer for breakfast. We felt the hotel offered good value for money and was handy to the Grand Bazaar and comfortable walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the train system.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: tjcantor
Reviews.Content: We saw the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to stay a night at the Hotel Niles Istanbul before flying on to Cappadocia. It is conveniently located in the Bazaar district and not as touristy as Sultanahmet. The streets are narrow and cobbly, which makes for difficult walking, and are not very well lit at night. This, however, is about the only negative point to make. The reception staff were very friendly throughout our stay and we were offered a free welcome drink in the cafe on the roof terrace. This is where we had our breakfast. There was a good variety of fresh fruit, nuts, cereals, breads, juices, omelette etc. to choose from and there is a nice view from the terrace. Free wireless internet was available throughout the hotel and was reliable. Our room was on the 5th floor but was easy to get to using a small elevator. For those with large luggage, several trips may be necessary. Our room itself was spacious and furnished with a cupboard, coach and table. Use of the security box requires a 20 Euro deposit as it requires a key. As we only stayed one night, we can not comment on the level and trustworthiness of the cleaning. Our stay cost us 68 Euro all tax. incl. when paid by cash.

Reviews.Title: “A Cozy Palace for the Sultan and his Queen”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSultan
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the heart of the Grand Bazaar and in close proximity to the world renowned Blue Mosque, and many other tourist attractions,including remarkable marketplaces, boutique shops, convenient transportation venues, and critically acclaimed restaurants, the Hotel Niles Istanbul is truly the crown jewel of hotels in terms of its warm and comfortable atmosphere creating a distinctive mood with all of the amenities and the feeling of a luxurious five star hotel at an affordable price. Highlights include overall "Excellent" service, cleanliness, breakfast, and outstanding assistance provided by the Front Office Manager, Ms. Seda Kucukbenli who not only bespeaks a delightful demeanor and personality but is always ready, willing and able to help. This Hotel enjoys my highest recommendation and is fully endorsed and signed by The Sultan, Mr. Fernando and His Queen, Mrs. Ofelia Ortiz.

Reviews.Title: “A Standard Stay - Americanized!”
Reviews.Author: Kochevnik
Reviews.Content: Honestly I'm not sure what all the hype is about. I don't have any specific complaints, but my wife and I stayed here for one night on a return trip to Istanbul before heading to the airport. Honestly, there are other hotels and bed and breakfasts elsewhere in Istanbul that are more conveniently located, with better service, better rooms, better food AND at a better price. I suppose if you are with a big group, and you cannot stay in a smaller location then consider this place, but otherwise look around. Also, I must confess: after a travelling in Turkey, we were a little stunned to find such a high concentration of American tourists in one hotel! If you like this, this is your place, if you want more local colour and international variety in the hotel guests, beware!! Your breakfast on the terrace will most likely include guys in baseball caps slurping up breakfast cereal and older retired American businessmen loudly telling other guests how they could run the economy better than Obama (this was my direct experience). The rooms were standard, and fairly simple when compared to other Turkish hotel rooms, with an ancient TV that did not work. The food was likewise standard, and had less than the usual Turkish selection (plus American fares such as omelets and cereal). The terrace view is also so-so as there is another terrace under construction between you and any view of the Marmara Sea, which is not that close to Beyazit in any case. Beyazit is a fine location for shopping at the grand bazaar, but you would be better off staying in Sultanahmet or Beyoglu. Overall, the price and quality would be equivalent to a Days Inn or Holiday Inn in the States (2-3 stars), but bear in mind that this is Turkey, not North America! There are some good deals on great hotels out there!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and was very impressed. The location is good with the hotel about a 5-15 minute walk from the central historical sites. It is a 3-4 minute walk to the nearest tram station which will get you to all of the major attractions of the city. However, as it is not in the central historical area, there are limited late night options for food and it gets pretty quiet. During the day, there are lots of food places, ATMs, etc minutes away. The most direct route from the tram station is a little dodgy at night (nothing happened, but itâ€™s very quiet), so I suggest going down one more street where there are more people and then doubling back by walking through the street full of boutique hotels. The hotel is also located on a semi-steep hill area, so it may be frustrating for people with mobility problems. The rooms are a little aged but decently sized and clean. The cleaning staff is nice and helpful â€“ one of them folded my clothes because they were lying everywhere! The staff in general was amazing from the waiter to reception. Many of them have worked there for many years so it has a â€˜family hotelâ€™ type of feel. Breakfast was good and served on a beautiful rooftop patio overlooking the city and the ocean. I think this hotel is a great deal given the relative low price of the rooms. I booked through a travel site and got a great deal, but you can also get good rates from their website. You can also arrange for hotel transportation through the website, but I found getting a normal taxi (or using the subway/tram) more economical.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hosts in the world”
Reviews.Author: DaveDixon
Reviews.Content: Room quality high considering the price (yes, small), the roof-top dining/lounge absolutely exquisite. I'm not one to rave, but the people are, by far, the nicest hotel staff I've ever met anywhere in the world. The location is convenient to Sultanahmet and very close to the tram line that takes you anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bluebird81
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides brilliant value for money in a good location (although the street you walk down from the main road is a little grim), it is literally a 2 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and a 10 minute walk to Aya Sofia. We stayed for 4 nights and were greeted by Seda. She speaks amazingly good English, is charming and very helpful (as are all of the staff). The rooms are reasonable. They have everything you need but in my opinion could do with a little freshen up (unlike the communal areas that are lovely), and unfortunately the views from most bedrooms are non existant. On the plus side there is a fridge, a free safe and excellent air con! Breakfast is served on the roof and is great - a good selection of breads meats cheese plus eggs and cereal and juice and coffee. The hotel has free wifi in the rooms or a computer in the lobby that you can use - very handy! Given the hotels price compared to many others and the excellent staff I would not hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “You read compliments from websites about this hotel is without doubt, its the best”
Reviews.Author: DickenM
Reviews.Content: We looked around the web for some where to stay in istanbul and we came across the Niles Hotel, all I can say all the good comments we read where true. From the Hotel Pickup at the airport, we had excellent service from all the staff, the hotel rooftop bar/ breakfast terrace gives you wonderful views and a nice place to relax after a wonderful day out.( And you very close walking distance to all local places of interest) The breakfast buffet is truly wonderful, with local pastries and breads, the rooms are clean and with regular changes of towels and bed linen and the staff are always aim to please and we will stay there again in the near future. Michael & June Dicken

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be improved upon”
Reviews.Author: Marcy22Seattle
Reviews.Content: We decided to try Hotel Niles (pronounced NEE - lis) based on reviews here on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The rooms are small but neat and clean. We had breakfast on the terrace, which was lovely, and they also ordered dinner for us from a local restaurant and served it to us on the terrace. We can't say enough about the staff. Hamel was gracious and warm, and was more of a concierge than a front desk manager. We had only 1.5 days (this was actually a layover on a longer trip) and he helped us find the best ways to take advantage of our short time here. We cannot recommend Hotel Niles strongly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: kateb1personal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay at Hotel Niles and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the roof terrace is an inspiring way to start the day. The location, with its and proximity to major attractions and public transport was ideal. What really stood out was the staff though, who in every instance were unfailingly friendly and helpful. We recommend you head up for a drink on the roof terrace to watch the sun go down and rest your feet after a long day - the bar is open 24 hours which we were not aware of until day two.

Reviews.Title: “A small, yet classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevtak1
Reviews.Content: General info/pros: Good locationâ€”on a small, quiet street perpendicular to the louder main drag. We could easily find it at all hours of day or night. 10-15 minute walk to main tourist attractions and right next to the Grand Bazaar and a tram stop. The rooms are quite small, so you have to manage your space carefully, but being on a small side ourselves, we didnâ€™t have any problems. Really liked the dÃ©corâ€”simple, but not bare, with predominantly light colorsâ€”unlike a lot of hotels tend to be excessively ornate. The atmosphere is great. The rooms are very cleanâ€”perhaps not quite at vertiginous Japanese standards (if you really set out to look for a speck of dust, you may find it), but head and shoulders above most of hotels in Turkey and even the United States, excepting the most expensive ones. For most part, the staff will work hard to satisfy additional requests (for extra pillows and blankets, etc.) and are very prompt about answering emails. We arrived on a very early flight, and were allowed to check in at 10:00 am instead of the standard 3:00 pm, which we really appreciated. When checking us in, the front office manager remembered our room preference (away from the elevator). I used the ironing room in the basement, and can testify that the â€œprivateâ€� areas of the hotel are as clean as well-organized as the â€œpublicâ€� ones, a sure sign of a well-run establishment. Things to consider: The one thing the hotel really lacks is a laundry service. Itâ€™s understandable that they donâ€™t want people doing their own laundry in the hotel basement at all hours of day and night, but I think that paid laundry service would have been great and spared us the necessity of doing our own laundry in the sink. As to the front staff, they are all uniformly courteous, but their expertise level, command of English and the willingness to go that extra mile for a guest varies from person to person. I found myself reserving most of my questions and concerns for â€œstrongerâ€� staff members, and I think Hotel Niles would do well to make sure to bring all of their front desk staff up to their standard. This hotel was fully renovated four years ago, but some fixtures/amenities are beginning to wearâ€”for example, the refrigerator door didnâ€™t close tightly, so we had to keep our food in the upstairs cafÃ© fridge (I was hoping they would replace the room fridge when I brought it up, but the front desk staff merely replied that it was â€œa very simple fridgeâ€� and offered to have someone take the food upstairs). Also, my shower drained a little slowly. Bottom line: Despite its small size and modest price, the hotel is a classy affair. Itâ€™s well worth your money, and if we ever return to Istanbul, we plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LASTING IMPRESSION”
Reviews.Author: FreoTrio
Reviews.Content: To our dearest friends Kemal, Sammi, Murrat and all the other wonderful people at the Niles Hotel. From Baba & Tania (Perth, Australia). Turkey has left a remarkable lifelong memory!. As for the actual hotel there's absolutely nothing to fault! Conveniently located in Sultanhamet, loacted to public transport (Beyazit tram stop), a pleasant stroll to all the historical sites plus across the road from the FAMOUS Grand Bazaar. All the reviews on the Niles Hotel were spot on....the owner of this hotel is very fortunate due to his staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Niles is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MMDNY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles, in the Beyazit section of Istanbul, is a wonderful small hotel. We were travelling as an extended family (grandfather, father, mother, and two children), and we very much enjoyed our stay. The rooms are incredibly clean, and the staff are all unbelievably responsive and friendly. They were expert guides to the city, and they helped us with our Turkish, teaching us new phrases each day of our stay. Seda, in particular, was so helpful, giving us tips about negotiating in the bazaar and recommending restaurants for us. Aside from the staff, the most wonderful aspect to the hotel was the amazing breakfast each day. Eggs, fresh yogurt, fruits and vegetables were all delicious, but the pastries and breads Seda's mother makes -- especially the borek -- were a revelation! We look forward to the next time that we can be in Istanbul and stay at the Hotel Niles

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and great value”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on my recent trip to Istanbul, and had a great time. Rooms are basic, but nice and clean (and with airco - great in August in Istanbul), staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: WorldviewNW
Reviews.Content: Located in a "real" neighborhood (not touristy) just a 5 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar and the tram line. The rooms were a little small, but not unusual for a major city. They were clean and very comfortable. All the staff were friendly and helpful, particularly the front desk who were exceptional. The breakfast buffet was abundant and full of variety; everything was fresh. Breakfast was on the roof terrace, which had a great view of the Sea of Mamara and all the ships waiting to go into the Black Sea. We stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of our 30-day trip to Turkey and again for 3 nights at the end of our trip. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place away from home”
Reviews.Author: pilarlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My friends & I LOVED the Hotel Niles! We have all traveled extensively throughout the world & I can say that the Hotel Niles offers a service that is better than that of a 5 star hotel! Every single staff member is incredibly kind, welcoming & accommodating beyond belief. We had some of the best night at the Hotel Niles.. I'm already missing seeing their bright cheerful faces. The rooms are a bit small, however the location of the hotel & the service make the Hotel Niles the best choice in my opinion. Seda, the other front office gentleman & Murat went well above & beyond to make our trip perfect!! I highly, highly, highly recommend the Hotel Niles!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful expereince”
Reviews.Author: OZMUk
Reviews.Content: After reading excellent reviews of Hotel Niles at various websites I decided to book this hotel for my short stay in Istanbul. As described in the reviews, I also a had wonderful expereince of staying at this hotel. Staff is very friendly and provides great customer service. They will go an extra mile to service you for whatever you need. Location is like a 10-15 mins walk to Sultanahmet or 5 mins by Tram which is actually very convenient. Rooms are neat and clean and are serviced every day. I would definetly recommend this hotel to those who are looking for a budget hotel with excellent customer and room services in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation for Niles Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerSarajevo
Reviews.Content: We spent five very nice days in this charming hotel. It has great staff, very kind and friendly and always ready to help and to give answers on all your questions. The rooms are tidy and clean. On the roof there is a cafe restaurant with a beautiful view on the sea. On this terrace breakfast is served and you can enjoy in tasty food, including turkish home made dishes. On this place, during the day and evening you can take drinks and relax. The price is incredible for such kind of service! Family from Bosnia and Herzegovina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaperMidge
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July so we could explore a bit of Istanbul. The location is amazing and the hotel itself it really lovely. I wasn't expecting such nice surroundings for the price. The staff is SO helpful an make your stay great. The rooftop terrace has a wonderful view. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAL74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul in July 2009 and I can say without doubt it is the friendliest most personal hotel I have ever stayed in. Our room was basic but had everything you need, plus it was immaculately clean. From the chamber maids to the restaurant staff and Front Desk everyone makes you feel at home and is always willing to help out. The roof top restaurant/bar is a fantastic little location with some great views out to sea, the service is good and the complimentary breakfast is great. If you are staying in Old Istanbul and want a great location at an affordable price you should definitely consider Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “When you go home, you definitely wanna come back here....”
Reviews.Author: SaminBayat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find: we took the tramway to Beyazit station; then It's a 2-minute walk away. We were warmly welcomed by Seda, the always-smiling-lady at the reception. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. The rooms are a little small but quiet, clean and comfortable. The location is excellent: It's in the Bazar district. Sultanahmet sq (where Hagia Sophia and Blue mosque are) is the next station after Beyazit. The best is the breakfast buffet with home-made cakes on the roof where you have a view of the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Hotel Niles where the cleanliness and staff were terrific”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers99
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Holel Niles for four nights in early July. The Hotel was spotlessly clean, quiet and well located. The included breakfast, which was served on the rooftop terrace, was fresh and delicious. Seda, the front office manager, provided excellent advice on the do's and don'ts of Istanbul. All of the staff were friendly and eager to help. The hotel was located within walking distance of major tourist sites. It was quiet at night. It is not an international resort, so we did not expect a swimming pool or fitness equipment. But it was also close to the waterfront if you needed to go for a run. Overall, we felt it was very good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, compact hotel, ideally suited to explore the sites on foot.”
Reviews.Author: Bertybign
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money and the staff tried so hard to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Located between main tramway and fish market within short walk of grand bazaar. Room was small but adequate with Air con that worked. The receptionist, a young lady was both charming and beautiful. Only one minor, negative comment. The music played in the restaurant was best suited for short elevator trips - please, will somebody change the CD! Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this small, clean, comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: paullones99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Niles from 20th June to 27th June 2009. Hotel staff and management were friendly and helpful like most of the people we met in Istanbul. The hotel is ideally located for the Grand Bazaar and only 10-15 walk to Sultanahmet where the Blue Mosque and other attractions are located. The hotel rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. If you are looking for somewhere comfortable and convenient to stay you canâ€™t go too far wrong with Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: mkradamsOgden
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Niles provided us with a convenient and comfortable base of operations for our Istanbul stay. Close to the Grand Bazaar, it is a short walk from the Beyazit Metro stop and also a short walk to the Sultanahmet sites. The Hotel provides a tremendous value but, most importantly, the staff was courteous and accommodating and did everything possible to enhance our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel wih excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: lionbury
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed in Niles hotel. Whilst being a small hotel the reception gives a big service and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. The rooms all appear to be standard rooms but some are larger than others. We initially had double but this was smaller than a twin, so we asked if we could have a twin with beds together. Very obliging and we moved to a larger room. The excellent breakfast is on the roof terrace with excellent views of Marmara Sea. Upon arrival we checked the other suite room and preferred to stay Like other hotels, the extras are in euros. One point to note is the hotel is on a steep road and may not suit some people. Another point is that the area has lots of mosques and the call can be heard late a night and morning at sunrise, but you soon get used to it. I am sure most other hotels also have mosques in the vicinity. The Met and bus services are very close. I have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Niles Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEERNUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Niles hotel from the 11th to the 18th of June 2009. This is a great little hotel that has excellent staff that truly make the stay in the hotel worthwhile. Location wise it is also fantastic less then 5 minuite walk to the tram to the Beyazit tram stop which is only a couple of stops to the centre of Sultanahmet or can just as easily be walked in 10-15 mins. For the Grand Bazaar entrance this is possibly one of the best to stay at as the entrance is the near the the tram stop. Breakfast is reasonable and there is sufficient variety, however i did suggest fresh juice should be available and that hot water as opposed to tea that is overboiled...... The rooms are small but completely functional especially if like us you are going to be out for most of the day, specifically our room 401 is probably in need of some redecoration this was one closest to the lift but did not hear to much noise. The Air condition worked perfectly and was grealtly needed during our stay, also a small but good shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service, Value”
Reviews.Author: aowats
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not all that large, but this is a great place to stay at reasonable cost right near the Blue Mosque and other attractions in the Sultanahment section of the city. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, and Seda, one of the Front Desk personnel, was particularly helpful. We stayed with our grown children for four nights at the start of a 17-day Turkish adventure, and again for two nights at the end of our trip. The airconditioning was needed in that it was prematurely quite hot, and I'm happy to say that, as opposed to many reasonably-priced hotels, the airconditioning at the Niles was up-to-date. Our individual unit had a problem one night and the management promptly dealt with it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: velipekka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Niles during the Formula1 weekend. I think all is said in the previous reviews: So clean, so good location, a charming roof terrace, delicious breakfast and what a wonderful staff ! Never forget the atmoshpere at nights at the roof terrace as the full moon lighted the Marmara sea. We really enjoyed our stay there. Please, keep going like that...with those prices ;- )

Reviews.Title: “Just as Good the Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: sulsal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed the Niles when we stayed there in january '08. I wondered if it would still measure up a few weeks ago when we stayed there for two nights. I am very happy to say it did. The Niles still provides incredible value, a very good staff and a very convenient location very close to the sights but without the constant harassment by salesmen that you get in Sultanahmet. Two examples of how special this place is. We were buying a bottle of water (you can't drink the tap water in Istanbul) in the tiny shop near the Niles when a man greeted us warmly. It was Sami -- one of the wonderful waiters at the Niles - -who remembered us from out last stay. The next morning I stayed away from the wonderful rooftop breakfast because of a stomach bug I had picked up. When my husband returned with tea and a bit of simit (sp?) for me, there also wad a pile of cherries that Sami insisted I eat because they were good for a troublesome tummy. I ate the cherries, slept for another three hours and woke up cured! Thanks to Sami we spent our last afternoon in Istanbul with a wonderful visit to St. Savior in Chora and a great late lunch at Asitane (EAT THERE!!!) next to that wonderful Byzantine Church. The Niles should also do everythiong to keep their wonderful front desk staff there as well as all the other folks like Sami.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff!Excellent Value for money...”
Reviews.Author: nztraveller8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance to The grand Bizaar, the blue mosque, the fish markets/restaurants etc...location was excellent..the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly and breakfast on the roof top was a great way to start the day, the room was spacious enough and very clean...

Reviews.Title: “great staff; good location”
Reviews.Author: SCRTX
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small hotel in a good location close to the Grand Bazaar. Great staff that was very helpful, friendly and professional. We had a 6 am flight out of Istanbul, so we had a 3:30 am wake-up call. And they delivered breakfast to our door at 3:45---very thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tombeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near to the main historic sites and very near to tram cars. The rooms are good but the highlights are the rooftop breakfast room/bar. This has superb views over the Sea of Marmara and has both indor and outdoor facilities. They gave us first class advice abiout restaurants and the like. To my mind it offers really excellent value for money. My onle reservation would be that it is positioned on a steepish hill which may not be suitable for wheelchairs and the like.

Reviews.Title: “Super terrace, friendly service & delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hjtWindsor_England
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for one night but the highlight has to be the super terrace & friendly service. Despite the fact that the hotel is situated in the commercial part of town. the terrace had a lovely view over the sea and even a telescope was provided. The midday sandwich and ample breakfast that we experienced up there were of a high quality and a wide selection of breakfast foods was available. The bedrooms were simple and comfortable and my white duvet was just the thing to snuggle under after a hard day sightseeing. The view from the windows (which could open if required) was of the surrounding shops/businesses. The hotel was within walking distance of most attractions. Seda, the receptionist was very helpful as was the chief waiter on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base in a romantic city”
Reviews.Author: sidneyxx
Reviews.Content: Once again we were guided by Trip Advisor reviews in our choice of the Niles, and once again they were spot on. I feel like praising Trip Advisor as much as the Niles. I can only repeat what so many reviewers have said - it's such a welcoming little hotel that you can quite easily believe your are one of the "family"; Seda and Kemal were exceptional in their help, but as we stayed for nearly two weeks we equally found Sami and Murat helpful, and almost like friends; the breakfast upstairs on the terrace was always our favourite part of the day (we stayed at some top hotels overseas afterwards, but never had such a fresh and enjoyable breakfast as we had at the Niles); the rooms (as was the whole hotel) were spotless; the location was great, we could walk to just about everywhere, and if we wanted to get the tram it was just at the top of the road (The Grand Bazaar was our stop - sounds great, doesn't it?); their arrangements for airport transfers were excellent and just so convenient. As you will gather, we had a wonderful time in Istanbul, a very romantic yet vibrant city, and our stay at the Niles made it just that much more special. It would never have been the same if we had chosen to stay at some smart European style hotel away from the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Romadman
Reviews.Content: Just wanted everybody to know about the great people at this hotel.They went out of their way (especially Seda and Murrat) to make our stay fun. The hotel is small, clean and has a great terrace on the roof. The location is not great but close to all the things we wanted to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sierragoddess
Reviews.Content: With the recommendations from the TripAdvisor site, we stayed at the Hotel Niles. We thought the name appropriate. We were not disappointed. The service was excellent. We were received at the airport and taken to the hotel at an early hour. Very happy with all services. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but the hotel is clean! That speaks volumes!! The breakfast buffet was excellent. The staff was courteous and curious (as we are from Egypt). The location was excellent for us, as we tend to venture into local communities and stay away from touristic ventures (as in night clubs and bars). Even though I was taking a break from the internet, I did find it helpful that they had a computer in the lobby for guest use. Overall, we will definitely stay here again. (and we have already recommended it to 2 different friends who will be staying there in the future)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Loshalp
Reviews.Content: We chose the Niles Hotel after checking out Tripadvisor recommendations and were not disappointed. The location is very good, across the road from the Grand Bazaar but in a quiet side street. The tram service is just as close and can take you to all the popular spots. As other tripadvisors have written the hotel staff are super helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The rooms are not huge but they are comfortable, although the TV reception was no good - we didn't go to watch TV! and everything else worked well (plenty of hot water). Plus the price was right, really excellent value. Go and check it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles helped us to make our Trip in Istanbul an unforgetable one”
Reviews.Author: Sharifraisi
Reviews.Content: We spent our birthdays in Istanbul. Since it was our first time there, we were a bit worried. But the staff in Hotel Niles specially Ms. Seda Kucukbenli (Front desk manager) helped us out with all our queries about places to go,booking cruises and spa for us,giving proper detailed guidance. It gave us the energy to go out every day exploring the country when you know there is someone supporting and helping you with it. The hotel also provided us with a surprise on our birthday night which both of us thought was fantastic. We will definately go back to Istanbul and stay only and only in HOTEL NILES. Sharif & Lesley

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great value”
Reviews.Author: babybat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul for 6 days, and the Hotel Niles was a great base for us. Literally 2 minutes walk from Beyazit tram stop, the Grand Bazaar (and an amazing Lamacun stall - 2YTL and tastes great!) and about 10 minutes walk from the rest of Sultanahmet. The room was small, and the decoration a bit quaint, but it was absolutely spotless, comfortable, and well maintained. Small fridge in the room was a nice touch as we could keep water, beer & snacks in the room. The breakfast terrace was a lovely way to start the day - great views of the Marmara sea and the food was fresh and nice, although not very varied. The real selling point of this hotel though is the staff - they are all very friendly and helpful, especially Seda, the receptionist, and they were able to answer our questions about getting around and finding places. They made us feel very welcome and we really enjoyed our stay. If I were revisiting Istanbul I might be inclined to stay closer to Karakoy/Galata as many of the restaurants in Sultanahmet are quite touristy and there's not a lot of nightlife in the area, but if you want a great value base near the majority of the historical sights, this is a great location and a really nice, basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Service, Fine Rooftop Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jwed
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the area near Bazaar and Hagia Sophia. Rooms are modest, but breakfast on beautiful rooftop is worthwhile, affording views of water and terra cotta rooftops. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “The Good & the Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Poushie
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to Istanbul and I chose the Niles hotel for location to be close to the Grand Bazaar and price. The good points are listed as follows:- 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar even though the roads were a bit rough and mostly uphill. The room was spotless. The bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and great choice especially the home made pastries and lovely view out to sea. The bad points:- ROOM 101 - I dont think this room should be sold to anyone. I requested a room next to my friend as we purchased 2 single rooms knowing that the rooms were quite small. She was allocated 102 which was along the main corridor with a total of 4 rooms (not close to mine at all but our walls were adjoining). Room 101 located between the lift and the stairs away from all the other rooms and directly under Reception I was also seemed to be one of the smallest rooms in the hotel. I asked to change rooms but hotel was full. The main issue here was the noise factor. I could hear nearly every conversation from the front desk including the mobile phone beeping sms's during the night and of course guests making a racket walking past my room every night to use the stair of lift. I barely slept for 3 days and was glad to check out. This being said ...if I was given a normal room like my friend who loved the hotel I would have written a rave review.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: D-TAdventures
Reviews.Content: The first leg of our journey through Turkey (3 nights) was in Istanbul and we stayed at this lovely hotel. The staff, its professionalism, view, location (better than Sultanahmet in our opinion since you are minutes from the Grand Bazaar and less craziness from all of the tourists a little further down)....you can walk to any of the sights from here all within a 20 min stroll - very accessible and handy location. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bathingsuit
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for ages, as the staff at the Hotel Niles really deserves it. My friends and I stayed here last August and found the hotel to be in a good location, with most sites easily walkable. The hotel is not luxury and the rooms are pretty basic, but it is inexpensive and does the job. Breakfast was served on the roof, with a lovely view of the sea and offered a decent selection of Turkish fare. The staff were there to answer any questions we had, making excellent suggestions and giving us map after map with planned out routes. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good location, excellent staff and basic but clean accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Better service than the 5 star hotel I stayed in Budapest”
Reviews.Author: maverick246
Reviews.Content: Kemal and the staff at the Hotel Niles are incredible. They gave tips on sights, restaurants, and just things to do besides just being genuinely friendly. The rooftop terrace bar/restaurant has views of the Marmara Sea and the commercial ships awaiting cargo...awesome. The rooms are not enormous but having talked with other people, that is normal for the area. The location near the tram is super convenient and easy (the staff will explain everything you need to know). I am excited to see the suites and the gym that are supposed to be finished this year. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: NellyCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, beautiful terrace with great view. Very clean and staff extremely friendly and helpful. But not luxurious rooms if that is what you are looking for. Also very central for tourist attractions. We loved our stay here and would definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good things and bad things- overall average”
Reviews.Author: TheKeck
Reviews.Content: I've been unsure about how I should rate Hotel Niles. To be fair, I think I need to compare it to European Hotels which tend to be smaller and less comfortable than american hotels. The biggest negative I found with this hotel is the rock hard beds! I never had a soft bed while I was in Turkey, but the ones at the Niles were particularly hard. We did experience the noise pollution from construction and the broken lift for 5 days which we didn't love. That being said, I thought the staff were so helpful and really courteous! The view of the water is nice from the breakfast room on the roof. The location is very convenient, really close to a bus and tram stop for those who are using public transport on their trip, and within walking distance of all the big sights, even across the river in Galata if you're up for it! Unlike other reviewers, I never had trouble finding the hotel after I found it the first time, it really isn't that far from the main road. My husband and I loved that there was a computer for guest use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, good for your pocket.”
Reviews.Author: J_F_london
Reviews.Content: We had a large group, and everyone agreed across the board that the staff, location of the hotel and cleanliness was top notch. Down the road from the Grand Bazaar, in Beyazit, it's good for a tourist on a budget, or a business trip with a bit more character. The staff were very helpful and accommodating to our very random requests! (Watch out for the Istanbul taxis!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndyJfire
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise.... tucked down a side street, all of 2 mins walk from Beyazit tram stop and Grand Bazaar (5 mins tram to Galata bridge, 10-15 mins stroll from Blue Mosque)! The staff are super friendly and very helpful, spoke excellent English (even helping me with my mispronunciated Turkish words). The room was immaculate, cleaned every day, new towels, etc. The breakfast was lovely, full range of continental salad bits, cheeses, 4 different fresh breads, cereal, juice, coffee, etc all served on a roof top terrace!! Worth every single penny of the two star price, would recommend it to anyone wanting a basic getaway location. The only recommendation I could give is to provide a better map on their website, but it really is only 2 mins from tram stop!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Tripadvisor and booked the Niles last summer. I'm glad we did the room was small but comfortable and very clean the bathroom was very modern. Breakfast on the roof was great. And the price fantastic. It pays to read Tripadvisor. And remember to post when you return home to help others.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: jenniferbeale
Reviews.Content: Lovely spotlessly clean hotel, great staff nothing to much trouble, roof terrace for simple fresh cooked breakfast... Great location 2 mins from Grand Bazzar (and I walk slow)..blue mosque 3 mins!! resturants close ,great food... check fare on taxis younger guys seem to rip you off, haggle in market..wear comfy shoes pavements uneven..had a great time will go again and stay at same hotel. check out the tea gardens!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & good value”
Reviews.Author: SamuelMcwhirter
Reviews.Content: The most striking thing about the Niles Hotel is the quality of the staff and the welcome they offer. The staff were friendly and keen to help in any matter; making a sharp contrast to many of the hotels we have been to before. We thoroughly recommend the Niles for those looking for good value and who put a high value on being treated with kindness and respect. The beds were also 1st class!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, great location, super staff”
Reviews.Author: RuthieBerlin
Reviews.Content: This is a rather small, charming hotel, like 15 not-overly-large but very tidy rooms, so you get personal attention. We were there a week and everyone there, without exception, was incredibly helpful, polite and friendly, The cozy roof top breakfast room with wicker furniture and a happy, singing canary has a beautiful view of the water , plus the breakfast buffet was very nice , though not extravagent. Breakfast with a view is a great way to start the day. Our first room, 301, was nicely furnished, but without a writing table and single chair, plus the flat screen tv was oddly placed and didn't work well. So we moved to 403 which had an older tv, but BBC, CNN etc, plus a small table and chair. Because my husband and I both had computers and telephones that needed to be plugged in, we found that the 2 electrical outlets on only one side of the room were inadequate. The one multiple plug was already octopus-like with the tv, light, and fridge plugged into it. We did end up totally rearranging the furniture in our room just to make access to the outlets more convenient. The wifi connection had a good, strong signal, which was essential for us. The air conditioner was quiet and efficient. The view out our window was not so great, but the street wasn't a very loud street either, despite the great location (Beyazit). The bathrooms are small, with a shower, no bathtub, but with all that one needs. Our hook was broken off the back of the bathroom door and the area where the closet is needs a light. It was very hard to see inside the closet. They do provide a small safe, which we appreciated and used. We got a special limited offer that included airport pickup with the cost of the room, which was a luxury. We like being in non-chain, independent hotels, so this is one that we would highly recommend, especially at a cost of ca. TL 45 for 2 of us for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and even better”
Reviews.Author: CCCCDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago and it was good then. Seda is possibly the best hotal receptionist I've even come across, (along with Kamil and others) - a receptionist, travel guide, friend and advisor, all rolled into one. It's a small hotel with small rooms but the prices are very cheap and the position central. Breakfast on the beautiful roof terrace overlooking the sea is excellent. You're within minutes of the main sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Cisterns, Hippodrome etc. Tram stop - tokens at the stop for 1.40 TL. Try going further afield to the City Walls, Eyup and the trip up the Bosphorus. Walk down the hill and there's the Kumkapi fish restaurants. Look at the menu outside before entering and ask for a discount. Once inside ask the price before ordering anything - they have a habit of bumping up the bill. The food, however, is excellent. You should get a plate of Sea Bass, Sea Bream etc for around 12-20 Lira. The wine is drinkable for 30-40 Lira. Hamdi's is good but a little pricy and you get rushed. There's lots of smaller, cheaper restaurants - PIknic's is a good chain and there's one (go straight out of door, keep walking straight down street, first right, then first left, down on right hand side (name starts with a B). Good wholesome Turkish food - excellent bean soup, lentil soup with mint, lamb, roast chicken etc and Efes beer. Good service. Watch out for taxi drivers - get a price before entering cab. If a shoeshine person accidentally drops a brush in the street, don't pick it up and hand it back - it's a scam! Happened to us twice. See my blog for more on restaurants/sites/scams etc. [--] Great hotel with superb staff and cheap room rates. They're opening more rooms (two room suites) later this year for around 100 euros. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, LOVED Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: aa625
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was absolutely perfect. The service was unlike any other we've seen and the location is excellent and walking distance to all tourist sites. The rooftop terrace was beautiful and the breakfast was delicious. The reception staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant, especially Kemal Celik! This hotel was recommended to us by a friend and now we know why. We would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Niles is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toki7
Reviews.Content: Niles hotel is a very nice place to stay. We stayed for 2 days and were pleased by the room provided - clean, with all conveniencies (TV, fridge, hair drier, shower, safe). The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect to Grand Bazaar - just a few minutes walk. And the most attractive is hotel price :) I recommend it for those who prefer affordable stay with a quality service/rooms/good location !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petrine_Spore
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of the hotel and decided to book it. One main criteria for our stay is location. The hotel is centrally located near to the tram stations and within walking distance to the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar. Upon our arrival, we had welcome drinks at the rooftop patio. The view of the Marmara Sea was fantastic. Seagulls completed the pictures. The surroundings of the boutique hotel is not as nice. But, the service was prompt. Our air-con was not working well and we called the hotel receptionist. A technician came by within 8 mins and fixed the problem. The room was small but the beds are good. The bathroom is small but clean and the facets work well. We didn't mind as we were out from 9am to 8pm. And the renovations were over by the time we came back. (We were told via Hotel.com that the hotel was undergoing renovations for the months of Nov-Dec) Our stay is made memorable by the warmth of Kemal and Seda who helped us in recommending some places of interest and how to go about taking the Borphorus ferry. They informed us about the different prices for the Borphorus ferry ride operators. We already enjoyed Turkey while using a tour group package which took us to Ankara, Cappodocia, Canakkale, Parmakkale and Ayavlik. We extended our stay at Niles, Istanbul and their fantastic service made every single moment in Turkey a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NYkerinCambridgeUK
Reviews.Content: The Niles is one of the friendliest places we've ever stayed at - spent a week there between Christmas and New Years 2008-9. Seda and Kemal, among other staff, were incredibly helpful with everything from explaining the transport system to making dinner reservations. While we indulged in a fabulous breakfast of cheeses, fresh Turkish breads (including the amazing borek, a different version each day), fruit, and more, Seda would come around asking us if we needed help. The room was spotless, if small, and the location very convenient - it's nice to be outside of Sultanahmet, which is too touristy, and being near the Beyazit tram/bus stop is perfect. My husband left his glasses there and they sent them on right away. Really recommend this hotel! It's too bad the rates are in euros, which makes it so expensive these days, but compared to other hotels this gave us the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, shame about the building works”
Reviews.Author: PenfoldMumbai
Reviews.Content: We too booked this after searching on TripAdvisor and broadly fit with the reviews we read. Rooms were quite small and a little dated, but central, clean and staff were friendly (as people were all over Istanbul). Breakfast roof terrace is a nice place to start the day - apart from the noisy issue mentioned below.
