In terms of price, we were there for New Years so prices were at least 50% higher than normal winter rates, otherwise I thought it would have been priced about right. The biggest shame was the very noisy building works next door (expansion of the hotel I think). This started at about 7am every morning, including Sat and Sun The hotel never mentioned this at any point and it was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with a BIG HEART!”
Reviews.Author: Pugs-in-Otown
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel through TripAdvisor. I was in Istanbul for about a week and needed a central spot in the Old City. Niles would easily be classified as a boutique hotel in the US. The rooms are comfortable and smallish. Bathrooms very clean with the showers being smallish as well. This is all fine because in Istanbul you will rarely have time to spend in the hotel. What sets Niles off from most hotels I have seen around the world is their Ultra personal touch. The front office manager, a gentleman named Kemal, was so in tuned at making sure everything you need was taken care of or addressed. In my case it was restaurants. I would pick one or ask his advise... While I am getting ready for dinner, he would arrange the reservations, implore to the restaurants how important of a guest I was, and to take care of me. This would lead to a wonderful experience everywhere! These are things Niles hotel staff did not have to do, nor do staffs go out of their way in many other places... but because of the feelings it leaves behind, you think you are in a 5 star hotel, and even the don't allot this much attention to their guests! Bottom line, stay there, you can not go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but did not live up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Bosques
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews of the Niles, I was slightly disapointed with the hotel. As in all the reviews, the staff are the best thing about the hotel, especially Seda and Kemal. The hotel is cleanest I have ever stayed in. The Niles's location is within walking distance of all the main sights on the western side of Istanbul, but is some distance from Galata and Taksim. The hotel is just off a main road, but is in a slightly run-down garment area, though I felt very safe in the city in general. The hotel itself suffers from internal noise, the lift makes a lot of noise and doors opening and closing can be a pain. Our room was a great size, but the bathroom could've been larger. The room rate in Euros now seems quite steep as the currency has risen against the dollar and the pound. Overall the hotel is good, but I did not think it justfied all the great reviews. Beware of a scam in Istanbul which we were warned about before we arrived: Shoe-shine guys look out for tourists, he will walk in front of you and 'drop' his brush, ignore this, if you alert him to this, he will insist on shining your shoes in gratitude, but will then demand payment once he has finshed! Keep your eyes peeled!

Reviews.Title: “ok but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during winter, and booked via hotels.com for the new year. Contrary to some other reviews, I found this hotel ok, but not great. The rooms are very small, the roof terrace cold in winter. The staff is very friendly, service is good. But we found it pricey for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Niles Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samiam79
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at the Niles Hotel if you are planning a trip to Istanbul. The location is very good (walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque) and a very short train ride to Taxsim Square. The rooms were very clean and the staff was excellent! Seda - thank you very much for all of the tips on how to get around Istanbul. You truly made our stay a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “It was so home.”
Reviews.Author: Razoooo
Reviews.Content: I couldn't actually say for sure if all these excellent votes are for real or not. We arrived with a bit of anxiety but just looking and the big smiles on the faces of a few guys who where leaving the hotel was loudly saying that our choice was a good one. As each minute passed for us in Niles, till the end of our 5 days stay, our smiles grew bigger and bigger. This name, Niles, now gives us a feeling of laughter and cry... it was really so home. The hotel is ran by a family and everyone there just reaches you as if you are a member of the family. Seda at the front desk, Marat in the very beautiful terrace bar, and the lady in pink who was doing the room service, they are all so kind and helpful. I was basically looking for a room not so small. The room in Nilas are, of course, not big, but we didn't have a single problem with the size. Rooms are clean, breakfast is simple and at the same time, so delicious. Terrace restaurant is... just wow! Location is good, a few minutes away from metro station and maybe 10 min walking to the Blue mosque and Ayasufia museum. The hotel doesn't serve lunch and dinner in the terrace, but no worries, there are many good restaurants nearby. The bar though, is 24h open and you can enjoy it any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: patrickfoster18
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the heart of Old Istanbul, Hotel Niles is a great home base for exploring the sights of Istanbul. It is located down a side street a few blocks from one of the city's main streets, the tram, and the Grand Bazaar. The rooms are very large, clean, and comfortable and the rooftop terrace where the free breakfast is served every morning has excellent panoramic views of the city. The room decor is certainly not first rate but has all the amenities you need such as AC, TV, fridge and there is free internet in the lobby. The aspect that puts the Hotel Niles over the top is the service. The front desk was extremely helpful and kind under all circumstances. We had stayed at their sister hotel, Dersaadet Oteli, the previous four nights and tried to extend for a fifth but they were full. The staff at Dersaadet booked us at the Niles for the fifth night and transported us there for free. Also because we ended up staying more than three nights at their hotels we became eligible for a free transfer to the airport and the staff at both hotels made it a point that we got that free transfer. The Dersaadet is a little more expensive but is a little more elegant and in a nicer neighborhood while Niles is the better value. I would not hesitate to stay here again if traveling to Istanbul. You can read more about out visit to Istanbul on our travel blog- http://patrinadoestheglobe.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: world_in_80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles made my stay in Istanbul wonderful. First, the location is great for seeing all the main attractions in a short period of time. The tram stop is steps away, and the tram is easy and convenient to navigate. The Grande Baazar is steps away from Hotel Niles. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with any questions you may have about your visit. Finally, the roof terrace is incredible. One night, we had dinner up there. There's a kebab restaurant next door, and our food was delivered upstairs to the roof. We ate brekfast here every morning. The food and coffee was great and the views of the Sea were priceless. Breakfast/spending time on the roof was one of my favorite parts of my stay in Istanbul. In terms of general hotel details, I have nothing bad to say about the Niles. The bathroom was very clean- newly renovated. The room, sheets, closets were clean as well. The air conditioner and refrigerator functioned properly and there was a safe in the room. One thing to note- the room is on the small side. Don't expect luxury for this price, but Hotel Niles will exceed your expectations of a 3* hotel. Most importanly, I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SFGiants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles for 4 nights at the beginning of November pre cruise. All the positives that have been noted here on Trip Advisor are accurate. As per our arranged pick up at the airport, there was our driver waiting for us with our name on his sign. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were cheerfully greeted by Kemal. He gave us a great overview of our location and how to get around. Our corner room was small but adequate. The bathroom was clean but the shower was small. The breakfast buffet, which is included, on the rooftop terrace was good. A good selection of homemade breads and pastries, cheeses, cereal, eggs, juices. They offer free wi-fi in the rooms along with a computer in the lobby to use. Their location is within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topaki Palace. The tram stop is just minutes away. We definitely enjoyed our stay here. The staff, especially Kemal and Seda, made the whole stay pleasant. They were always helpful with their suggestions and easy to talk to. All their recommendations were excellent. Great value for the money at a very convenient location. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles great experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldCruiserMaryland
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Hotel Niles was excellent. From the moment we arrived we were welcomed as if we were family. We arrived early and our room was ready. The room was very comfortable and appeared to have been recently remodeled. When we went downstairs Seka the front desk manager was gracious enough to give us first timers a tutorial of what to see, routes to use so we wouldn't get lost, and excellent restaurant suggestions . When we checked out (530 AM) the front desk again made sure our bags were brought down and had breakfast brought to our room even though the restaurant did not normally open till 7 AM. All in all a friendly and efficient staff, clean facilities and a location close to transportation and all the major sites. I would whole heartily recommend Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AnAussieInParis
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Notel Niles. A great location - near Grand Bazaar, but off a little bit in a more local area, so nice and quiet. Easy (2 minute) walk up to the tram line, 5 minute walk to blue mosque / aya sofia. Rooms also nice - simple and clean - great for the price!. The terrace is truly fantastic. Great breakfast. Staff were amazing, especially Seda who is a wealth of knowledge and so friendly. Would definitely go back and I definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Good Hotel Thanks to Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: haystacks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early October having booked directly with the hotel. The staff are superb, the rooms very clean and comfortable and the location was near to all of the major attractions. The view from the rooftop (over the Sea of Marmaris) was superb. Don't expect a 5-star hotel, but for value-for-money it is a great place. The neighbourhood is not particularly attractive and the streets are dimly lit at night, which unsettled our wives a little when we first arrived; but other than that (and of course the street lighting is nothing to do with the hotel) I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, centrally located hotel. Finally, a word of caution about the drivers of the black and yellow taxis. We were robbed by one light-fingered driver who dived into my wife's purse, in the pretence of helping her, and relieved her of 70 turkish lira. A nearby policeman wasn't interested when we complained and back at the hotel we were told it is a common problem with these drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roymaboy
Reviews.Content: With such wonderfully friendly and helpful staff, the Hotel Niles is a hotel that we can thoroughly recommend. Initially, we asked the hotel to organise a taxi from the airport and they did this extremely efficiently. The traffic in Istanbul is pretty amazing, so well worth the cash to have a taxi organised - from our point of view anyway. We also wanted to take a trip to Gallipoli and nothing was too much trouble for the young man at the front desk as he rang several companies to ascertain prices and availability. The trip itself was organised and was more than worth it - as it all ran very smoothly. The hotel itself was in a very good location - only a few minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and maybe half an hour casual walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Haghia Sophia. Hotel Niles was also very clean and tidy, with a decent selection for breakfast. We would recommend the Hotel Niles if you are after a good value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: cubacouple
Reviews.Content: My husband, his parents, and I stayed at the Hotel Niles for two nights before our cruise. We only wish we had more time to enjoy the hospitality of the hotel and the wonderful sights of Istanbul. We arranged pickup at the airport and our driver was waiting for us with a sign. We were so glad we did this, as we had a quick trip to the hotel. Check in was very quick and our bags brought up to our rooms promptly. We were offered a complimentary non-alcoholic drink on the terrace which we enjoyed after we settled into our room. Our rooms were clean and adequate with modern bath fixtures. Breakfast on the terrace was included in the rates and was a variety of eggs, cheeses, fruits, and pastries - very fresh and delicious. The best features of the Niles are the staff and the location. Staff were extremely nice and helpful, providing information on the local neighbourhood as well as restaurant selections near the tourist sights. The Grand Bazaar is just a 5 minute walk and the main sights in the Sultanahmet area are less than one km away -an easy walking distance. The tram is only a few minutes away on a main street if you do not want to do the 1 km walk. We look forward to returning to Istanbul and the Hotel Niles one day.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: VICtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night after a cruise. It was easy to find, and it's only a few short blocks from the tram. The room was large and spotlessly clean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There was free wi-fi and a shared computer if you didn't bring your own laptop. They arranged transportation to the airport for us at 3am (!!) and even made us coffee and sandwiches at that way-too-early hour. The hotel isn't fancy, but it had everything we needed. We especially enjoyed the lovely rooftop cafe area where breakfast is served and you can have a drink at the end of a long day. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist sites, the university, and in the interesting garment area. We loved the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: erica3363
Reviews.Content: As this was our first time in Istanbul, we didn't know what to expect. Upon arrival (plane was an hour late), our driver was easy to find, patierntly holding our name up on a sign. Located in the old part of the city, Hotel Niles is close to many wonderful locations. Seda at the front desk was courteous and professional. Willing to help in any way. Her English was terrific. Rooms were small but clean and comfortable. Being in the old part of the city, the view from our window looked out on the street where merchants were selling their wares. Free internet service was a bonus. The calls to prayer throughout the day were a reminder that we were in an exotic location and added to the atmosphere. Breakfast on the rooftop was great. My only criticism was that the first night (due to different time zones), my husband awoke and went to the rooftop in the middle of the night for coffee. Waking up a little later, I tried to turn the lights on. The card for the lights is on the keychain that he had with him. I had no lights, no clock and was locked in the room. There is no way out if you don't have a key! I phoned the front desk, but at that time of night, the person on duty didn't speak English. Fortunately, he called up to the restaurant, my husband returned and all was well, but it was a panicky few minutes. I would recommend this hotel to my friends without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: rpadam
Reviews.Content: Small but very friendly hotel. Located close to the Grand Bazaar, and all the main sights in the old city are within walking distance (or just a short tram ride away). Decent buffet breakfast. Thoroughly recommended to those looking for a good value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: BellaFleur
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here two nights pre cruise last month. It definitely is not an easy place to find and I'm very glad that we made arrangements ahead of time for the airport pickup ($25Euro). They were there waiting for us after we picked up our luggage. The rooms are extremely tiny but very clean and how much time do you really spend in your room while in Istanbul? As others have stated, it is noisy but it probably wouldn't have been half as bad if my roommate had checked to see if the window was really open when I asked the first time....as we were checking out, I looked out the window....and it was open!! The call to prayer at 5 AM sounded like he was right in our room....but I'm sure that's everywhere in the country. The hotel is within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topaki Palace. Breakfast in the morning was wonderful on the rooftop and the staff is very warm and friendly. It's a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Desertdiva24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth the cost, which is reasonable. We asked for our room to be changed from the first floor to the second floor because we were two women and didn't want to be close to the street level. The hotel was able to accomodate. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was a plus. Breakfast was more than a typical Turkish breakfast and offered plenty of choices. The staff was friendly, accomodating, and spoke English well. Free internet cafe! Fairly close to the major sights, about a 15 minute walk, but right across from the grand Bazaar. The hotel is in an industrial neighborhood; no bars/restaurants are around. It is pretty quiet at night since the businesses close down, but very loud with activity in the morning. I recommend it if you don't mind the loud mornings or the lack of nightlife immediately surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: badboy77777
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively.My first visit to Istanbul and I would not hesitate to stay here on my return and I would highly recommend it to others.Hotel Niles has a central location.Very conveinient to the Grand Bazaar and public transport and taxis if needed.The rooftop breakfast terrace was a favorite memory of my stay.Rooms are nice size and reasonable rates too.I am difficult to impress in general,however i have to admit that the staffing of the hotel is excellent.Not only are they friendly and knowlegeable,they make you feel at home.Kemal went the extra mile for me and my travelling companion during our visit.He is a great asset to the hotel. Dr.Daniel Neger

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: lakevale
Reviews.Content: Eight of us from Ottawa Canada stayed for four nights before our cruise. Picked up at the airport and received detailed attention from the time we arrived until we left. Seda the front desk manager was so pleasant and came to greet everyone at breakfast each morning. She was so helpful and so were the rest of the staff. The breakfast was lovely and so nice when you could sit outside and enjoy the sight of the Bosphorous. Location is great for getting around and lots to do in the area. Hotel is very clean and although the rooms are a bit small everything else is wonderful. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Would definitely stay again if in Istanbul. Thanks to the wonderful staff for making our stay so memorable. It was a great beginning to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mac088
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central position as you can walk to all the main attractions, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar , docks, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, etc.Restaurants are near by as are a number of small shops with drinks, food, etc. It is not in a very touristy section of the city . The hotel itself is tastefully decorated, free internet in the lobby, air conditioned rooms, windows that open, room safe, free drinking water available at the roof terrace, cable TV with English stations, clean room with good quality linen. Breakfast is on the roof terrace with views to the Bosphorous. Drinks and snacks are also available here. It is a pleasure to sit up here of a night and look out over the water and city. We were very impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The receptionist was a gold mine of travel advice, she knew the cost , times , and what was involved in most of the sights, tours, trips. The hotel can arrange pick up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in Tourist Area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Niles in early October 2008 at the end of 2 week trip thru Greece and Turkey. I can agree with most of the reviews on this website of this hotel - basic, cheap, clean with very nice and informative personnel. The hotel is near the Grand Bazaar, etc. just two blocks off the Ordu Caddesi (the street with the tram) but the hotel is still (as others reviews have stated) very difficult to find. I took the subway and tram from the airport for only 2.80 lira (1.40 for the metro from the airport Havalimani station to Azytinburnu then the tram from there to the Beyazit station) in 60 minutes. The hotel does have a 25 Euro pickup service that would definitely be worth it if arriving after dark. Having a map or printout with the hotels location to show a cab driver is a good suggestion. I found the hotel to be basic, cheap and clean. It is not a 4 or 5 star experience as the rooms, while acceptable, are spartan to say the least. I was in room 403 and could still hear the elevator going up and down and there was another room between me and the elevator shaft. My suggestion, don't take rooms x01, x02 or x03 if you are a light sleeper. Also, I heard one guest complain and request a different room because he was on the top (5th) floor and the breakfast room was right above him and he could hear the employees walking around, moving chairs, etc. The hotel, while only 2 blocks from the main tourist street, is in a marginal area. There are several other hotels in the area and the Hotel Niles is definitely the best of the bunch. It is newly remodeled with small rooms, very small showers, thin walls and door jams that will hit your head if you're 6'2" or taller as I am. The street is lively with vehicles and people so the hotel has double paned glass windows that keep out most of the noise. The beds were, for me, a little small and hard with flimsy blankets but I still slept very soundly as I spent my days walking and was very tired when I returned. I would definitely agree that the breakfast, while acceptable, was made more pleasant by the amazing views of the Sea of Marmara - definitely a very positive way to start the day. The rooms do have very small televisions that receive only 2 english language stations (CNN and BBC) but who goes to Istanbul to watch TV. As others have stated, the hotel staff is the most friendly I have ever encountered in my world travels. The were very knowledgeable and genuinely curious as to what I had seen and had suggestions for possible out-of-the-way sites to visit. I really appreciated their input and it made my trip to Istanbul enjoyable. In all, a pleasant experience. The Hotel Niles is not 5 or 4 star but it was clean, modern and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles review”
Reviews.Author: near-far
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Niles. For my wife and I, it was ideally situated being 2 blocks away from the tram line. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The room, although small met our needs very well. The staff, which all spoke English, were all a real joy to interact with. They were helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfast, served on the rooftop, glassed in room, was excellent as was the view. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem!”
Reviews.Author: JGEM2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles for two nights in January 2008. It was a perfect experience! The hotel is centrally located and a short walk from many of Istanbul's most incredible sites. The staff is warm and welcoming. Seda, the lovely manager at the front desk, was incredibly helpful in guiding us during our stay. Each morning, after we had a great breakfast on the rooftop, Seda suggested an itinerary for our day. We followed her advice, and had a wonderful trip. Seda and others at the hotel also recommended nice spots for our dinners. We also were pleased by the hotel's airport pick-up service. Our room at the hotel was very comfortable, extremely clean, and modern. The bedsheets and linens were extremely clean and comfy. There is a computer in the lobby with internet that you can use free of charge, for as long as you need. We highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Niles”
Reviews.Author: carolat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights pre-cruise. Largely based on reviews here, but also on price and location, we booked Hotel Niles. Having stayed in the Intercontinental (on business) twice, the hotel Niles is certainly not in that category. However, it is as advertised. Very close to tram and Grand Bazaar, and easy walking distance to Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. The view from our room overlooked a sewing factory, but we were'nt there for the view. the room was simple, but just what we needed. The A/C worked great! Everything was clean. The rooftop restaurant had great views of the Sea of Marmara and the surrounding neighborhood. We liked the breakfast and were able to take our own beverages up to drink in the bar at night. The only complaint we had was that ice was limited, and I noted that on the survey provided by the hotel. We did buy some wine there and the price and wine were fine. We also met some very nice fellow travellers. It became breezy one night while we were visiting with some Aussies. The bar manager came out and draped me and the other lady with shawls that they keep handy for that purpose! We used the hotel's taxi from the airport and the driver was efficient and friendly. Seda at the front desk was extremely helpful and fun to talk to. She told us she loves her job.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: JWFArlington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles for a week in mid-September based largely on reviews from Trip Advisor, and we were so glad we did! We have traveled widely worldwide for 20 years, and this is one of the best values we've ever had in a hotel. The price is incredibly reasonable, and the service is absolutely top of the line -- I agree with others, it's four-star-hotel level service. Yes, it is in a neighborhood that is a little messy, but it's perfectly safe even late at night and the hotel itself is a lovely oasis. Also, Hotel Niles is incredibly convenient to nearby attractions and easy access to other parts of the city. The front desk staff, particularly Seda, just could not do enough to make our stay pleasant and gave us great directions, ideas, assistance, etc. The breakfasts on the rooftop terrace were easily the best of our 16-day trip through Turkey and Greece, with fresh fruit and meats, cereal, yogurt, eggs, breads and other offerings. And the staff upstairs is equally nice and helpful. You can tell this hotel is well run by caring people. The rooms, as others have said, are spotless and, while not huge, are bigger than many others we've had in Europe. We left the hotel feeling lucky that we'd found it, and with the quality of the property and the service, that we'd benefited from an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate reviews, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: ggCostaRica
Reviews.Content: I was wondering which hotel to choose in Istanbul since most of them had good reviews. I am happy I chose Hotel Niles: excellent location, within walking distance to the most important sites, very good breakfast and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - decent location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Matthew2
Reviews.Content: A decent location and the reception team treated us like we were at a 5 star hotel. Example we pull up in a taxi, a chap is already taking our luggage out of the car. Another chap shakes our hands as we enter the hotel and then the person on the reception desk also wlecomes us and gives us a run through of the hotel details. Bags are then taken to our room. Doesn't sound like a 2/3star reception to me. We stayed two weekends in a row. After the first I mentioned that I thought the breakfast was rather poor. On our return the breakfast was much much better. Doubt it was due to my complaint but they do seem interested to see what they can do better, leaving comment cards in your room for example.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in bustling Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bernie22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eight day trip to Istanbul and stayed at the Hotel Niles. The hotel is a wonderfully run, very clean, and friendly place. The staff are extremely helpful - on more than one occasion they went above and beyond the call of duty for us. The breakfasts are generous and you get to eat them on a lovely terrace overlooking the sea of Marmara. The location is great. Easy access to the tram line and walking distance to all the sites in the old city. Istanbul can be overwhelming and busy, this hotel provides a wonderful, safe and calm oasis in the middle of it all. It is great value for the money. I HIGHLY recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in the small distance to Bazar and Blue Moqsue”
Reviews.Author: baumhausente
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this lovely small hotel in the old town district. It was very clean. Staff was wonderful, helpful and friendly. It is definitely worthwhile price and value you got. They offer a pickup service from the airport that we can highly recommend. They have a beautiful nice terrace on the rooftop with ocean view where we enjoyed breakfast and after dinner drinks. We would definitely come back again. Be aware that there is a mosque nearby and you might wake up when they call for prayer in the morning. Around the hotels are a lot of leather shops. The closest metro is 5 minutes by foot. Grand bazaar is 7 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, likeable hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldChap33
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles has very helpful staff, you arrive, are welcomed, we got a free drink on the roof terrace. The bedroom was quite small but adequate. The location is near the Grand Bazaar, 20 minutes walk from the tourist attractions in Sultanahmet (or 5 minutes in the tram). Breakfast on the roof terrace is self-service and delightful, when my coffee overflowed from the cup into the saucer, the waiter noticed and brought me a new saucer unasked. It has free unsecured wifi, I think one transmitter for each floor, good signal. A tip - watch the taxi's meter like a hawk, when you arrive somewhere they sometimes press a button and the price jumps from YTL 14 to YTL34 as if by magic! We also really liked the fish restaurant on the roof of the Seven Hills Hotel, fantastic views of the Mamara Sea, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque, S E V E N H I L L S H O T E L Tevkifhane Sokak No: 8/A 34400 Sultanahmet Istanbul / TURKEY Tel: [--], www.hotelsevenhills.com. We paid EUR74 per night at the Niles for a double room including breakfast, there is a 5% discount for cash.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: bootty5
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, with fantastically kind and helpful staff. Good location near the tramline and the Grand Bazaar. The Niles also has a very realxing terrace with views out to sea and towards the Grand Bazaar. If you want, you can order food from the excellent kebab shop next door and they will deliver it to you to the terrace. My only slight complaint is that the room windows are very thin and you can really hear the cries of the muezzin calling the muslim faithful to prayer at 5.30 in the morning. Maybe double glazing would be a good idea? Apart from that, the Niles is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “a charming little gem”
Reviews.Author: adi_3201
Reviews.Content: Great location, warm friendly service, helpful staff and all of it at a great price - thatâ€™s Hotel Niles for you. I stayed at this charming little hotel for about 8 days and from the moment I got there; I knew my trip was going to be great. With a pre arranged pick up from the airport, we were driven to the hotel in a comfortable minivan and greeted by Seda at the reception. The check in was quick and hassle free and the room was simple, clean yet very cozy. The breakfast served on the terrace is lovely with a good selection of cereals, breads, yogurt, cold cuts, cheese, juices, milk and eggs.... I must specially the lovely young lady serving there - very sweet and helpful. The location is good too... just a short walk up to the main street to the Tram stop and walking distance to the historical sites, places of interest, Grand Bazaar, etc. If you enjoy seafood, the hotel is also a short walk from the seafood restaurants that line the shore ... a must try! Iâ€™m surely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: mh1HoiAn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in terms of service, cleanliness and value for money. Yes, the rooms are small and basic by five star standards but we weren't looking for this type of hotel. We wanted a small boutique style hotel that allowed us to experience local life and the Niles totally met our expectation. The rooms were spotless and had everything we needed including air-conditioning - a must at this time of year and great hot shower! There was sufficient room to store our luggage and let's face it - how much time do you want to spend in a hotel room anyway - especially in a vibrant city like Istanbul with so much to see and do. We stayed in the Niles for eight days in total. When we arrived our transfer (booked through the hotel) was waiting for us at the airport. We arrived after an all night flight and didn't expect our rooms to be made up until the afternoon but the friendly hotel staff went out of their way to get our rooms ready early. You simply can't fault the helpfulness and friendliness and efficiency of the staff in this hotel - especially the lovely Seda and Murat. The piece de resistance of this hotel is the roof-top terrace with 24 hour service - absolutely magical - overlooking the Istanbul skyline and the sea of Marmara. Also magnificent is breakfast on the terrace - all included in the very reasonable tarriff and the best breakfast we have had in any boutique hotel anywhere in the world with a great selection of cereals, fruit, eggs, salads, olives, cheeses, bread and of course, apple tea (very nice). The views from the terrace at night are spectacular. The staff was happy to provide plates/cutlery etc for our takeways from the little kebab shop next door. Really can't fault this hotel for overall service, comfort and proximity to major attractions. It is just a short walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and short tram ride to Blue Mosque. If you want a five star, big glitzy hotel experience then don't stay at the Niles. However, if you want to experience the old city in a less touristy part of town and witness local life and colour at close proximity and in comfort then this hotel is for you. We absolutely loved our stay here and will definitely return. 2 couples from Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “great experince at Hotel niles”
Reviews.Author: pjs536rome
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of all glowing reiviews from tripadvisor. You ddn't steer me wrong, very comfortable room, good air conditioning. We had a driver meet us at the airport. The manager is wonderful, great fast emails and when we arrived at the hotel she gave us an orientation of the area. Don't hesitate, this is a gem, good breakfast and beautiful roof top terrace too.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and the best service in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RDDPerth_Australia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Niles for 5 nights in August 2008. I had read great reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. I cannot fault a single thing with this hotel. The rooms were large and immaculate, breakfast was delicious and the location was great. What really sets this hotel apart is the service - you will not find better anywhere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Wee Jewel in the Niles”
Reviews.Author: peterchuichui
Reviews.Content: This was a wee find, an oasis in a very busy hot city. The staff were amazing always smiling and willing to help. The aircon broke down once and they were super efficient and fixed it promptly, The breakfast was healthy and the buffet well attended. Its tucked away from the buslte of the main road and other tourists. Rooms were on the smallish side but they were well equipped and came with a fridge!! The room and the batchroom were always spotless and the rooms were made up each day, The bathroom was well looked after and the shower was excellent. Overall we had a great experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but good”
Reviews.Author: daviscalhoun
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Niles for 6 nights last week. The only negatives were the small rooms. One well placed dresser may have made up for that, but as it was, we had stuff strewn everywhere. Location is great. We didn't catch on to the Beyazit tram stop being so close and cheap until we had paid for one too many trips across town to Taksim. DO THE TRAM. We also walked to Taksim several times. Easy to do. A return trip at 11PM+ through the closed shops of the Grand Bazaar was a little sketchy (borderline spooky), but my girlfriend loves to walk. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Indian restaurant Dubb near the Aya Sophia is very good. Avoid the Cemberlitas Hamam (bath).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic welcome, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: crogga
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Niles in August, booking directly with the property by email and receiving prompt and efficient responses to our enquiries. The hotel is well located in a side street opposite Beyazit Square and is easily within walking distance of some of Istanbul's main tourist draws - the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aghia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Alternatively, the excellent tram service at the top of the street affords access (for only 1.30YTL) to Galata Bridge and beyond. The room was on the small side, but comfortable and very, very clean. Our aircon worked perfectly and we needed it with the temperatures hitting 40c. The roof top terrace is a great place to have breakfast or a cold beer after a day taking in the sights. However, the biggest plus of our stay was the warmth of the welcome from Seda and the entire staff team, who are all a credit to the hotel. Considering the room rack rate was 67 euros per night, including breakfast, Hotel Niles represents terrific value for money To compare it to the Hyatt as one reviewer has done (yeah right - the Hyatt is only 3 - 4 times the price) is like comparing apples and pears. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as described in Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: cosmosmariner8
Reviews.Content: The Niles Hotel is a hidden gem; a bit hard to find even by taxis (have a map if possible to show the driver), but worth the effort. The rooms are simple but clean and functional..and air conditioned. The two notably great things about the Niles are (1) the staff who are most helpful and who make you welcome, and (2) the rooftop terrace with view of the Sea of Marmara....it's well furnished, never crowded, has a bar, and you can order simple food from the restaurant next door (the hotel does not have a restaurant) and have it delivered to the terrace, giving you one of the best dining locations in Istanbul for a low price!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: shuttergirlTO
Reviews.Content: Professional service, providing easy transfers to/from airport. Reception staff were very friendly and attentive and provided suggestions for sites, restaurants and activities in the city. Rooms were adequate with air conditioning, hot water, daily linen service and small TV. Very clean and able to accommodate with 3 single beds. Location is convenient, not right in Sultanhamet (nice not to be right in the heart of tourist area) but 20 minute walk or short tram ride (tram 4 minute walk from hotel). And 7 minute walk to Grand Bazaar. Area is desolate at night as it is mostly wholesale offices/stores, but felt safe at all times. Self service breakfast is served on a rooftop terrace with a view of the sea. Nice selection of Turkish style and international foods. Wait staff are pleasant and attentive. Rooftop is available day and evening for a drink, or staff can assist with order of food delivery from local restaurants (also big flat screen TV can provide entertainment). Single internet terminal in main lobby free.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: PierCove
Reviews.Content: We were just one night at the Niles, but we appreciated their genuine personal interest in us and our situation. One of our bags failed to arrive at the airport on our flight, and we needed it to begin a cruise the next day. Cemil greeted us warmly at the front desk and promised to call the baggage office after the final flight of the day. The next morning, we asked at the desk before breakfast, but nothing had turned up. While we were eating breakfast, Sebnem (the daytime woman at the front desk) found us in the terrace and said our bag was on its way. Two more status reports were given (based on phone conversations with the delivery service) and our bag arrived just in time for us to head for the cruise terminal. Meanwhile Murat the bartender/porter took a friendly interest in our cruise destinations and our missing bag. He carried our bags one block to a taxi--necessary because a traffic jam had blocked the street in front of the hotel. As for the room, it was a bit spartan, but very clean and the air conditioning worked. For the price, we thought it was quite decent. Unless one wants to spend a lot of time at the Grand Bazaar, the neighborhood has little to offer the tourist, but the tram line is very close and we had no trouble getting taxis. Others have commented that the hotel is hard to find. We took the precaution of printing up a Google map (maps on the hotel's website were not too clear) and we had no trouble with taxis finding the hotel. We didn't find the local restaurant scene very attractive, but the hotel will order simple meals from next door to be brought up to the roof terrace. For more ambitious meals, one should go to the main tourist centers. Although I'm not sure we would recommend the Niles as a base for a long-term stay, it served our purpose well at a reasonable price. The human warmth of its staff was the most memorable element in rating it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: Aimee74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was a real find. Located just outside the main tourist district, it was perfect. Still close enough to walk to everything, but not so close that you were hassled. Very friendly and helpful staff who made our stay a real pleasure. The rooms are defintiely on the small side (especially the 06 rooms) but still good value for money and very clean. Roof terrace was an excellent spot for breakfast or a drink at sunset. Woudl highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent service and pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: nikolas_k
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very organised there was driver sent to pick us up from the airport, also they will be on time in seconds with wake up call or room service. The stuff is very helpful and will make your stay comfortable as much it can. The hotel is clean and has a lovely restaurant on top open floor. The famous grand bazaar is only minutes walk from the hotel. Thanks for the pleasant stay I hope to visit turkey again and stay at your hotel. Nikolas Kostov, Australia NT

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nies was excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rachelle2008
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was an excellent choice for an Istanbul hotel. At first, it is slightly hard to find, as it is not in the main tourist street with the tram, but that is actually makes is more peaceful. One wouldn't want to walk out and get run over by locals trying to get work around the tourists. The staff are all excellent, and must give thanks to Seda, Murat, and the night bellhop. The rooms were adequate, this is not a 5 star, and the bathroom was cleaner than some of the 5 stars I've stayed in. It is close to everything in the Sultahnamet area of Istanbul. I highly recommend this place. Breakfast wasn't bad either. When we left too early to catch breakfast, they gave us sandwiches to take with us and coffee to drink before we left.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: GizmoCairo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August. Jimmy the receptionist immediately made us welcome even though we were far too early to check in (I don't think we ever saw him without a smile on his face, during our whole stay). He provided us with a map, told us where to go and off we went. Check in itself was very painless and before we were allowed to go to our room, they proudly showed us the roof terrace, and introduced us to the owner. The terrace (where breakfast is served) has views of the Sea of Marmara (those seagulls were big!). Breakfast itself is more than adequate unless you are looking for a full cooked breakfast. During breakfast, Seda (the front office manager) would appear and greet every table of guests with 'Good Morning, how are you!' She then went on to enquire how our stay was going and seemed almost disappointed if we didn't have a question for her or require some assistance with our travel plans. The room was clean and very compact , if we weren't only using it as somewhere to sleep it wouldn't have been big enough. The TV was small and reception was poor and it was almost impossible to sit and watch it comfortably -but then, with so much to see and do in Istanbul, we didn't find this a problem. The bathroom was small but had everything we needed - lighting was not great for shaving! The A/C in our room was great; our room looked out onto the street but it was very quiet. However, there was some internal noise from neighbouring rooms but never too intrusive. The wi-fi in the room worked well and it was great to have free internet access in reception. Overall, this small and friendly hotel would be our choice every time. They try hard to make you feel welcome and succeed. If you want 5 Star luxury and anonymity then we suggest you go somewhere else. But if you are looking for a hotel where you can feel comfortable and be very close to (but not right in the heart of) most of the major tourist attractions in Instanbul, then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Met Rather High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: germanfan
Reviews.Content: Like many other guests, we booked the Hotel Niles based on the very-high ratings on Tripadvisor.com Our experience at the Hotel Niles was consistent with the reviews with a few exceptions. We stayed there for a total of 6 nights. I admit, I am rather picky and give tough (but hopefully fair)reviews. In summary: Pros: 1. Hotel is an excellent value. We paid 62 Euros (cash price) and took advantage of the airport pick up. Rooms were relatively modern and clean. 2. As previously written, the terrace on the roof of the building has a great view and is wonderful for breakfast or early evening drinks. 3. The staff (with specific compliments for Seda) are very friendly and try to accomodate all requests. 4. Location is excellent for sightseeing in wonderful Istanbul. 5. Definitely eat at the kabob house next door. To save money on any additional charges, order and prepay for the food yourself (very reasonable prices) and have it delivered to the roof top terrace. We ate there 3 times (sometimes for a late lunch) and it was always excellent. Cons: 1. The room we booked (upper floor) was not given to us by the evening check in clerk (a relatively new employee who said "all the rooms are the same"). The room was tiny and had many problems (AC, lamp, bathroom size) and luckily Seda helped us the next day in transferring us to one of the rooms on the 5th floor which had more space. 2. Due to the design of the rooms, there is only a very tiny closet, which accomodates only 5 hanging items, plus some small shelve space. Since we were a couple who had packed for a 14-day vacation, it was impossible to unpack our suitcases and to store or hang up much of our clothes. This was a problem, especially for my wife. Bottomline: this is an excellent hotel for those on a tight budget but are looking for a good value. However, we would not stay there again because we personally need a bigger room and strorage area and a hotel with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: GoldenHorn
Reviews.Content: This hotel has glowing reviews but i reckon that this is somehow stage managed by the hotel guests or management. The negatives : 1- We booked an aiport pickup. NO one was at the airport despite us looking at all the boards for 30 mins. This was denied by Cemil (jamil??) at reception. We made our own way via a transfer booked at a private counter at the airport who took 2 hours to find the hotel as it is an obscure area off a main road close to the grand bazaar and Istanbul university. Also someone should tell Cemil to stop saying free of charge. i.e "wireless internet is free of charge". "Breakfast is free of charge". No its not , its included in your room rate. 2- We emailed the hotel asking for confirmation of the airport transfer and also a twin bed room. We got a double room wedged in the corner of the hotel all the way to to the top. The guy that showed us the room asked us with a dirty smirk 'You are sleeping in 1 bed'. Um no we asked for two beds. We are best mates .... 3- The room was very clean but it looked like it had been decorated at the time of Ataturk and not been changed since. The decor would apeal to ppl that loves parquet floors and wall paper. 4. When i checked out after being here for only 2 hours I was not even asked if there was anything they could do to help me change my mind. offering us a refund would have been great but hey..... 5 the bed was rock hard and could not have accomodated two adults confortably who aint in a relationship. Hence the request for twin beds. 6- The location is just naff, there are no retaurants close by at all bar the dodgy looking kebab shop next door. if you like cheap stylish clothes then i guess this is a good location. The positives 1 - Clean 2 - Nice service 3 - free wireless though it contsantly drops I unfortnately did not find this hotel great and checked out after two hours as the electricty constantly dropped in the room and i could not be bothered to complain about it as they had no other rooms available in any case. This also meant the room was bloody hot and the window had to be left open which meant that the street noise came in . I moved to a five star hotel which in hindsight is what i should have booked in the first place as istanbul is truly one of those places that u get what u pay for. Hotel NIles does not live up to its trip advisor reputation but Istanbul is still amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location of the hotel with extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nfazal1031
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was the perfect location for our 5 night stay. Within walking distance of some of Istanbul's main attractions such as Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia. Basic, cheap and very clean accomodation. Staff were always friendly, approachable and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent custmer service , clean hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: shasta1910
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i have ever stayed in , the customer service was faultless the staff (jamil) were outstanding, could not have asked more from the wonderful and helpful staff, very clean rooms were cleaned daily, rooms were a good size compared to some hotels in istanbul, would 1000% recommend this hotel to anybody who stays in istanbul , booked through last minute got excellent value for money , thankyou for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pomona1
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with very friendly service. Rooms and whole hotel is very clean and staff cannot be more helpful. Good buffet breakfast. Very reasonably priced for hotel near main tourist area. Slightly difficult to find at first - but location near tram stop helps getting around Istanbul. Thanks to all at Hotel Niles for a pleasant 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service”
Reviews.Author: nikzik
Reviews.Content: We booked Niles after reading the reviews on this website. The hotel is well placed for sightseeing round the city. The tram stop is 100 meters from the hotel. We travelled to the hotel using the tram/train. It was very straightforward. Read here for step by step tram instructions http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/go/Istanbul/Transport/airport_sultanahmet.html or do a quick search on Google. The hotel arranged transport back to the airport and offered to set up taxi sharing with another guest to save us money. It cost 20 Euro (we didnâ€™t share the taxi). The hotel room was well proportioned and clean. The bathroom was fairly small but perfectly functional. It didnâ€™t have a bath. The room itself suffered from the street noise. We didnâ€™t really sleep very well. Breakfast was very good. Thereâ€™s an interesting selection of food. We were able to vary our meal without getting bored of eating the same thing after 10 days. The breakfast room with roof terrace was pleasant with a view of the Sea (and a few old run down buildings). We took the opportunity to relax on the roof terrace on more than one occasion. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. We felt as though we were saying goodbye to family when we left. Iâ€™ve seen other people say this in their reviews, and I didnâ€™t think I would feel the same way. I must give a special mention to Osman in the bar. His general temperament and manor was perfectly set up for the stiff upper lip British traveller. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. Mehmet in the Bar also made a lot of effort to make our stay pleasant. The three members of staff on reception were great too and always helped with everything we wanted. The wireless internet reception was not very strong in our room and we had to sit by the door to pick up a signal. We spent a few evenings roaming the shopping streets round the hotel. They were safe and interesting, though probably not Istanbulâ€™s greatest attraction. Most tourist attractions are within walking distance, 10 minutes slow plod to Sultanahment. Unlike others, I do not recommend to Kebap shop next door. The food was not great and they charged us extra on top of the menu prices. I didnâ€™t argue (because I cannot speak Turkish), I paid and left never to return. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I would definitely stay if I went to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: andon246
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Niles based on Tripadvisor reviews and popularity. We were not disappointed. This small hotel is perfect for a tourist visit to Istanbul. If one is looking for a business oriented hotel in the business center, this is not the place. The staff, led by Seda the front desk manager is very accomodating as well knowledgeble.The rooms are somewhat small, but very clean with all conveniences. The breakfast on the terrace is excellent as is the service. It is not the nicest neighborhood,but it seems safe, and is close to tram, Grand bazaar, and many major sights. We recommend it without any hesitation. Have the hotel arrange airport pickup. It is reasonable and reliable. Andon246 River Vale, New Jersey U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true!”
Reviews.Author: 0003she
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money hotel. My husband, daughter and I have just visited Istanbul and stayed 5 nights at Hotel Niles. We chose this hotel because of reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Yes, it is in a noisy part of the city and lots of the surrounding buildings are run down, which might put some people off. If you want peace and quiet, then don't stay here. However, if you like the buzz of being in the centre of things, close to restaurants, tram and major sites then I can recommend this hotel. Seda on the front desk is delightful, and I can honestly say that all the staff were courteous and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. They are like a family and they welcomed us into it. The rooms are not massive but are well equipped. The air conditioning works and the housekeeping standards are very high. The room and bathroom were spotless. The breakfast on the roof terrace each morning was delicious and included a selection of wonderful home made pastries, cooked by Seda's mum. The terrace came into its own in the evening too when the city quietened and we went for our night cap before retiring to bed. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: divacape
Reviews.Content: We have just returned (today) after spending 5 nights at the Niles Hotel in Istanbul. I was rather weary about booking the hotel as there were hardly any reviews on Trip and after spending several weeks searching for a moderately priced hotel (in S.A. Rands) i contacted some trip forum members and decided on the Niles (pronounced Neeless) not knowing where i was going and what i would find. We organised a shuttle to the hotel where we were welcomed by a cheerful young Seda - the front office manager. It was early evening when we got in and our room was ready - even the air conditioning had been turned on awaiting our arrival. Everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful from the little young lady who cleaned our room (no english) to the General Manager. The room was 15 sq. metres and had a double bed (or two twins), a fridge, little table and 2 chairs. Neat, clean and simple. The bathroom however was teeny. You could not bend down in the shower without hitting the back wall if you were to try and pick up a piece of soap. It consisted of a shower, basin and toilet - probably about 4 sq. metres.(the shower itself being less than a sq. metre) Cupboards in Istanbul from what i have been reading seems to be a problem and so it was at the hotel Niles too. Two shelves, a safety deposit box (very convenient) and about 4 hangers. If only they would turn the rod to hang up clothes the other way (horizontally) one could have space . The rod was placed across the depth as opposed to across the width. Fresh soaps, towels, shampoo every morning. Breakfast was included and served on the top terrace with a lovely view of the Bosphorus. Two cheeses, juice, 2-3 fruits, boiled eggs and scrambled eggs, oats, and 2 other cereals, cumber, tomato and olives. Some home made goodies and bread. Coffee, tea or apple tea. After 4 days it got a bit boring though. The fruit didnt always taste fresh and i think its something they could brush up upon. Again though excellent service and after the 3rd day without asking i was given hot milk for my coffee. There is a computer for hotel guests which didnt work some days but no problem - i was given either Seda's to check my mail or on one occassion the General Managers. Each day Seda or her colleague suggested what we should do. They were always smiling and willing to please. The hotel was spotless too. All in all it was an excellent choice. Oh it was near the Beyazit tram station and on a VERY quiet street which was also important to me in my choice. 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and about a 20 min walk to Sultanahmet to the Blue Mosque area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SameOldTown
Reviews.Content: +great location -- near historical sites and the tram +lovely rooftop terrace with delicious breakfasts +gracious, attentive staff who are as knowledgeable and capable as they are warm and genuine

Reviews.Title: “Jewell in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: TBGLondon
Reviews.Content: When the taxi dropped us off at the Hotel Niles we were a little concerned as the buildings in the area are run down and worse for wear. Do not let this deter you however as this hotel is fantastic both inside and out. We stayed in five hotels over a ten day period whilst on our trip to Turkey and the Hotel Niles was by far the best regarding service and value for money (Â£55 per night). The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and made recommendations on restaurants that were absolutely spot on. They even gave us the names of the best masseurs at the nearby Turkish baths!! The rooms are spotless and a decent size with excellent bathrooms. The roof terrace provides a great place for sundowners as well as enjoying the very tasty breakfast spreads. The hotel is very conveniently located and is approximately a two minute walk away from the Grand Bazaar and the main tram line that services the city. Great place to stay if visiting the usual tourist attractions in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: neb
Reviews.Content: Perfect for budget conscious traveller. Rooms are well sized and clean, bathroom a little on the small side. PROS: - Excellent customer service, Seda on the front desk is brilliant at making your stay organised, comfortable and stress free. - Roof terrace is the perfect place to enjoy a pre-dinner drink. - Price/quality ratio for this centrally located hotel is spot on. Great value. CONS: - Woken up early each morning by jackhammers on nearby large building site. Obviously, this is out of the control of the hotel, however a current problem. Affected our ability to sleep in, and also eat breakfast on the fantastic roof terrace in peace and quiet. PS. We recommend booking the airport pickup service offered by the hotel, 25 euros.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: walkerinbayern
Reviews.Content: my family and i spent 6 days in istanbul and stayed in hotel niles. the staffs are helpful and provided useful information. the hotel is located in a lane with 5 min walk to Beyazit Tram station by the Grand Bazaar and with 15 min. walk to sultanhamet. the breakfast was OK, the view on terrace is nice, the hotel is clean but the room is quite small that an extra bed for my child did not allow a desk. Besides, a building nearby is under reconstruction, and the noise could destroy all the good mood while having breakfast. and the street is full of noise in day time, so we have to closed the window and opened the air condition. anyway, the price is reasonable and the location is good. i would recommend to those who do not have to travel with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SwampyLondon
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel its well worth it!!! It was clean and comfortable and the rooms were a decent size. But the biggest bonus was that the staff were so friendly, booking trips for you and generally giving you advice on how to get around in Istanbul as well as checking that everything was to your satisfaction. That is something you do not normally get in any hotel and it certainly makes a difference. The roof top terrace is also really relaxing and well kept with its trees and plants and makes a really great place to have a well deserved drink at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Most highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: whitstablewanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Niles for four nights whilst visiting Istanbul. It is a small hotel with the most fantastic atmosphere and friendly yet professional service. Seda, the hotel manager, obviously loves her job and did everything in her power to make our stay a happy one. She even got up at 5am to see us off, having arranged sandwiches for us because we were going to miss breakfast. Breakfast on the roof terrace with its fantastic views and fabulous, extensive buffet is something we will always remember. We cannot recommend this hotel more highly!

Reviews.Title: “great value, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: liloBedford
Reviews.Content: a great little hotel in the bazaar district. the hotel organised a car to collect us from the airport ( the car worked out about Â£40 between 4 of us - for an hours journey it saved the hassle of possibly being ripped off by an airport cab! ) Hotel was small, but very clean and well serviced - the rooftop bar was great for a beer and although the views are not amazing, its good to find a sun trap. Breakfasts good too - a choice of cheese, ham, fruit, cereal, cakes, juices and eggs and strong coffee The hotel is in a great location , 2 mins from grand bazaar - the tram is at the top of the road which takes you all over the city , and the blue mosque / hagia sophia / topkapi / basilica cistern are all in walking distance. Staff were really helpful and friendly and full of useful information, both on email before we went and during our stay - would definitely recommend the hotel as a budget base - they charge 62 euros per room per night if you pay cash which was excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: sueycat
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul late in the morning and were met by Ms. Seda Kucukbenli, the Front Office Manager. She is very warm and welcoming and insisted we go upstairs to the restaraunt for breakfast "on the house". The hotel is very clean and confortable and the breakfast is fantastic - lots of fresh fruit, veggies, eggs, and some amazing baked goods. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and offered tips and advice on how best to navigate Istanbul. The rooftop patio is a lovely place to end the day with a glass of wine and a chat with other travellers (all of whom, like us, were congratulating themselves on finding this little gem of a hotel!). We will be in Istanbul next year and will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Delightful Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Velvetclaw
Reviews.Content: Our whole experience of staying at the Hotel Niles was excellent. This boutique hotel is well situated for visiting The Blue Mosque, Aghia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar (and so much more) all within walking distance or you can catch the tram which is very efficient and frequent. However, it is advisable to wear comfortable walking shoes as many of the streets are cobbled so high heels are out of the question!! When going to Taksim Square it is easy to just jump on the tram and then the connecting fenecular all of which operate until midnight. Watch out for taxi drivers though, there are the odd dodgy ones around. We can only praise all of the staff and mangement at the Hotel Niles. The hotel is spotlessly clean and well organised and nothing is too much trouble if you have a query. A varied and delicious breakfast is served on the roof terrace with views of the Bosphorous, or you can just go up there for a snack or a drink at any time of the day. We would particularly like to thank Seda and Mehmet for their help and advice in getting us around Istanbul. Seda's knowledge and patience is invaluable and made our trip to Istanbul trouble free and straightforward. We thank her for this.

Reviews.Title: “All these great TripAdvisor reviews are right on!”
Reviews.Author: SolaGo
Reviews.Content: Won't repeat all of the positive remarks made by others -- just that we "ditto" all of them. An excellent choice, especially for a first visit to Istanbul as the Niles is so convenient to many major tourist sites and to the tram, which gets you to many of the others. I can't really think of a complaint we had! Seda could teach small-hotel management as far as I'm concerned -- her warmth, knowledge and professionalism were outstanding -- and the rest of the staff followed her lead. We loved the terrace for breakfast, cocktails and to eat our very inexpensive but good (and delivered!) kebab dinner from the family-run restaurant next door after our evening at the Turkish bath. One thing -- don't believe we paid more than 60 euro per night with breakfast but may have been cheaper than TripAdvisor price because we were there prior to start of high season.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I loved this hotel!!! I really can't add anything more. It was really lovely. Really a 4 star. I booked through the hotel website & received an almost immediate, professional response. I arranged the airport pick-up & drop-off, which I highly recommend. My flight was late, so Istanbul Airlines called the hotel to notify them. I arrived around 1:00 AM & someone from the hotel was there to pick me up. All the staff were very nice & gracious. The location was perfect. I had to be back at the airport around 10:30 the next day, so I got up at 6:00 AM & had a lovely breakfast on the roof. Very nice. Wonderful view. It's about a 15 minute walk to the sites, such as the Haggia Sofia, Basicilla Cistern, etc. Excellent looking restaurants on the walk to this area, with wonderful pasteries, & so forth. The room itself was wonderful. Chic little soaps & shampoos provided. Hairdryer, slippers. Very nice Turkish motif. Wonderful bed. It was fun to watch some Turkish tv, in my short, less than 12 hour overnight trip. Everything was top notch quality. I think I paid close to $75 with taxes & everything included. Wish I could have stayed longer. Ahhhh...Istanbul. Very magical place...

Reviews.Title: “Staff make a good hotel great”
Reviews.Author: MaxHS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Hotel Niles in early June 2008. It is small and down a small street in the clothing district, but only 100 metres or so off a main street and tram stop, 3 mins from the Grand Bazaar, about 10-15 mins to the Blue Mosque and 5 mins to the sea (fish restaurants aplenty). There are lots of restaurants within 5 to 10 mins walk in most directions and plenty of almost every type of shop (save that there are no big mall type shops nearby). The area is hardly pretty, with cars and small lorries squeezing down the roads, but it is busy, lively and quirky and much more interesting than some sanitised boring locations. For example, the clothing shop opposite the hotel had lots of shop dummies stuck all over the outside walls of the shop at first floor level! The hotel itself has small but very clean rooms, a great rooftop terrace with good views and best of all it has staff who seem more than happy at any time to go above and beyond the call of duty to help any query or problem, no matter how small. Seda the hyperactive front office manager is particularly kind and very knowledgeable. She insisted on giving all four of us big hugs when we left. In summary a good family run hotel in a very good location, made great by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rahulioathena
Reviews.Content: We bookended our trip to Turkey with stays at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul. Communicating via email to book the room, Niles staff was quick and clear in their communications. When we arrived they made our stay comfortable and convenient. They guided us on directions, advice about the neighbourhoods, and suggested sites to see. The hotel is clean and the room was great. The staff is friendly, engaging and happy. We found the free internet and the rooftop patio to be special highlights of our stay there - the view is fantastic. The hotel is also walking distance to the big tourist sites, but far enough away to not be in the thick of it. It is also conveniently located near a tram stop, and a moderately inexpensive taxi ride from the airport. Overall, we thought the hotel was great, and we recommend it to anyone passing through Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wheninrome2001
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Niles for four nights. I'd found reviews of the hotel on trip advisor so felt comfortable about the booking decision. We are both so happy we stayed here and will definitely be back. The price, location, cleanliness, charm of the place and friendliness of the staff exceeded our expectations. The price for two people was very reasonable. Breakfast is included and is fantastic --- hot scrambled eggs, homemade breads, fresh fruit, cheeses, cold cuts, coffee, tea, etc... It kept us going until dinner time. There is a terrace above the fifth floor where breakfast is served and you can sit and watch the seagulls flying with a great view of the Sea of Marmara in one direction and a beautiful mosque in the other. We also enjoyed the terrace in the evening where we sat and ate a nice doner from the restaurant next door. We ordered beer and were able to watch soccer on the big screen TV. The hotel is very clean and well situated near the tram and bus making it easy to see the major sights. (The tram is clean and cheap and air conditioned). Even on foot it wasn't that far to the blue mosque and Aja Sophia. It is a short walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and the fish market. Even with this great location we found the hotel to be very peaceful. The room was small but charming and had air conditioning, a hair dryer and a small television and refrigerator. Seda at the front desk was so helpful, courteous, precise and quick answering our many questions concerning Istanbul. She saved us a lot of time with her expertise. We couldn't be happier with our stay at this hotel. Sincerely, Leslie (from New Mexico) and Ermano (from Venice)

Reviews.Title: “Niles was great in service and location”
Reviews.Author: froehlichefamilie
Reviews.Content: We spend there our 2.honeymoon after 25 years married. First we found roses in our room. This is the perfect hotel for a trip - centrally located in a safe area of Istanbul. Miss Seda at the front desk is a very knowledgeable and helpful person who will give you an "orientation" to the city on your first day and follow-up with brilliant suggestions and answers to the many questions you will have. I walked all over the city and found it safe and enjoyed my vacation immensely. But the principle reason was the comfort and friendliness of using this hotel as a base. It's a great location close by the great bazaar and near the excellent trolley line. The roof garden has a great view, the staff is just the best, and the breakfast buffets are terrific with plentiful good food and many home made delicacies. We come again in about 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Found a Gem”
Reviews.Author: OshawaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Found a Gem, this is a wonderful hotel within walking distance of all the major attractions. The staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way for you. Examples, they will write out directions for you and tell you what public transportation to take if you go further out into the City. The hotel rooms are very clean. There is a wonderful rooftop restaurant where breakfast is given. The rest of the day it serves as a bar/lounge area. The view is wonderful from the roof. I stayed at this hotel with my daughter for 6 days and loved every minute of it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and am extremely happy that I found it as it made my stay in Istanbul wonderful. Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DCTourist_8
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Niles last month, based on the positive reviews we read on TripAdvisor. The hotel was very much as advertised: friendly staff, quiet, clean, convenient, excellent breakfast, wonderful rooftop views. What I would add is that the Niles Hotel provides a welcome relief from Istanbul's bustling intensity. When you come back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, you feel as though you are in a place where you can relax and compose yourself. Any assistance you might need is readily available, and you can linger on the rooftop looking out at the sea while body and spirit are refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Of A Hotel And Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: snowTrencin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real Gem of a hotel find! We stayed there and found it excellent value for money. Central Istanbul and within easy walking distance to all of the popular attractions and must see places to visit. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble when asking the staff for help and we were made to feel totally at ease and on holiday. The reception was always helpful and attentive with local advice as to best places to see including advice as to best prices and tour options. The room was cleaned daily with fresh bedding and towels and highly maintained. The roof top terrace was the breakfast venue and was very satisfactory with superb views over the sea. We used the hotel taxi on both arrival and departure and the rates were acceptable. Upon arrival at the airport take care that you check to see if you need a visa obtainable before you proceed through passport control.At the time of our visit we being UK passport holders had to pay 10 Pounds each for a compulsory 90 day tourist visa. The arrival hall is hectic so we recommend using the hotel taxi driver who was waiting for us with our names clearly printed on his notice board. One thing we would like to point out to visitors to this hotel is the perfect arrangement the hotel has with the restaurant next door. In that you can order meals at the restaurant and they will deliver directly up to the terrace cafe in the hotel whilst you can relax and enjoy the view awaiting your order. All in all value for money has got to be a 5 and the staff also receive a 5 for good attitude, helpfulness and local knowledge. Last to mention is not to buy anything at the Grand Bazaar as the Spice Market Bazaar is much cheaper and if you explore further afield you can get even cheaper bargains, ask the reception they know the best places to shop. This hotel was an excellent choice for our stay in vibrant Istanbul. Newcastle Upon Tyne England

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles - I loved it! lucky to have found it!”
Reviews.Author: nozruk
