Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for an American or European wanting a comfortable and affordable hotel centrally located in a safe area of Istanbul. Miss Seda at the front desk is a very knowledgeable and helpful person who will give you an "orientation" to the city on your first day and follow-up with brilliant suggestions and answers to the many questions you will have. I walked all over the city and found it safe and enjoyed my vacation immensely. But the principle reason was the comfort and friendliness of using this hotel as a base. It's a great location close by the great bazaar and near the excellent trolley line. The roof garden has a great view, the staff is just the best, and the breakfast buffets are terrific with plentiful good food and many home made delicacies. I stayed 10 days and really got to enjoy the staff and the ambiance. Also there are a lot of interesting people staying at the hotel. It's not that big so book early. Also, I was able to sleep comfortably in the air conditioned quiet rooms. I would go back in a minute if I could. JK from Boston, Mass. USA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker8
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Niles from May 24-30, 2008. It is a small hotel , located a short walk from the tram and many major attractions. The hotel provided airport pickup. The rooftop terrace is very nice, with a great view of the Sea of Marmara and the streets of Istanbul. Delicious breakfast is served there in the morning, and it is a pleasant place to sit and plan your day or rest afterwards. . The front desk manager, Seda, was exceptionally helpful in providing directions and advice that made our stay in Istanbul an excellent and memorable one. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AVALANCHEMiami
Reviews.Content: I have been using Tripadvisor for the last 10 years, and so far it has been an excellent guide for choosing the right hotel, but this time with the Niles Hotel in Istanbul it was the grand prize. When I read the great reviews in Tripadvisor I decided to call the Niles directly, Seda, the front counter supervisor, assisted me, she explained everything with such kindness and professionalism that I booked that same day. The hotel is family owned and small but once you are there they make you are part of that great family. The rooms are a bit small but very comfortable, the bathrooms were recently renovated and the entire property is spotless. Their breakfast is very good served in their roof top cafe which is very comfortable and cozy, in the mornings you can enjoy the Marmara Sea while having breakfast and at night you can enjoy the Istanbul lights while having some tea or coffee. The Niles Hotel is located in the old part of the city within walking distance of basically all the major sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, underground Cistern, palaces, Grand Bazzar, banks and stores. My wife and I, along with another couple, also booked all the tours and the airport pick-up through the hotel with no mishaps, also the check-in and check-out was done very smoothly and accurately. The hotel along with the entire staff made our stay in Istanbul a memorable experience, we recommend this hotel highly and if we return to Istanbul we will only stay at the Niles Hotel. Gabriel Miami Florida

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTEL for location and perfect customer service”
Reviews.Author: travelfans38
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Niles from 13 May 2008 to 17 May 2008 after selecting the hotel on the basis of the previous excellent reviews. We were not disappointed, in fact we were more than delighted with all aspects of our stay. The hotel is small and friendly, with a family atmosphere but without being overbearing or intrusive. Whilst the rooms are on the small side they are perfectly adequate for a short stay and are kept beautifully clean with daily maid service. The excellent breakfast is taken on the roof terrace which has beautiful views over the sea. This facility provides an excellent start to the day and a perfect place to enjoy a drink following a busy day seeing the sights. We found the level of customer service at the hotel second to none, even when compared with much more expensive accommodation. Everyone we met conveyed a positive warmth and genuine desire to deliver the highest levels of customer care and help. Their dedication is obvious, their approach being naturally professional. The hotel can be thoroughly recommended with absolute confidence. We would like to record our sincerest thanks to Seda, Murat and his Wife (sorry we forgot the name) and all others who ensured that our stay at the Niles was so pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles - Istanbul - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: oldfatdog
Reviews.Content: After booking our flight and lodging we contacted the Hotel Niles via email and recived a prompt reply fromthe front office manager (Seda). We then arranged for an airport pick-up (strongly recommended) through the hotel. Once we were picked up at the airport our stay in Istanbul blossomed into a fantastic experience. The hotel's location is excellant, the staff personable and accomodating and the view from the roof-top cafe superb. All of the advice we received from Seda was right on the mark. Most of the sights you "must" see are within walking distance. Enough English is spoken so that the language differences had minimal affect. This stay in Istanbul at the Hotel Niles was a positive experience on all counts.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maury8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel niles for 6 nights, the staff were all very helpful and friendly and made us feel very welcome from the moment of our arrival. Staff in reception offer accurate information on places to visit, transportation and directions.Hotel is also very clean. Nice terrace where breakfast is served.Locaction of hotel is central and within walking distance to most of the sights. Istanbul is a beautiful city of old and new and the people are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price quality”
Reviews.Author: Paddock25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles istanbul May 2008 3 older couples from Belgium Excellent stay within walking distance to all the major attractions and the "real" Istanbul life. Good organisation for airport pick up at a price of 35 Euro one way for 6 persons plus luggage. Friendly and helpfull personnel. Excellent breakfast (inside outside sitting)on the roof with view on the water and "real Istanbul" Very clean, new towels every day. Small not so new rooms with minor defects. E.g. not working lamps. After all an excellent price quality hotel with friendly and helpfull staff on a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Moderate-priced accommodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EHLibrarian
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 days in Istanbul, and the helpful staff at Hotel Niles were an instrumental part of it. From the information about the Bosphorous ferry tour to breakfast on the rooftop breakfast room we were very pleased. The rooms are fairly small, but well kept. Breakfast was the best we had during our 2 weeks in Turkey. The hotel is well located, near the University of Istanbul and the Grand Bazaar, and a shot walk to Ordu Caddesi where the east-west tram line runs. Front desk manager Sena went out of her way to make sure guests were looked after. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Yukongrizzly
Reviews.Content: Located in the Old Town of Istanbul, the Hotel Niles is among the best addresses to recommend. In the closer area you find the most important historic sites like Hagia Sofia, Sultan Ahmed Mos., Topkapi, the Great Basar, the oldest Turkish Bath and others. The rooms are not too big and clean, quiet during the night (unbelievable but no joke), the roof garden with flowers has a great view, the staff is more than friendly and the rates are quite fair. Breakfast is fresh every day, lovely decorated and you feel like in a family. There are no problems the beautiful girl from the front office desk will not be able to solve, and in the evening the little bar in the roof garden is well "maintained" by THE waiter. To put it in a nutshell: it was the best decision to choose this lovely hotel and our expectations were great. Thank you Seda and Osman. We miss you.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel niles”
Reviews.Author: TippVoyager
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 days at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul. Loved it ,loved Istanbul. The Hotel was spotless ,beds very comfortable, the terrace and breakfast were gorgeous. Above all the staff were excellent. We have also stayed at the Four Seasons Istanbul and while it is deinitely more luxurious I think in overall experience I would stay at the Hotel Niles if I were to return to Istanbul again

Reviews.Title: “I miss the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sabzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated his 30th birthday out in Istanbul and we wanted a reasonably priced hotel with good amentites in an excellent location - and thats exactly what we got with home like friendliness, great breakfast and a warm welcome thrown in for good measure. Seda the lady at reception was knowledgable , friendly and went out of her way to help us out- always giving us the local heads up! The room and bathroom was small but spotless - the only downside was that the tv signal was never clear. Breakfast was simple and traditional with home made pastries - the sesame bread rolls are lush! Location was fantastic, you literally walk 2 mins up the road turn right and you are at the Beyazit tramstop. The hotel is a 10 min walk to the Sultanamet area which houses the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia. All in all we had a comfortable stay and would recommend Hotel Niles as an ideal place to stay for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - great price”
Reviews.Author: freethinkr
Reviews.Content: this was an amazing hotel - great location - small by comfortable rooms. They picked us up from the airport as well as dropped us off - had to make arrangements beforehand for a small / extra fee.. but basically really really helped us out when in Istanbul. Last day we were leaving, the lights in the area went out, and they were very nice to give us some extra time to get ready before we left for the airport. Did I mention great location? and a really nice view from the rooftop terrace of the sea of marmara. I'd highly recommend people staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ibili
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights in April 2008. The hotel is very well located, 10 minutes walking distance to the Blue Moske and 5 min to a bus stop with multiple conections. Nonetheless it is situated in a small and dirty side street, difficult to find. We took several taxis during and none of them were able to find exactly the hotel. The rooms are small with a tiny bathroom, but very clean. The bed was actually good and we were able to rest after a long day of walking. The only "but" would be the thin walls and old door. During the night, it was quite but you would be woken up early in the morning as soon as any of the hotel guests make any noise. The hotel stuff was always friendly and eager to help. I would definetly consider coming back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: shanellek
Reviews.Content: After seeing a number of other positive reviews for Hotel Niles, my boyfriend we thought we'd give it a go for our stay in Istanbul. The hotel staff were fantastic - friendly, helpful, kind and humble. The hotel was clean, located within old Istanbul in easy walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and the tram stop, making it easy to get around to see all of the sights. Breakfast was good - Turkish cuisine served on the roof top terrace. I would highly recommend Hotel Niles to family and friends for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: vaguevagabond
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the hotel in April 2008. Overall the experience was very pleasant. The rooms were of adequate size and were clean and in very good condition. The hotel is situated very close to the Grand Bazaar and a short trip from all the major sights. The breakfast was served on the roof terrace with great views of the Marmara Sea and included tea, juice, bread, cold cuts, cheeses, vegetables and sweet pastries. It is not a full continental breakfast but comes very close and was a great start for the day. The most striking part of the hotel was the attitude of the receptionists, who all were extremely helpful and nice. There's also a computer with Internet access in the lobby for quickly checking email and weather. I'd strongly recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Istanbul! P.S. Prepare for the fact that taxis won't easily find the hotel, because it is on a small alley. I'd definitely choose the hotel's own pick-up service from the airport because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Getupandgotoday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in April and would echo what has been said before. Hotel located in a warehouse/workshop area of the city - we could see shoes being made in the workshop opposite, but is very close to the main tramway. It is an easy 20 minute walk to Sultanahmet with the main sights and Grand Bazaar even closer. Rooms are small but have all you need except as the previous reviewer said - no drawer space - there is one shelf in the wardrobe. We were on the 5th floor and did find the room quite noisy - near lift and scraping of chairs from roof terrace. All the staff are very helpful, especially Seda on reception and also Mehmet. I would come back to this hotel if I came back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for seeing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Misterexpress
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, contemporary and well located. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Having never been to Istanbul, we were astonished to discover that the hotel was so convenient to getting around. Literally, it was just a short walk to the Tramway which took you anywhere you would want to go. Then once we got the lay of the land, we were able to walk to and fro various locations from Hotel Niles. The breakfast service, offerings and setting were a perfect way to start each day. The room was very comfortable, well kept, and nice to come back to at the end of the day. Seda, whom no trip to Istanbul is complete without, helped us even before we left the USA with various questions and arrangements. Once we were in Istanbul, she greeted us each morning wanting to know our agendas and making very wise and informed suggestions as to best use the day. We were lucky to find this hotel through Expedia and would recommend it to anyone wanting a carefree hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: G-BOAC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the middle of the rabbit warren of roads that you'll find in this part of Istanbul. It's a good idea to request the hotel to arrange at pick-up at the airport, as you'll never find it by yourself. The hotel is very clean and the staff friendly and accommodating. Our room was small but comfortable with an en-suite shower and air conditioning. There was a wardrobe but no drawer space. The beds were comfortable. The double glazing is very effective at keeping out the noise (our room was on the first floor and because of the gradient of the street outside passers-by were practically at room level). There are regular 'calls to prayer' emanating from the mosques (but not during the night). The hotel is a short walk away from restaurants, cash machines, etc. as well being close by to the Grand Bazaar, Turkish bath houses, the Blue Mosque, etc. Taxis are cheap and there is a modern tramway closeby that passes through the city. Check-in and check-out were efficient, and the hotel discounts its room rates by 5% if you pay in cash (any currency). The rooftop breakfast room has a view over the rooftops towards the open water. But it has limited seating capacity which means that when the hotel is busy, there aren't enough tables and chairs for everyone. The breakfast is a cold buffet, with plenty to choose from. All in all, not a bad hotel to base yourself during a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a short-break visit”
Reviews.Author: prujim
Reviews.Content: Can only echo what so many other reviews have said - the Niles provides the service and facilities, at a reasonable price, that are ideal for the short-break in Istanbul. Being located on a side-road opposite Beyazit Square in an area dominated by wholesale clothing can make it slightly difficult to find when arriving on the tram. However this easy access to the transport system allows for cheap transfers to and from the airport / ferry terminals, and the main historic sites are mostly within 20 minutes walk. There's also the feeling of not being in an area dedicated solely to the pursuit of the tourists lira. The hotel staff, from manager and reception through to waiters and cleaners, were cheerful, helpful and efficient. The rooms are adequate and the buffet breakfasts taken on the roof-top area were plentiful, varied and included "home made" items on a changing basis. What this small hotel provides is the personal touch that can make a memorable stay. Other hotels may provide more facilities, but this one delivers for those wishing a reasonably priced base for a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ml1234
Reviews.Content: We have returned from 10 days in Istanbul. The hotel is located close to all the main attactions and is 2 minutes walk to the tram which gets you to most places easily. We found the staff very welcoming, respectful, friendly and they went that extra mile to help especially Mehmet and Seda on reception. The hotel staff were very responsive in replying to emails through the booking process and when we asked questions about the hotel. We found the hotel was very honest prior to us booking when we asked about the size of the room. As we had our 3 year old son with us we didn't want to book a room which was really small. They informed us that all the rooms were the same size and were not very large, we were also sent a plan of 2 rooms so that we could see exactly how big they were. I found this very reassuring as many hotels we had asked a similiar question to prior to booking just didn't respond. Our room was on the 5th floor so we didnt hear much noise from within the hotel or outside. Also once when our heater didnt work in the room we were swiftly given another heater. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and they do have a toaster now!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if no DISCRIMINATION TREATMENT”
Reviews.Author: andayand
Reviews.Content: Family: 2 adults and a 5 yrs old girl from Romania Great location, great view, very clean rooms, friendly staff and very helpful BUT if we didn't experience a discrimination treatment I would have said: the perfect choice for Istanbul. We have booked a double bed room specifying that we have a little girl and we want to use the existing beds. (the twin room was at the same price) At the arrival we've received a room at the last floor on the corner - the smallest room and the smallest double bed in the hotel (this we discovered later when living the hotel) The size of the bed was very uncomfortable for 2 adults and a child. We didn't complain until the last day when we saw the room next to our door- twin double room - with BIG size twin beds AND, in addition, on the beds: slippers and wardrobes prepared for the guests! We have stayed 3 nights, every day the room was cleaned, the "accessories" replaced but we didn't have the "honor" to have slippers and wardrobes waiting for us on the bed or anywhere else in our decent room. So, I live at your judge this story. STILL, I DO RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. Despite of discrimination treatment if I will go back to Istanbul one day I will book at Niles hotel specifying this time: size of bad, "full room package", no 5th floor (chairs noise early in the morning because of the breakfast served on the terrace 6th floor:))

Reviews.Title: “Simply great at very good price”
Reviews.Author: Lolicon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, very tidy and clean. But the highlights are the staff (super friendly), free internet, wireless troughout the hotel, the terrace for breakfast and the breakfast itself. Also the location is great! 3 minutes on foot from a tram station and inside a colourful "fashion" district.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location but...........”
Reviews.Author: JimmyandHeather
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Niles for four nights due to the rave reviews it gets on this website and in many ways those plaudits are well deserved. All of the staff are absolutely fantastic. Rarely have we seen such hospitality. The front desk staff all speak good English and are knowledgable about their city and are keen to help. The location is brilliant. Ten minutes walk to The Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia ( actually itâ€™s the Aya Sofya) and ten minutes by tram to The Galata bridge. The kebab place next door is very good value and the food is simple but we found it nice and safe. We used their airport pick up service which costs 25 euro to the hotel and 20 euro back. Well worth it. However the main downside is that there is no sound proofing in the rooms and if your neighbours (above you, below you or next next door to you) have an early flight their four am alarm call will also become yours. Doors bang all night long and the vibrations permeate the structure and in a city which is prone to earthquakes being rudely awoken at 3 in the morning with your mirrors shuddering is quite disconcerting. We tried a different room but it was no better. There is actually very little noise from outside. Break fast is also disappointing with little or no hot food. They donâ€™t even have a toaster!!! But itâ€™s true the views are great. But these gripes aside The Niles is really nice. We normally stay at the multi-national brands like Hyatt and Hilton where obviously you are paying more so you expect more. So in that respect The Niles represents good value for money. You get a TV in your room. Sheets and towels are changed every day and there is free internet access which is great. Would we stay there again? A resounding YES but only once they have dampened down all the noise and bought a toaster!!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sea-mew
Reviews.Content: This hotels main assets are its very friendly and helpful staff and its breakfast area/cafe with a great view of the Marmara sea. We used the 25 Euro Airport pick-up arriving in Istanbul and that worked well. We returned using tpublic transportation (tram) taking the advice ot the helpful receptionist who said that worked well if we did not have much luggage. That proved to be right. It was quicker than a car (and much much cheaper) even though we had to change once. But I do not recommend taking the tram to the hotel if you ar not familiar with Istanbul, the hotel is not that easy to spot the first time. The main attractions the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia is only two tram stops away, and the great Bazaar is only 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. And you will get any advise you would ever need from the staff. The breakfast is a strong advantage with this hotel. It is served in the roof top area with a great view. And you get both a selection of "the normal stuff" but also some turkish and home made specialities. All served with great care. Breakfast is served 8-10, and we left for the ariport 7:30, and naturally they were happy to fix us coffe and sandwiches at 7:00 instead. The rest of the time you can order beer, coffee, tea, sandwiches etc in there. Or read a book, or play cards... We finished our evenings with a beer overlooking the harbour and the Marmara sea. (Many restaurants do not serve beer, nor wine and spirits) The room was very clean, had a comfortable bed an a quite small but nice bathroom. When it comes to decorations and furniture it was on the basic side, but everything worked as it should. Our room (201) was close to the elevator and the staircase, and if you are sensitive to noice you might get disturbed if you wish to go to bed early. I guess that the rooms futher away are more quiet. It did not bother us though. No noice from the outside was heard at night. There is a computer in the lobby that we used for searching wikipedia etc and check- in.

Reviews.Title: “Best base for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wullie28
Reviews.Content: The Niles is splendidly situated, just 100m from the main "tram street" you can get to most sites easily. Actually, Sultanahmet is only an interesting 15 minute stroll away. We used very little public transport. The hotel reception is very friendly and great with advice and recommendations. We arrived very late and the night cover found that there was a "problem" with our booking. However, we were welcomed, shown our room and assured that everything would be dealt with. It was, and the next morning, we could enjoy our breakfast in the roof-top glass restaurant, with wonderful views over the Sea of Marmara, and an excellent choice of food and fruit. We found all of the main tourist sites lived up to their reputation - it's a really beautiful city. We discovered Kodokai across the Bosphorus as a great slice of "real" Istanbul. Hassles were few, and most were enjoyable. The people are very friendly, nice to old folk, and the relative lack of liquor means a lack of threat. It feels very safe, even at night. We shall be back to the city, and to the Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff - definitely recommended.”
Reviews.Author: slim05
Reviews.Content: The challenge - to see as much of Istanbul as possible in one weekend. Many people laughed when we told them this but me and my girlfriend were up to it. One major factor that helped us achieve our goal was the staff at the Hotel Niles. Everyone knows Turkish people in shops etc are really friendly and helpful but the staff at the Hotel Niles seem to go that extra mile. We were offered great advice regarding where to go according to our interests and the best way of doing it. We could have done no research and left the AA Istanbul travel guide at home thanks to Seda! Murat - one of the waiters/bar staff was very helpful and is an example of how the staff at the Niles are geniuinely helpful and friendly. The only reason I booked the hotel was because of its rating and positive reviews on Trip Advisor - to be honest we were worried as the price was too good to be true for a hotel that is rated #4 in Istanbul but since staying there I can safely say all praise is justified! Some reviewers below have said how the rooms are slightly small but we didn't find this at all. The rooms are clean and roomy - upon entering for the first time my girlfriend said it was amazing and she can be quite hard to please at the best of times !! We found the rooftop cafe/bar a great retreat when looking for a rest during our busy schedule as it offers an calm, elegant atmosphere... Anyway, I'll stop now or people are gonna think I work for the Niles - seriously though I can't say one bad word about this hotel. When we come back to Istanbul later this year we will 100% be staying at the Niles again. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: legalbabelondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and loved our time there. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and looked after. Seda, front desk person is most helpful and kind, be it from giving tips on how not to get conned by taxis or recommending places to see and restaurants to eat at. We went with Seda's recommendation and tried Rumeli's, which we loved and would recommend also. Our room was adequately furnished and was very clean; the bathroom was modern and rather nice. Our room backed on to the street but it was not noisy at all. The hotel is next to a mosque so we could hear the call to the prayer in the early morning but it was not disturbing at all in fact we found it rather peaceful. The little restaurant/bar is on the roof top, which meant we had gorgeous views of the Bosphorus during breakfast and for our last drink of the evening. The food was great, simple choice but more than adequate to start your day with. The hotel is 5 minutes walk to the Grand Bazar and 20 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and the other must see sights in the Old Town. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: annaandprince
Reviews.Content: Magnificient Hotel Niles - Istanbul Actually, words can not express our experience. We stay at the Hotel (felt more like a luxury resort) for 3 weeks. The service and attentiveness was superior at the first to the last minute when the Hotel arranged our departure 3:30 am, loaded us and waved good-bye as we drove away. Fantastic. The Hotel was immaculate, clean fresh and new interior and decor. The Buffet breakfast was varied and delicious, fresh. The wait staff and hotel anticipated out needs and requests. The Hotel staff was so familiar wih Istanbul and tour companies and sights they were able to save us much heaache and needless worry. We will return t Istanbul and the only place we will lodge is Hotel Niles. Bravo! We are world traveller and rarely experience this level on service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kenfrohling
Reviews.Content: As previous posts have reported, this hotel is a gem. We booked two rooms for a weekend stay. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to the Grand Bazaar and Tram line (3 blocks). Seda at the front desk was charming and helpful - and always available. It seems like she works 24/7! The breakfast was included and very good with fresh fruits and home baked pastries. The rooms are very basic, but clean and functional and the beds comfortable. We would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NZ2
Reviews.Content: After reviewing other guest comments via Tripadvisor we decided on Hotel Niles. Used the pickup service 20 Euro. Great very clean room. Good breakfast in roof area. Very good location to tram, Blue Mosque tourist sights etc. Hotel staff always prepared to assist with tourist information. Stayed 5 nights in total.

Reviews.Title: “Your Best Bet in Sultanahmet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Larendavis
Reviews.Content: Outstanding in value, customer service, and location. You cannot find a better hotel for the price range bar none! I am writing this on the last day of a 6 day stay in Istanbul. And everything I read about the hotel niles was spot on! the following are exemplary: - customer service from EVERY employee was outstanding in all aspects of hotel management and guest relations. This is a rare find. - breakfast was consistent; warm eggs, light meats, and breads. the fresh fruit was always welcome each Am and the view is outstanding. - the room was spotless, well maintained, and typical in Euro size; the bath met my expecttations while the water was HOT and with amazing pressure. Overall ... I would come here again if i stayed at Sultanahmet/Beyzet area Suggestions: The "New district" certainly is where i spent most of my time once I went through the usual monuments on the old town side. So I would probably be looking for a hotel in the Galata Tower area next time. As far as eating establishments: KONAK on strip in the New district .... excellent. Vegetarian, just off the strip near the Funicular, starts with a Ze ... and I must say, Turkish cuisine is often a bit lacking real gourmet qualities so the food was not up to par with france or italy on this trip. Also, GO to the PRINCES ISLANDS for a day trip! This is a great way t spend the afternoon following the hubbub of Istanbul. Also the ferry down the Bosphous was a nice respite with the bus trip back. Again ,,,,,,,,,, the hotel niles was excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “This has to be the best Hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: docvwLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel on the basis on reviews on this site. The Hotel is an easy walking distance from the main sights in the City, but, if walking is a problem, the tram stops just 2 minutes away. The area felt very safe and although the Hotel is in a side street devoted it seems to the rag trade and hence not very scenic, the advantages of the Hotel more than made up for this. All staff are exceptionally kind, accomodating and helpful, with good english and appeared to take pride in thier work. We were made to feel at home on arrival and offered complementary hot drinks when we returned very wet from sightseeing in the rain. They even came to the front door to wave us off when we left! Breakfast was plentiful, fresh and enjoyable - continental style - no hot breakfast options other than omlette, which suited us, but may be problematic if you need a fry up. No evening meals available but the Kebap shop next door is superb and they will bring plated meals up to the breakfast room in the hotel if you want to eat there. The rooms were small to mediumsized but had everything you could want and they were nicely decorated and very clean. TV offered CNN and BBC World. There is a fridge available in the room and free internet at Reception All in all there is nothing to fault at Niles Hotel. They deserve an award

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Niles Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vasUK
Reviews.Content: I chose the Niles Hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. It was absolutely perfect and I would not hesitate to stay there again. I was welcomed with open arms and as I got in the taxi to leave, was waved off goodbye. I feel like I have left friends behind. The service and attention from staff was superior to 5 star hotels. As a woman on a business trip alone I felt very safe there and very welcome. The room was small but had everything I needed. It was exceptionally clean and bed extremely comfy. The bed linen seemed super clean and crisp. Better than I have seen in some 4 and 5 star hotels. Lovely terrace to have breakfast. Very helpful staff who spoke english on reception. On recommendation from another traveller I visited the excellent kebab shop next door, some of the best kebabs I've ever tasted and as a woman travelling alone they didn't make me feel uncomfortable even though I don't speak any Turkish. The main road was 2 minutes up the road with tram and bus station. The Grand Bazaar 5 minutes walk away. If you're looking for an authentic experience, at a reasonable price, great food then you don't have to look any futher than the Niles Hotel. The way you get treated is 5 star service without paying 5 star prices. I would definitely stay at the Niles again.

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: surfbum7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over christmas with my wife and two sons and we really enjoyed ourselves. The good reviews are accurate and I'll add mine- Warm and very friendly staff (Seda and Murat), clean, small but cozy rooms and a wonderfull rooftop enclosed patio and terrace for breakfasts. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and also walkable to the Blue Mosque, etc. There is a tram line about a block away if you don't want to walk to the sites. I chose this hotel mainly through trip advisor reviews and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with everyone else!”
Reviews.Author: OzzieBahrain
Reviews.Content: Not much more you can say really, everything you have read about this hotel is true. Seda in particular is more than willing to help you in any way with advice and information. Good value, location, breakfast and standard. Can be a little noisy at times, but this is expected with any european hotel of its age. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: Waltzing_Matlida
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a room at Hotel Niles after reading the fabulous reviews on Trid Advisor and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel was very conveniently located (close to the bazaar and the tram, walking distance to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, near Kumkapi which has great restaurants), the room was very clean and well appointed and the staff was absolutely wonderful. We would have had a fine experience with the hotel alone, but the fabulously helpful staff - Seda and Emre in particular - made our stay that much better. A very nice breakfast was included in the price. Hotel Niles was by far the best value for our money while we were in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for short break”
Reviews.Author: RobinLondonN1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a short break. Very clean and agreable - rooms are small but we were out most of the time so what did we want a large room for. Television works. Hairdryer works. Bathroom fine - though our shower was a bit feeble but one word to reception and to Seda the charming Manageress sorted that! Lovely breakfast room on the roof terrace. All staff EXTREMELY amiable - they couldn't do enough to help! Perfectly situated for visiting the city ..... We totally recommend this hotel for a break in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “If service was this good in all hotels, we wouldn't buy houses!”
Reviews.Author: rpardoroques
Reviews.Content: Staying in Hotel Niles was fantastic. If service was this good in all Hotel then nobody would bother with a mortgage!!!! The friendly and well organised atmosphere inside Hotel Niles makes you feel at home from the beginning! Any help we needed in organising trips or getting to places was immediately offered... and organised!!! The view from the roof-top dining room is excellent whilst you wait for your fresh food to be brought to you from the eatery the hotel has a link with! Fantastic! The hotel staff made everyone feel like we were the most important guests there, from 4 year-old children, through all ages! A true home way from home!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We just spent 10 nights at the Niles in Istanbul. The hotel is a short uphill walk to buses and trams and a walkable distance from many major attractions. It's located in Beyazit (the grand bazaar area). The staff is helpful, cheerful and able to communicate well with English speakers. Seda gives excellent information and directions that help the visitor get around a very large city. Twenty-four hour front desk. Very clean. Delicious breakfast variety of fresh fruit, (oranges, pomegranites, olives, cucumbers, tomatoes), real yogurt, home-baked Turkish breads and cakes,cereals, sliced deli meat and cheese, coffee, etc. Rooms are small but have all necessities. Located in an active garment district, so there is street noise between morning and about 7 p.m. A good base for exploring Istanbul's attractions. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Carrie33
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Niles for 3 nights in early December 2007. The staff in this small hotel were all efficient, welcoming and nothing was too much trouble, particularly for Seda the front desk lady. A problem in closing the window was fixed within hours. An issue with missing laundry (outsourced by the hotel) was also addressed without any problem. Located within a 5-10 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar, the hotel is ideally located to drop off shopping then return for more browsing. Its also an easy walk to the main tourist attractions of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace areas with the tram line also just a few mins walk away. Breakfast was included in the tariff and offered home-made cakes and little savoury rolls which were delicious and varied each day, along with the usual breakfast fare. The room we had was spotless with comfortable beds and an airport transfer was organised and arrived on time. Highly recommended :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stefanerics
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Niles in Istanbul in November, we were a group of five that wanted a good place as a base for exploring Istanbul and surroundings for 5 days. The hotel had a very good location in Sultanahmnet, with walking distance to several of the "must-see" sights such as the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and Topkapi, as well as the Grand Bazar. It is not so far away from the more modern Beyoglu either, one can walk there (30 minutes) or take a taxi (5-10 minutes). The rooms were medium sized and clean and nice. The roof terrace was very nice to have breakfast on (it is covered by a "glass house", so it works also when it is raining, which it did quite a lot during our stay...). But the best thing was the staff and the helpfulness that they showed. They were very friendly and helpful when explaining about how to find the different sights in the city and giving general advise, as well as recommending restaurants. The pick-up service to and from the airport also worked very well. A stay here is recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: jrussell4934
Reviews.Content: The friendly and helpful staff at the Hotel Niles greeted us as if we were part of their family upon our arrival there. This boutique hotel was recommended in a travel article this year in the Atlanta Journal Constitution newspaper after the reporter stayed there. We were very pleased with the cleaniness of the rooms, the convenient location and the warmness of the staff. Breakfast on the rooftop dining area was tops and offered a wonderful view of the sea. It was great value for the cost of lodging. Seda, the front office manager, arranged for a local guide for our first day there. He was excellant! Not only did we see so much of the city, he gave us confidence that we could explore on our own for the remainder of our visit there. Truly our visit to Istanbul was a memory we will treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Denvergirl55
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for five nights in early November at the Hotel Niles. The English-speaking staff members were so welcoming and attentive. The rooms are comfortably sized, with access to the BBC or CNN, if you feel compelled to know what is going on outside of Istanbul. Free internet was a bonus. Breakfast each morning was delightful and served in their rooftop bar, overlooking the Sea of Marmara. Seda, the assistant manager, provided great recommendations for sightseeing and excellent directions to everywhere we wanted to visit. The proximity to the Tram makes it easy to get around Istanbul or to connect to points beyond. The rates at this hotel were quite reasonable, $100 per night. It is just a few blocks away from the chaos of the city but an easy walk to the Grand Bazaar. After having traveled for two months, this was a welcome respite at the end of my journey. If I visit Istanbul again, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Family Owned...and we felt like FAMILY!!!”
Reviews.Author: netsden
Reviews.Content: We read about this wonderful hotel on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed! We were welcomed by Seda, at the Front Desk as if we were long lost friends! The owner took us on a tour of their cozy, but well appointed hotel! The restaurant at the top is perfect...overlooking the Marmara Sea on one side and the ecclectic street below...it allows easy conversation with fellow travellers or quiet times to reflect on a busy day! The food was wonderful too! Our room was small...but we did not spend much time in it...the bathroom tiny, but very well supplied with lovely soaps, shampoo etc.... we had all the amenities we needed and it was super clean! Exactly what we were looking for,,,and the proximity of the hotel to everything was awesome! A two minute walk to the Grand Bazaar...Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern etc. etc. within easy walking distance...the train was only minutes away too! Information was readily available on any sightseeing we wished to do and questions were answered with great honesty and willingness...I think if Seda could have come with us...she would have! From check-in to check-out we were treated like very special guests...an experience that is rare today...and so appreciated! Thank You Hotel Niles...and in particular Seda (Seda is the epitome of a Front Desk Manager)...for making our stay in Istanbul a most memorable one!!! We appreciated the special touches as we celebrated our 40th Anniversary! We loved every minute we spent with you!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeatoskyVancouver
Reviews.Content: The highlight of Hotel Niles Istanbul was the staff. They were most welcoming and helpful. After checking in we enjoyed a complimentary cup of tea on the pretty roof terrace. Soon we were reminded that we had arrived at a unique place when we heard the call to prayer from a nearby mosque. Our room was basic and clean but - best of all - was the location, within walking distance of all the sights in Old Istanbul: Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and Topkapi Palace. The breakfast was good and nutritious. We loved Istanbul and would be pleased to stay at Hotel Niles Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinayChak
Reviews.Content: We just returned last week from a three week holiday to Europe. The last leg of our holiday was at Istanbul where we stayed at the Niles for three days We travel extensively as part of our jobs and have stayed across various categories of hotels - without doubt the staff at the Niles is the friendliest we have encountered. Right from the moment we checked in till the time we checked out - they were always willing to help and give suggestions. Not only were were Seda & Yesut always ready to help so were the staff at rooftop coffee shop. This is a great help especially if you have a 14 month baby with you The hotel is located in a fabulous location - it is a 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and tram station and 15 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofiya. If that wasn't enough, the area is also a shoppers delight. It's in the middle of leather making stores (no pollution here) and one can get excellent bargains on leather garments like jackets - which are sold at high street stores for atleast 6-7 times the price In addition there are also lots of garment wholesellers who sell to high street stores. Though a lot of them refuse to sell individual garments, some effort and going to various stores will ensure you can pick up some great bargains The tram station closeby ensures you can get to the main points in the city easily. The only drawback of the hotel was the small size of the room - with small baby that can be a problem. In addition, I think they do not have room service - but these were very small hindrances for us Even though they do not have a restaurant, there is an awesome kebeb joint adjacent (literally joined to the hotel) which serves amazing kebabs at unbelievably low prices. Their kebabs were without doubt among the better ones I ate in Istanbul from far more expensive places All in all a great experience!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddictZG
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was wonderful. We were there as a family and enjoyed both the city and the hotel. The location is central, near a tram station, breakfast was excellent and served at the rooftop terrace and the rooms were very clean. Members of the staff were helpful and kind enough to point us to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great place but beware if booked online”
Reviews.Author: jlsw
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel Niles with a prepaid Priceline reservation only to find the hotel was full and we were transported to sister property, Hotel Dersaadet. Both places seemed great and excellent staff. Liked the hotel a great deal but problems at check out with accusation of having not paid and attempt to double bill. Think the problem would have been the same at Hotel Niles as staff appears to assume Priceline works different than reality of payment in full for room at time of reservation. The situation was very embarrassing and ended a nice stay on a terrible note. Will explain on Hotel D. website but beware if going to Hotel Niles with paid confirmation as it will not be accepted.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly staff !”
Reviews.Author: MannyLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas, USA and am sourounded by steel, glass and plastic make believe so on my frequent travels around the globe I seek out ancient cities like Istanbul and find small, congenial hotels like this one. Hotel Niles fits this category perfectly, its fluently English speaking staff is most helpful, knwledgeable and exceptionally friendly. The room was unusually large and comfortable, so was the rooftop breakfast - and drink facility overlooking the sea of Marmara. The location is great too, if you want to get to know the locals, the narrow, hilly, cobblestone streets make it easy to meet and converse with shop keepers. Up the street is the tram station which brings you to the harbor ares. Near by short walk is the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosk, Hagia Sophia and countles cafees and shops. I was in Istanbul once before and find the Turkish people and this city most congenial and fascinating. Might go visit here again and will stay at the Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: uzvizitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The moment I arrived I was greeted by hotel's front manager. I arrived a bit earlier than a check-in time. In spite of this, my room was prepared with a welcome coffee on the rooftop cafe. Location is great. The Hotel manager gives a helpful orientation of vicinity and provides maps where to go and suggests the attractions to visit. The hotel is in the heart of the shopping area in Istanbul and within the 5 minute walking to Grand Bazar, about 10 min walking to Blue Musk, and Topkapi palace. There is a tramline nearby which takes you to the bank of the Bosphorus for the tours. There also a lot of cafes, and restaurants nearby. Hotel provides the complimentary breakfast with choices of fruits, amlet, cereal, pastry, and coffee/tea. It is served on the rooftop cafe of hotel. The room was clean and nicely decorated. It was comfortable. It is not a Big, busy hotel with a grand lobby. It has a charm of privacy ..like in a downtown apartment plaza setting. Hotel has a free WiFi internet available in all rooms. If you do not have your laptop there is public computer available in the lobby. This hotel could facilitate a pickup/drop off from/to Ataturk Airport in Istanbul for a decent price. The hotel staff is very ambitious and helpful with carrying your luggage to a room. I had to leave the hotel for airport at 3 am on a check out day. On that early morning, I was nicely surprised by staff who had the breakfast ready, and had it delivered to my room at 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: cherokeeWorcester
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on the basis of the good reviews from Tripadvisor. I wasnt disappointed. Its a clean functional hotel, not particularly big, but in a great location for exploring the city. It isnt luxurious by any means , but is perfectly adequate with helpful, welcoming staff. The rooftop is very pleasant for a drink and is also where the breakfast room is. Breakfasts are ok , although not a huge choice. The hotel is inexpensive and great value. The hotel is very close to the grand bazzar and the main tram line which goes through Sultanhamet down to the Bospherous where the boats terminal is. Its only a 10 to 15 minute walk down from the hotel to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace. We got the hotel to collect us from the airport (sabiha Gokcen) on the Asian side and they charged Â£8 each . Its probably the easiest way to get there and its a 45 minute trip. Some of the restaurants dont serve alcohol as we found on our first night when we went to the Izmir restaurant close to the hotel. Expect to pay around Â£8 for two courses and a drink in most places. If you choose to eat on one of the main restaurants on the main street yoou can easily double this and more. Liked the hotel and Istanbul. A bargain stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicbarr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles is well located, near to all the attractions in the old city. The hotel is nicely decorated and clean and all the staff are extremely helpful. They arrranged our transport to and from the airport. The hotel has a rooftop terrace where it is lovely just to sit and have a drink. Breakfast is also taken on the terrace - the homemade breads are wonderful. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if visiting Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: crh_kw
Reviews.Content: Hi Three friends and I stayed at this hotel on the advice of a friend (whose mother is Turkish). We're glad we did. Great location (within walking distance of most major sites, but not part of the tourist zone), incredible staff (the hotel Manager, Seda, the night staff, everyone -- they even helped when we inquired about places, etc. outside of the main tourist zone), clean rooms, and good food. It was also reasonable. We met up with people who paid the same price and stayed in a dump. I'd recommend anyone looking for a good place in Istanbul stay at Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Soggychops
Reviews.Content: A friend I was meeting in Istanbul found this hotel and in this price range it was great value for money. The staff especially were very friendly and helpful and the roof terrace was a lovely place to have breakfast. Seda, the front of house manager, loves her job and it shows. Local area is interesting too, it's easy to walk to the big sites from the Hotel Niles and if you want to buy leather goods - especially handbags - I recommend a walk around the streets near by. We were very happy there. They can arrange airport transfers for 20 euros as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: Pensioner99
Reviews.Content: This is a small family run hotel. The rooms are quite small and so are the en-suites - but the rooms are well furnished, clean and comfortable and the bathrooms are beautifully clean and everything works! The showers are really good!! The air conditioning worked well. The roof terrace is delightful - an oasis of calm overlooking the sea - binoculars provided. Breakfast is served there and you can have drinks there all day. Breakfast was good - a cold buffet with a wide variety of choice. Best of all is the friendly and informed service by all the staff. We were there for a short time only and we were so well advised on where to go and where to eat - so we made the most of our time. The hotel can arrange pick up from the airport - there are two airports so make sure you know which one - and this helps to maximise your time and cut down on travel fatigue. Thank you Seda and your staff - it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Casie_51
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at 2.30am after a delay at the airport and when we got out of the taxi there were three members of staff waiting to greet us, howâ€™s that for service. When we went up on to the roof top for breakfast on the first day we realized we had made the right choice as the view is brilliant. The food was the usal that you get these days and was always fresh and plentiful. The Hotel is situated about two minutes walk from the main bus / tram route into the heart of the city, ideal for getting around, although its in an area where they produce clothes and footwear so it could be a little noisy if you left the window open. At reception you will find Seda who will tell you all you need to know about places to visit and where to eat, she is a little gem. All the staff at the hotel were excellent and couldnâ€™t do enough to help, nothing was too much trouble. Our room was basic but clean and had air con, a TV and a fridge. Only downside was the bathroom was a little on the small side but donâ€™t let that put you off. Would we stay there again, most certainly would.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Hotel Niles in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bandcon
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Niles Hotel in Istanbul in early September 2007. The hotel was a small hotel with a staff that could not have been more attentive to our needs. The rooms were clean and expertly maintained. The front desk manager, Seda, could not have been more accommodating. She arranged for tours for us and set us up with an excellent tour guide who knew the history and architecture of Istanbul. Even after we left the hotel, she made arrangements for us at another location in Turkey. She is a great ambassador for the hotel. We would stay in the Niles Hotel again if our travels take us to Istanbul. It is conveniently located within walking distance of the trolley line and most of the important ancient sites of Istanbul. Our experience at the Niles Hotel was one of the highlights of our stay in Istanbul. The rooftop restaurant where breakfast is served and where one can relax after a day of sightseeing is a real plus for the hotel. We would recommend the Niles Hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MB_washdc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Niles was the perfect hotel for my week long stay in Istanbul. The location is great for getting around the city. Tourist locations are a short walk from the hotel and the tram is only a few blocks away. Seda and all the staff were extremely helpful with directions and tips for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain at the price”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeofYork
Reviews.Content: The Niles is a sister hotel to the Dersaadet, also in Istanbul. It's a 10 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar, 20 from the Blue Mosque. Because of a mixup in our original booking for 8 nights at the Desaadet, we agreed to the first 3 nights being at the Niles. We were collected f.o.c from the airport, and after the 3 nights were transferred at lunchtime to the Desaadet without any hassle . The Niles is new. slap bang among tailoring workshops (which are a bit noisy from 6 am) and pedestrian access is down a rather steep street, so the initial impression isn't great. However, all the staff are most welcoming, and the breakfast served on the rooftop restaurant is excellent . The clean room is best described as adequate for a short stay though anyone with a hip size of more than 40 inches could have difficulty in getting into and out of the tiny bathroom. The price is so remarkably low that it 's a real bargain. Our ages are 79 and 73

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: doxieladyflorida
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all over the world and stayed in various types of hotels, and there is none better than The Hotel Niles in Istanbul. The staff are helpful and friendly, and they often helped me plan my day. The rooftop terrace was my favorite place within the hotel. A large and varied breakfast was served there every morning. The view from the terrace was spectacular. I would definitely stay at the Niles Hotel again, and would recommend it to anyone thinking about coming to Istanbul. Elaine Walker

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: India2542
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location which is quite close to all the touristy sites but not too close to be too noisy, The staff is very friendly and do their best to make you feel at home. They provide good information and are very efficient. In all, the stay in Istanbul was memorable for many reasons and Niles was one of the important ones. Although this is not a fancy hotel, its clean rooms and outstanding roof view are excellent value for money. Will strongly recommend this hotel for a budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: mystery100
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Niles, helped to make our trip to Istanbul an incredible experience. The rooms are a reasonable size. All the staff provide a sensational service. They were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: EstherBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Well all I have to say is that Hotel Niles is one of the reasons our trip to Istambul were that good. All the staff were extremily kind and helpfull. The building had something that made it wonderful and special, and made you realise that you don't need a luxury hotal to feel like home in a foreing country like Turkey. I reccomend all of you that are searching for a place to stay in Istambul, to go to Niles Hotel, it's very close to the main points of the city, you have a wonderful views of the Marmara sea from the terrace, and also for the wonderful team they have. Thanks for treating us so well, be sure we will come back! Esther. from Barceona

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value- recommended”
Reviews.Author: DullDave
Reviews.Content: Firstly, and I am probably being over simplistic, a visit Istanbul requires a choice between staying in the Sultanahmet/Grand Bazaar area where the sights mostly are, or at Taksim where nightlife and restaurants tend to be better. Having tried both, I favour the former, for both price and character. The Hotel Niles is very near the university, close to the Grand Bazaar and within an easy stroll of all the Sultanahmet attractions. The only negatives I can think of are: The surrounding 50 metres or so are narrow streets that are, perhaps, a little run down. I didn't feel nervous walking down them at night, but perhaps some sole travellers might. The hotel han't got its own generator in the event of power cuts, which aren't at all unknown in Turkey. My first evening was in darkness, though I would have to say that the staff did everything possible to ensure guests were not inconvenienced. The positives have been covered before- I can only repeat and agree with them. The staff, especially Seda (front office manager) were superb, ensuring orientation and enjoyment. The rooftop terrace is lovely, an especially nice place to have breakfast. Rooms are clean, spacious and with decent air conditioning. The bathrooms are ok. I was on the top floor(504) the shower was nicely powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brasrus
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a five night stay at the Hotel Niles in Istanbul. We had read the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed at all. We has arranged an airport pick up through the hotel and unfortunately one of our suitcases failed to arrive with our flight. It took over an hour to sort out the paperwork at the airport but eventually when we did get to the exit hall the driver was still there waiting for us with a smile and a welcome to Istanbul. The hotel is situated in a quiet street just 5 minutes walk to the Grand Bazaar. The hotel is spotlessly clean and maintained to a high standard.Our room was of adequate size with a very efficient air conditioning unit, fridge and T.V. with BBC World. Breakfast, buffet style is taken on the roof top terrace where you can sit and enjoy the views over the Marmaris Sea. The breakfast is more than adequate with some home made specialities available. Seda is the front office manager and gave us excellent advice on how to spend our time in Istanbul. Her advice was invaluable. All the staff at the hotel are very pleasant and willing to help, and always with a smile. For value for money, great location and a very friendly service you will not find better in Istanbul.We would definately stay here again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles - the best service in town”
Reviews.Author: Maneen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul and stayed in Hotel Niles. The service was speedy and there was no language problem. The hotel was very clean and the staff always happy to help. If you don't want to spend lots of money and stay relativley close to all the main attractions i.e. The Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Haga Sofia then this is the place to stay. It is definitly worth considering Hotel Niles. We have already recommended them to our family and friends. Yasmin Durrani from UK.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: UCSDTravelers
Reviews.Content: We relied upon the reviews from TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and within a pleasant walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Palace and other sights. The staff are more than friendly and very helpful. I really enjoyed the view from the terrace. The room was perfect for our needs â€“efficient in size, very clean when we arrived and tidied during our daily excursions, and with a very good working AC. We stayed at other boutique hotels during our stay in Turkey, but we were quite happy to find that this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask for more at Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: DADUBE
Reviews.Content: Our title says it all. We found this superb hotel on TripAdvsor and it certainly lived up to the promise of all the reviews we read. We arrived at Hotel Niles after a nightmare 12 hour coach journey from Fethiye, and the welcome at the hotel was amazing. Getting to the hotel was a slight problem (see directions at the end) but there were incredibly friendly and helpful people along the way from shop owners to stall holders who pointed us in the right direction. At the desk we were greeted by Seda - she is the front office manager, face of the hotel and worth her weight in gold. When I reserved a room at the hotel through its website she sent me speedy emails and answered all our questions. This excellent service was a pre-taste of what was to follow. As we arrived we were welcomed as valued guests, and were promised an orientation to help us along (it was our first trip to Istanbul). Our room was basic but very clean and comfortable, with an excellent AC unit ,and good shower. There is also a fridge which is useful and the tv has BBC World which kept my bloke happy! We also found it to be very quiet which is exactly what we wanted. As soon as we were ready to go out Seda gave us a map and suggested places to go - she was especially helpful in suggesting when to do things (we wanted to go on a trip down the Bosphorus and Seda explained it would be better to do it before the weekend as it would get busier then). The hotel is literally 2 minutes away from the covered baazar, with the tram station at Beyazit opposite, which is fantastic as you are right in the thick of the old Istanbul places of interest. Sultanahmet (the Blue Mosque) is two stops down on the tram (it costs 1.30TYL) but is also a very easy 10 minute walk away. That evening we were pretty tired so we spent part of the night drinking on the panoramic roofed terrace. It has beautiful views over the Marmara Sea and the service was faultless. The next morning we has breakfast on the same terrace - its a briliant way to wake up with the sun and view and the carrot cake was especially yummy. Breakfast is all healthy - fruit, museli, cheese and veal salami, and home made cakes that were brilliant (did I mention the carrot cake?). In a nut shell I'm not sure you could find better in this area. It is excellent value for money, clean and the friendliest staff you could ask for. We celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary while we were there, and it was an incredibly special experience. If we return to Istanbul there is no question in our minds where we'd stay. Directions: (to avoid being riped off by a taxi driver!) Head for the Grand Baazar, main entrance opposite the Beyazit tram station. With your back to the baazar cross the road and turn right. Take the 2nd left down a back street (its a steep hill). Walk 100m down the hill and its on your left.

Reviews.Title: “A delÄ±ghtful stay”
Reviews.Author: Neatravels
Reviews.Content: After readÄ±ng other revÄ±ews on TrÄ±p AdvÄ±sor we Ä±nstantly decÄ±ded to lock Ä±n 2 days at Hotel Niles. Upon arrival the warm and friendly greetÄ±ng was outstanding. We felt at home and were iÄ±mmediÄ±ately comfortable Ä±n our surroundÄ±ngs. So much so that we booked an extra 2 nÄ±ghts! Staff couldnt be more helpful, room comfortable and good value for money Ä±n the price range. Roof top terrace Ä±s a breath of fresh aÄ±r for a small buffet breakfast. Free iÄ±nternet was a bonus. AnythÄ±ng you requÄ±re was never too much trouble for the frÄ±endly front desk staff. Rooms are clean and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “An Old City gem”
Reviews.Author: BigVarn
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Istanbul for my cousin's wedding (1wk, mid-July 07) and after reseaching hotels on this site took the plunge with the Niles. Its location is very good for the Old City and it's close to the tram (a short walk from Beyazit). The poorer features of the hotel are: i) Compact rooms & bathrooms ii) Size of TV and selection of channels in English (basically MTV equivalent and news - I never want to see Rhianna's "Umbrella-ella-ella video again) But the hotel is in the Old City and space is at a premium. Also, who goes on holiday to watch TV all day? The Aya Sofia is 100s of years older than St Paul's - get out there! Now that those tiny issues are out of the way, let's get to the reasons why you should stay here. i) The free breakfast was basic, but excellent (and buffet-style). Salad stuff; haloumi, regular cheese, sliced processed meat; bread; omlette; melon & watermelon; coffee & cake. ii) The hotel staff really are the friendliest we have ever encountered. Seriously. iii) The rooms may be compact, but they are clean and the air conditioning works - a must during Istanbul's summer! iv) Seda on the front desk has her team well trained and all of them were happy to help us with the smallest detail or request or chat away if it wasn't busy. They also gave us an excellent orientation at the start. v) One of the biggest things for us was that when we put a "do not disturb" sign on the door, we weren't disturbed! Now, I've stayed at a fair few hotels in my time and this is literally the first time that this has happened. We were overjoyed at this simple respect shown to guests! So, there's my review. If you want a fancy hotel then get rid of any idea of a budget, stay in Taksim and get taxis everywhere. If you're realistic about a reasonably-priced Old City hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff, then stay at the Niles. It's as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenandar
Reviews.Content: We have just spent the past three weeks re-exploring Istanbul and Turkey, after living there four years earlier. During all of our time in Turkey, we have stayed in dozens of Turkish hotels. The Niles Hotel definitely was one of our favorites. In particular, the entire staff is friendly and service oriented and they do everything possible to ensure a pleasant stay. It is very clean, has an above average breakfast buffet, a very convenient location for shopoholics and is very clean. We both recommend (at the risk of it becoming so popular that we may not be able to get a future reservation) the Niles Hotel without reservation. Ken and Darlene Bobrosky

Reviews.Title: “friendly budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerrySF
Reviews.Content: I agree with the comments made by uncletony from Scotland and I'll add to them. Room ammenities were on the nicer side of average by European standards, with fluffy towels and a larger than average shower. Location is excellent - near the things you want to see, but far enough away to be in a quieter area filled with locals. The front desk staff were indeed the best part. They made sure to ask about our plans for the day and give very helpful advice. Free use of the PC with internet was helpful too. My room was on the 2nd floor and would have been quiet if not for the 3 drunken couples who were staying in the other rooms on the floor. No noise at all from the rooms above. Overall, a very good budget hotel with staff who really seem to enjoy helping you.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made a good holiday great!”
Reviews.Author: uncletony
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple-bedded room for our stay in early July. We were given Room 503 which was perfectly CLEAN and comfortable, a nice bright bathroom with plenty of soap/shampoo and fluffy towels. The room has good airconditioner and a small TV with many channels (incl BBC). We did not see one bug, fly, mosquito or cockroach during our stay! The hotel is in the garment/fabric area of the city and is quiet at night but busy during the day. Some of the narrow cobbled streets are being reconstructed which gives the area a bit of a run-down appearance, but it'll be nice once the work is done. The main street leading to the major tourist attractions is just a couple of minutes walk away. The rooftop terrace is an oasis of peace. The wholesome buffet breakfast is served here, and it is a perfect place to watch the sunset with a G&T! We have travelled to many places in the world, but nowhere have we met hotel staff who go out of their way to ensure guests enjoy their stay not only in the hotel, but in the city too. They are only too happy to give hints and tips on how to get to places, book a tour, etc. Make sure you take them up on the offer of a car to pick you up at the airport on arrival - saves a lot of hassle. An example of their dedication was in the confirmation email to me when a copy of the room floor plan was attached to make me aware that we may find the room a bit cramped. They obviously wanted us to have a good stay. This hotel played a fundamental part of making our short trip to Istanbul a memorable and enjoyable occassion. Thank you to everyone at the Niles for making us so welcome. uncletony, Aberdeen, Scotland, UK

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles Is Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: alaska1968
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an extensive stay at the Hotel Niles (pronounced Neeless) and are happy to add our comments to the long list of great reviews. My daughter and I stayed at the Niles from June 7 - June 26 - we currently hold the record for longest stay! My daughter was a Rotary Exchange student in Istanbul for a year in 2005-2006, so this was our last mom-daughter trip before she leaves for college. It's hard to be original after all the other reviews, but we can certainly reaffirm that the Niles is a great choice for location, cleanliness, friendliness and price. I call it an Oasis because after all the sensory overload of Istanbul, it was wonderful to retreat back to the Niles for a serene escape from the noise, traffic and crowds of a large, active city. The staff is exceptional and will do everything within their power to make your stay comfortable. If you have issues with firm beds, noise or anything else, then ask Seda about the options - they will likely have a solution or recommendation. If you are a light sleeper, as I am, I always travel with my own earplugs to dampen the sounds that come with staying in the heart of a city. The terrace is wonderful and has classical music or light jazz going to add to the atmosphere. It was my favorite place to hang out during the day or evening. The breakfast buffet is delightful and often had special items to add to the selection. Turkish breakfast is pretty consistent - you can expect tomatoes, cheeses, eggs, olives and yogurt, but the Niles offers more than the normal spread. The rooms are small by Western standards, but cleanliness tops size in my book. The room was bright, tasteful and comfortable - with working air conditioning! We felt safe, too. We made good use of the refrigerator by stocking with water from the grocer on the corner. Kemal and his father Osman are very nice, too. The Hotel is in the garment district which is great for clothing, shoe and purse shoppers, but you should also realize that you are in a business district - the grates go up in the morning as people prepare their shops. But you are also very close to the Tram and bus stops, 5 minute walk to Grand Bazaar (which is great sport!) and 10 - 15 minutes to all "must-sees" in Sultanahmet. There are no carpet sellers in the immediate area - which is a nice break, but you should also be prepared to be solicited by nearly every store and restaurant you walk past - it's part of the retail culture there. Usually a smile and a no thanks will do - some are more persistent than others. I could go on and on, but that would be beyond the review for this hotel! Overall, we loved our experience. It is clear that the management is striving to create a professional and classy environment without the high prices and the pretension. We certainly got great value for the budget we wanted to spend on lodging. More than that, we met the wonderful people that make up the staff at the NIles. XOX from the Alaskans! I'm happy to provide additional comments to anyone serious about staying here. We also did a quick trip to Ephesus (including a tour to Didyma, Miletus, Priene) via roundtrip overnight bus ride (wouldn't do that again) and stayed in Kusadasi. Best of luck planning your trip - Istanbul is truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: SUMMERTRAVEL2007
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in Turkey, where we stayed at Hotel Niles for five nights. What a great hotel! It had everything you could want-- nice, clean rooms, wonderful location, incredible staff, delicious breakfast, and free internet. They also had a television with english channels, which was nice to come back to. I can't say enough about the staff. They were so incredibly helpful and cheerful. Every time we walked in the door, they stood up to greet us and ask how our day was. I just loved this hotel, and I would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Karisteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on the strength of other Trip Advisor reviews and can definitely recommend it. The location is excellent, only 200 metres from the Grand Bazaar and the main tram line through Sultanhamet, down to the Bosphorus. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff are lovely; friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Owned by the same company that owns the much more expensive Deserdaat!

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: JayD2006
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a family owned hotel. I can't add more about the quality of the service provided and already mentioned by the previous reviews. The manager, Seda, Sami, Mezut and the rest of the staff were all great, always ready to help with the smile. It's a small hotel well located in Beyazit district very close to Tram and the major attractions. It's not a luxury hotel but EXTREMLY clean. Yes that's true you hear some noise in the hallway especialy if you're close to the elevator but what you can do, it's human issue especially because of those coming drunk late at night. Anyway if you're looking for a nice, clean, well located and most of all great service and value, this is the one. Also no need to hire a guide in Istanbul.
