Just when you decide to go somewhere talk to anyone at the recepetion especially Seda, she will give an extremly detailed itinerary with routes, timing, prices and all the tips to make it easy for you. Again I've been to many hotels around the world and never had such an outstanding customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a better place than most tourist hotels”
Reviews.Author: oulous
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a solid small hotel. The best thing about it was the location. I am never fond of being in the middle of tourist areas and instead prefer to be in a real neighborhood. This hotel is a short easy walk along a main street to the main tourist sights. I suggest you make an inquiry as to the condition of the street around the hotel. Turks like to work on their streets from midnight to 5 AM and this can wreak havoc on your sleep as its very loud. The woman who works during the day goes above and beyond normal customer service to make sure you figure everything out. My only criticism is the wireless. Ask to be moved if they book you in a room on what I believe is the north side of the hotel as the wireless will not work in your room. If my orientation is wrong then its the room furthest away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: ejaves
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, nice lobby, GREAT location, nice but small rooms, very nice rooftop cafe and good breakfast. Only problem we had was the noise level. A few nights there was road construction outside, which was not the hotel's fault, but apart from that there was still quite a bit of noise just from room doors opening/shutting, etc. We would have suggested investing int some carpet or sealing the doors better to help cut down on some of this. Other than that, great place to stay and would definitely stay there again. Also, the kebap shop next door is cheap and good food!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles means the best of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TexasTurkey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Hotel Niles. The hotel is small and intimate and we have never experienced such warm and hospitable service before. We loved our weeks tour of Istanbul, but it would not have been as memorable if we had not stayed at Hotel Niles. We stayed in a clearly adequate room that was very economical, clean and secure. We ate a lovely complimentary continental spread for breakfast each day with cheeses, fruit, pastries, hard boiled eggs and omelet, yogurt and cereals etc. What makes this hotel so out standing is not the building or the fixtures but the staff. It is run by a small family staff and each is dedicated to the well being of it guests. Seda welcomed us with a guide conversation of our stay. She covered everything a first time visitor to Istanbul might want: advice on where to eat, how to get around without a car, what we should not miss (marking a map of Istanbul with routes, and locations). The Hotel is not in a very pretty part of the city. It is crowded; the streets are narrow; the neighbors are hand labor shops and small stores for the most part. But, the location is very convenient in the heart of the city relatively close to the major downtown attractions of Istanbul and Seda showed us how to get around without taxi or car, by walking short secure routes using the Tram for most city attractions. Seda was available almost every day to answer our questions and make suggestions. The rest of the staff was very helpful as well. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel staff we have ever encountered on holiday. Perhaps not the most luxurious hotel but, it was newly remodeled, clean, economical and comfortable and the staff made it so that we want to come again to Istanbul and stay at the Hotel Niles.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveMcCammon
Reviews.Content: Just returned to USA from Turkey. Spent 2.5 weeks there and from 23-29 Uune in Istanbul at this hotel. Simply stated, our review of the stay here is the same as others. It was just great and a great value. Seda and the staff really were fantistic. They were so helpful and when we had trouble with our AC they immediately moved us without question and in fact at their insistence. The breakfast on the roof overlooking the city is a great way to start the day. The rooms are just fine but do not expect fancy. The hotel is easy walking distance to just about everything. The only negative is not real close to restaurants but only 6 blocks or so away there are many. My wife and I travel quite a bit on business and use to live in Scotland. For us, Istanbul is at the top for places to visit and for that matter Turkey as a whole. If you go to Istanbul, you really need at least 3 full days to see it. We had 5 full days and were on the go quite a bit. Again, great hotel for value, location, and staff. A couple of unique things about Turkey and Istanbul - dress conservatively men and women, sellers can be very persistent in their efforts but we figured ways to deal with it (Spice Market especially persistent), Istanbul is easy to walk and follow the map but very few street signs, use the car service Seda can set up and not airport taxi, they really do appreciate your efforts to speak some key Turkish words, very friendly people. Favorite restauirants for us (and walking distance to hotel) - Mozaic Cafe, Cozy Terrace (view from roof is fantastic). Try and go to Galata Twoer and Taksin Square and you'll see a very European city and that was interesting. Agree about the do not miss but also do not miss the Basicalla Cistern.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: PixNZ
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here from 31 May & found it a pleasant place to stay - clean & comfortable & approx 10-15mins walk to the Blue Mosque. Tram stop is very handy & it's a great way to get around. The hotel staff are all very helpful & speak good English. I had been on an Insight tour for 12 days, staying 4-5* hotels & I have to say the most comfortable bed I had in all Turkey was at Hotel Niles! Also the best selection of English TV channels & an air conditioning system that I could operate as well!! Small but perfectly adequate bathroom with very good shower. Excellent breakfast served each morning & I really enjoyed sitting out on the rooftop terrace. The hotel is situated in quite an interesting area, surrounded by clothing & leather outlets & the little narrow streets are humming with activity during the day. As a solo woman traveller I did not feel at all unsafe in this area. I would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Niles & consider it great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and new!”
Reviews.Author: vars
Reviews.Content: We loved our one-night stay at Hotel Niles. Our hotel room was brand new and spotless and included a little plasma tv. The staff were nice and helpful. It was a good idea to get picked up from the airport as we arrived at night and would have difficulty finding the place in the dark, especially since they are tearing up the road in front of the hotel. Breakfast was included. Only 58 euros for our room. Highly recommend it if you like modern hotels. A few blocks from the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cecilCanaan_Ny
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent five days and four nights in Istanbul in the first part of June. We were very impressed with the courteous and helpful staff as well as the cleanliness of the hotel. We were looking for an authentic stay in Istanbul and were looking for a small locally run hotel that was centrally located and well-maintained. The Hotel Niles surpassed all of our criteria and made our visit to Istanbul very pleasant. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting in Istanbul. Celeen Lawrence New York, USA

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Niles is an absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: aewdc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Niles, along with three family members. We had two rooms and stayed for 10 days. I have to say that the service we received from this hotel was top notch. Seda, who works the front desk most days of the week, speaks very good English and is incredibly helpful. She had excellent suggestions on places to go and things to see, and knows the ins and out of the city so well. She explained things you wouldn't always think of -- whether to take the red bus or the green bus, how to buy access to the tram, etc. She was such a fantastic host. The wait staff (all of whom function as bellboys and handymen, too!) were so nice and remembered what everyone liked. The rooftop deck is very nice, although it can get a bit hot in the middle of the day if you're there in the summer. Part of it is indoors and part outdoors. Breakfast is served there each morning -- breakfast consisted of some pre-made omelets, homemade breads (made by Seda's mom!), hardboiled eggs, some meats and cheeses, cereal, and a few other items. It was quite good. We often hung out there at night, too, for an after dinner drink or two. The first room we had was one with two twin beds. It was on the smaller side, a European type room, but it had a closet and a standup shower, as well as a small tv that got English BBC and CNN. The second room had one queen bed and it had a sitting area that was a bit larger, with a similar bathroom. The rooms are very clean, with a remote-controlled air conditioning unit that works very well. The beds are definitely very firm, so if you like a softer bed this might not be the hotel for you. Overall, I'd HIGHLY recommend the Hotel Niles. The people who run the hotel are wonderful, it's close to many sites and it's very clean and pleasant in the rooms. If you stay at this hotel, I highly recommend a restaurant called "Sar". It's at Gedikpaqa Cad. No:43, very close to the hotel. The restaurant has great meze (try the white beans!) and good kebap, and it's pretty inexpensive with great, fun service. Another good restaurant is "Sahil" in the Komkapi area -- it's a fish restaurant and has good food and really fun people running the restaurant. I have lots of more Turkey thoughts so please feel free to email me if you want some suggestions or ideas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly and well-run”
Reviews.Author: jktravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Niles in early June 2007 and are glad to report that the high ratings it receives are accurate. The staff was very warm and professional, the room was clean and comfortable, and breakfast on the rooftop with the amazing view was fantastic. We especially liked that fact that we were close to the sites of Sultanahmet -- just a 10-15 minute walk away -- and yet not directly in that neighborhood. We found it more interesting to stay in the Beyazit area around the Hotel Niles and away from the more touristy areas. And yes, we did hear the calls to prayer from the mosques in the area, but were not at all bothered by them. On the contrary, we found them interesting as part of the fabric of the neighborhood and of Istanbul. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good breakfasts, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: kernac
Reviews.Content: My daughter and stayed here for one night before travelling on throughout other parts of Turkey. The staff was very helpful and warm--however, when we paid in cash, the exchange rate they gave was much different than the bank/exchange shop rates (and, to their advantage). Even though we tried to insist on having the present daily rate, they were adamant about the weaker rate, so we lost money on that one. The room was very small, but adequate. The rooftop garden was lovely, but all rooftops in the older area of Sultanehmet show ancient, decaying sights. Because we were very near a mosque, we were blasted out by the call to prayer at 5:00 am and in the evening. The location is convenient to many well-known sights, but is busy with traffic. We would stay in another place if we were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AnEnglishmanInGreece
Reviews.Content: Finding the Niles Hotel was a happy chance. Their sister hotel in the more touristic Sultan Ahmet region was full. We were not disappointed. Quite the reverse. We had an excellent stay. Although difficulties at the airport delayed our arrival, we were met by our pre-arranged taxi (very reasonably priced). In half an hour we were being warmly welcomed by Seda - one of the most impressive receptionists I have had the pleasure to come across. Our room was simple, but it was comfortable, very clean with a more than adequate shower-room and a (free) safe. Although deep in the Istanbul rag-trade district, the street was very quiet at night. The aircon worked well and our four nights at the Niles were restful. Upstairs, on the roof garden, the service was impeccable, with free tea, coffee and juice and swift service for other essentials, like beer. The fresh orange juice was . . . just perfect. Breakfast was well organised and although busy, the food was plentiful and there always seemed to be a table. The view of the Sea of Marmara was a joy and the street scenes from this rooftop endlessly fascinating. The hotel is usefully about 4 minutes from a tram stop. On the road with the trams, follow in the direction of Sultan Ahmet for about 100 metres and turn right down a pedestrianised shopping street. Here you will find the Sar restaurant. This is perfect for a quick salad lunch or more substantial kebabs. (Wine and beer served with a smile!) If you wish for shoes, handbags, leather jackets or briefcases, this is the area to shop. We found Santana to be excellent (1 minute from Niles Hotel). Seda provided valuable guidance about how to get around and booked us into two excellent restaurants (Rami and also Hamdi Et Lokantasi) with brilliant views. In its range, this is as good an hotel as I have stayed at. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful Front of House Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: GMan2478
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (well my girlfriend to be honest) found this fantastic hidden gem on Tripadvisor. We booked on the Hotel Niles website and arranged to be picked up at the airport. All went without a hitch. When we arrived it was quite late so we couldn't go out to eat, luckily the guy on reception said that they don't normally do room service but can prepare anything as long as it's a sandwich! Great! Seda the manager showed us a great route for our time in Istanbul. The hotel is so convenient for Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Cisterns. All of which are within a 10 min walk of each other. The hotel to these sites are a casual 15 min stroll away. (right out of the hotel and then right at the main road and follow it down!) All in all I've not come across a more accomodating and generally friendly staff than at the Hotel Niles. Hotel was clean and well kept. Breakfast was included. Generally a fantastic stay. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a good hotel close to Istanbul's top sights.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: TwoLs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Niles for four nights. It is a small,very tidy hotel in a good location but can be a little hard to find. However the staff were outstanding, going out of their way to help - and without the additional charges so many other hotels apply. A lot of hotels could learn from them. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roof Terrace, Location, and VERY Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Darryl_London
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul today and I had to write a review on the Niles Hotel. I learned about the hotel off Trip Advisor (First time I have used the site). Booked the hotel via Expedia. The pictures do not do this hotel justice. Hotel was just remodeled 8 months ago. The roof terrace at the top of the hotel (breakfast is included in the price!) is fantastic. Location is very close to the Grand Bazaar, 15 min walk / 5 min light rail ride to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. I enjoyed Istanbul and when I come back I will definetly stay at the Niles Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd thoroughly recomend it!”
Reviews.Author: ECPLondon_England
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Niles for a half term break with my teacher mates. It was so lovely there. The rooms were very comfortable and extremely clean - new towels everyday. The rooftop terrace was perfect for a late evening drink - no food but you can order food from next door and they'll serve it to you on the roof! The location is excellent. We walked everywhere from there pretty much. The Grand Bazaar is only a ten minute walk away - not so good if you don't want to spend all your money!! Really, one of the best things about the place was the people who work there. Seda, who is the main receptionist was so helpful and kind. She really made the experience excellent!! If I ever go back to Istanbu, and I would really like to, I will definitely stay at this place. It felt really safe and relaxing. A great base to explore the city from!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: OLNotts
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Hotel Niles is excellent value for money. In terms of cleanliness it's spotless, with a lovely terrace bar on the roof over looking the Bosphorous. The staff very friendly and helpful, happy to answer any questions. In terms of location, it is in easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and about 5/10 mins walk from the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sofia. Beware of taxis as they try and rip you off. We found the tram the easiest way to get around the city with a single fare costing approx 50 pence. The Oâ€™Learys, Nottingham, UK

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous break!”
Reviews.Author: blondannie
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 5 fantastic days at the Hotel Niles. The hotel is superb, the roof terrace and its views over the sea wonderful and the breakfast excellent. The staff could not be more friendly and went out of their way to ensure a pleasant stay. Seda, the receptionist is incredibly helpful and friendly and always ready to help and answer any questions the traveller may have. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly hope to come back. The prices are very reasonable, I shared a twin room with my friend and we paid about Â£90 each for 4 nights, my daughter had a single room and paid about Â£120, definitely good value for money. The rooms were light and airy, good air con and nice hot showers. It takes about 5 minutes to walk to the grand Bazaar and about 15 minutes to the Blue Mosque or for about 55p you can get a tram from the top of the road to all the main attractions. Plenty of superb restaurants all within walking distance too. Altogether an excellent short break.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customers at Hotel Niles”
Reviews.Author: HeidiHiLondon
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from 4 nights in Istanbul we would happily recommend this hotel to anyone else looking for a well-priced, well located hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and 15 mins tops from the Blue Mosque/Aya Sofia etc. It is also near the main tram line running down to Sultanahmet and on to the ferry ports, if you don't fancy walking . The ensuite bathrooms were immaculately clean, the shower was excellent and towels were replaced every couple of days even without us requesting that they be changed. The staff - especially Seda who manages the front desk - were warm and friendly and very helpful and made our stay even more enjoyable. The rooftop terrace is a lovely place to sit and eat breakfast or to unwind after a day of sightseeing. We would also recommend Izmir Restaurant, a small family owned restaurant a few mins walk from the hotel if heading down the main road towards Sultanahmet, on the right hand side. (The street ii is on is called Divani Ali Sok I think). It is not anything flash, but we ate there a few times, purely for convenience, and by the third time were being treated like old friends more than customers. Truly Turkish people are very welcoming and friendly!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Niles Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Dibekli Cami Sokak No:19 | Beyazit (Old City/Grand Bazaar District), Istanbul 34400, Turkey
